loans.name: Mutunga

texts.en:
Mutunga is a married man with six school-going children. His wife is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children. 

Mutunga has operated a charcoal selling business for the past six years. In addition he also sells maize. His potential clients are the local area brokers. He faces a major challenge of transportation. He dreams of buying a motorcycle for easy transport.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and maize for resale. He decided to join Yehu because of the easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal and maize for resale.

loans.name: Seut

texts.en:
Seut (in the photo with her loom) is 38 years old, and her husband, Pon, is 40 years old. They live in a village across Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have six children - four sons and two daughters. Five are in school and the other one is still young.  

Seut and her husband are weavers. Besides weaving, they also grow rice. Seut is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm. She will also use a part of the loan to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm and to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es: María, nuevamente necesita un crédito, porque en esta época D. poca lluvia, aprovechara D. sembrar plantas y comprara: plantas frutales, ornamentales macetas, abono orgánico y químico, a si podrá tener más variedad para ofrecerles a los clientes. Los anteriores prestamos le ayudaron mucho pues le genero más ganancias y pago varias deudas y le permitió mejorar las condiciones del vivero.
texts.en: María needs a loan again. Since this is the rainy season, she will take advantage of the planting season and buy: fruit plants, ornamental pots, and organic and chemical fertilizer. In this way, she will have more variety to offer her customers. The previous loans helped her a lot and generated a lot of income for her. She paid off several loans that allowed her to improve the conditions of her green house.

loans.use: to buy fruit plants, ornamental pots, and organic and chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 34 year old business woman, who lives in Juba. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 11 and 4.  Two of them go to school. 

Victoria runs a food store, and has been in the business for 6 years. She has 1 employee. Victoria heard about Finance Sudan through other clients.Victoria is taking a loan of 3,000 SDG to purchase more items like sorghum, maize, dried cassava, and millet. Aside from this business, Victoria has no other source of income. 

In 5 years time, Victoria would like to change her corrugated iron shop for a concrete building.  

Her major challenges include expensive schools in Juba for the children. Victoria says that, the loan will help her to build corrugated iron house for their accommodation.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sorghum, maize, dried cassava, and millet.

loans.name: Vilma Flora

texts.es:
La socia Vilma Flora se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de manjares y yogurt,ella trabaja en forma independiente llevando a diferentes lugares,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de manjares y yogures.La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos para hacer yogures como leche,azucar y mantequilla al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Vilma Flora continues to work in her business selling caramelized milk products and yogurt. She works independently, taking her products to various places. She works from 8:00 a.m to 6:00 p.m. Through this business, the borrower is helping her children get ahead in life. She would like to expand and improve her business selling milk-based sweets and yogurt. The borrower is requesting the loan to buy ingredients to make her products, such as milk, sugar and butter, on a wholesale basis. 

The borrower is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make milk-based sweets and yogurt, such as milk, sugar and butter, on a wholesale basis.

loans.name: Mixtalia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mixtalía, se dedica a la venta de tostadas de plátano y yuca, vive con su familia, sus hijos y su esposo, ella inició con este negocio por iniciativa propia no tiene un horario fijo y hasta la fecha no ha tenido problemas ni inconvenientes con el negocio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar plátanos, yuca, aceite, bolsas para el negocio,esta compra le permitirá tener los materiales necesarios para hacer la venta, dándole la oportunidad de continuar en el negocio y generar ingresos. Mixtalia aspira tener un negocio grande, más fortalecido para que las condiciones de vida de sus hijos sean más confortables.
texts.en:
Mixtalía sells yucca and plantain tostadas, lives with her family; her children and husband, and began this business through her own initiative.  She doesn’t have a set schedule and until now has not had problems nor inconveniences with the business.

She’s asking for this loan to buy plantains, yucca, cooking oil, and bags for her business.  This purchase will allow her to have the materials she needs for her sales, giving her the opportunity to continue her business and generate income.  Mixtalía aspires to have a large, stronger business so that she can provide a more comfortable life for her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is a widow and has six dependents. Adwoa is a palm oil extractor. She has been in this business for fifteen years. She uses her income to pay her children’s school fees. 

Adwoa will use her loan to purchase more palm fruit for her oil. With the new profit, Adwoa will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit for her oil.

loans.name: Rodilyn

texts.en:
Rodilyn is 52 years old, and married with six children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19500 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  Rodilyn has been farming rice for 20 years, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch, 42, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fish for over ten years and is successful in her career. Her husband is a sub leader in the village. One of her children is a driver. Selling fish is the main source of income in the family. Therefore, in order to improve her family finances, Touch is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike to use in her business for transporting fish to sell at the market. By doing so, she would easily transport her fish to sell and generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business by a large amount. In addition, she plans to build a kitchen and support her youngest child to study at a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to use in her business for transporting fish to sell at the market

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is a single parent and has two children. She sells African print cloth and fabrics at Elmina, which she has done for some years. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children, and pay their school fees. Comfort will use her loan to purchase more African print cloth and fabrics to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more African print cloth and fabrics to sell

loans.name: Fifonsi Nathalie

texts.fr: Fifonsi Nathalie âgée de 39 ans n’a pas fréquentée l’école mais a appris, activité qu’elle exerce depuis douze. Fifonsi Nathalie est célibataire et vit seule. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportée par elle. Pour cette raison, Fifonsi Nathalie vend également des tissus par la technique de distribution ; cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir à ses besoins. Fifonsi Nathalie achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Fifonsi Nathalie  pour une quatrième fois sollicite, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Mrs. Martha U. is a business woman who specializes in the sales of baby things. She is happily married with seven (7) children. She needs the above amount for her business improvement.

loans.use: To buy more baby things for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to purchase a hybrid dairy cow

loans.name: Soum

texts.en: Soum R. is 29 years old and is a mother of two children. She lives with her husband in Preyveng, Cambodia. She and her husband sell a variety of vegetables at the nearby market and typically make around $8/day in revenue. R. asks for $1000 loan fund to purchase more vegetables in response to a great demand of her clients.  In the future, she wants to become a wholesaler who makes more income from this kind of business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for a business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ann would like to buy 2 steers

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
Location: Chamissava area - Catembe
Client: António D. Conceição
Activity: Retail
Loan amount: 13,000 Mozambique Meticais (MT) (US$ 520.00)
Use: Purchase products for resale
Start date: 08/06/2007
End date: 11/28/2008

António D. Conceição was born in Maputo in 1974 and attended school only until the 9th grade as his parents were not capable of paying for his school. He married young, and at the age of 18 he was faced with the need to obtain employment to support his studies and his family. He found a job as a mechanic's assistant.

He currently has 3 children and lives with his wife of 14 years. The mechanic shop was not a sufficient source of income, so he had to start his own business as a way to better provide for his family.

He currently operates out of a small rented commercial space where he carries out the sale of essential products. With the 13,000 MT loan ($520.00) he plans to increase his volume by acquiring a diverse range of essential products. He runs the business himself and has had a positive impact on the community by placing the product closer to the client, thereby shortening travel distances for the residents of his area while increasing his family's monthly income.

In the future he plans to develop his business further and become a successful merchant.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Chamissava - Catembe
Cliente: António D. Conceição
Actividade : Comércio
Valor de Empréstimo: 13,000.00mt (520.00US$)
Aplicação: compra de Produtos para revenD.
Início: 06/08/2007
Fim: 28/11/ 2008

António D. Conceição nascido em Maputo em 1974 , estudou até 9ªclasse porque os pais não tinham condições para custear com os seus estudos. Juntou se muito cedo e aos 18 anos sentiu se obrigado a a ter que arranjar emprego para suportar os seus estudos e para o sustento D. sua família, tendo começado trabalhado como ajudante de mecânica.

Tem actualmente 3 filhos e vive com com a sua esposa já a 14 anos.Dado que o serviço de mecânica não estava a render lhe o suficiente , teve que iniciar o seu próprio negócio de forma a incrementar a renD. familiar.

Actualmente opera num pequeno estabelecimento comercial arrendaD. onde desenvolve a sua actividade comercial de venD. de produtos D. primeira necessidade. Com o crédito de 13,000.00MT pretende incrementar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo diversa gama de produtos de 1 necessidade. Ele gere o negócio pessoalmente e a sua actividade tem um impacto positivo na comunidade pois coloca o produto mais perto do cliente incurtando deste modo a distância para os moradores D. sua zona , bem como aumenta a renD. mensal familiar.

Futuramente pretende desenvolver o seu negócio tornando se num grande comerciante.

loans.use: To increase stocks in his shop

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila belongs to the Communal Bank "Las Triunfadoras" of Callería District in ucayali State. She is 32 years old and single. She began the business of selling juanes and tamales with her mother, who taught her to work and business strategies, so that in the future she could own and manage her own business. (Juanes are an Amazonian dish, consisting of rice, chicken, black olives, and eggs all wrapped tightly in a large leaf from the jungle.) Upon receiving her first loan of 300 soles in 1992, she decided to become independent and she started her own business selling Juanes and tamales in the market.

With the current loan from Manuela Ramos for 1300 soles (approximately US$433), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will be able to buy the ingredients to prepare the juanes and tamales (100-150 prepared daily) and she will pay the personnel who support her, as today the demand on her business is great.

Zoila is happy because she feels she is a capable woman and accomplished personally and in business, and in the future is planning to install a soda fountain and be able to employ additional people.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Zoila pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras” del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 32 años y es soltera, inició el negocio de venta de juanes y tamales junto a su mamá, quien le enseñó a trabajar y a conocer las estrategias del mismo, para que a futuro ella tenga el manejo y la administración de su propio negocio, ya en el año 1992 Zoila al recibir el primer préstamo que recibió de S/ 300 soles decidió independizarse, instaló su propio negocio de venta de Juanes y tamales en un mercado.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,300.00 (US$ 433.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, podrá comprar los ingredientes para la preparación de los juanes y tamales (100-150 diarios) y pagará al personal que la apoya, ya que en la actualidad la demanda que tiene en su negocio es mayor.

Zoila esta contenta porque se siente una mujer capaz y desarrollada tanto en lo personal como en lo económico, y a futuro esta proyectandose en poner una fuente de soda y así también podrá dar trabajo a otras personas.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make juanes and tamales

loans.name: Matrida

texts.en:
In the rural town of Tanita, Matrida L. (commonly and affectionately known as Mama L.) sells milk, vegetables and soap. The vegetables were a new addition in 2006 but it is her original milk-selling business, established in 2001, into which Mama L. wants to inject some new capital. She wants to revitalise the business by increasing her stock and purchasing a wider range of types and brands.

Mama L. is married to husband Felix and has three children, Franki, 18, Godwini, 17, and Dicsoni, 15. She hopes to increase her profits so that she can continue to support her family.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback arrangement as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are therefore termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of milk for her stall

loans.name: Ni Komang

texts.id:
Ni Komang N., 36 year old, trades local commodities like bananas, coconuts and coconut leaves. She has been in the business for a year. Ni Komang travels from one village to another with her motorcycle to buy commodities from local farmers to be resold to wholesaler. At this time, the demand for commodities are significant, especially around Hindu holidays. Those commodities are sold in Denpasar by wholesalers to vendors in local markets. Because of lack of funding, Ni Komang N. often cannot fulfill all orders. WIth a loan of $560, Ni Komang N. should be able to buy more inventories to fulfill all orders. She wants to serve the farmers whom she buys her products from better. Ni Komang always pays cash to the farmers so she earns their trust and prefers to do business with her. In every transactions, Ni Komang N. can reap $11 profit. That earnings can support her familyś needs and she could also save significantly for her familyś future.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Ni Komang N., 36 tahun, mempunyai usaha jual beli hasil bumi yang berupa pisang, kelapa yang dikupas dan daun kelapa muda. Usaha ini sudah ditekuninya sejak dua tahun yang lalu. Dengan sepeda motor yang dimilikinya, Ni Komang N. berkeliling dari satu desa ke desa yang lain untuk mencari dagangan yang nantinya akan dijual kembali kepada pedagang besar. Saat ini kebutuhan akan hasil bumi sangat besar terutama menjelang hari raya umay Hindu. Semua hasil bumi itu akan dijual ke Denpasar oleh pedagang besar. Karena kekurangan modal, seringkali Ni Komang N. tidak bisa memenuhi pesanan. Dengan pinjaman sebesar Rp. 5.000.000.- , Ni Komang N. bisa membeli hasil bumi dengan jumlah yang cukup lumayan sehingga pesanan akan terpenuhi. Yang paling penting bagi Ni Komang N. adalah pelayanannya kepada petani yang dibeli hasil buminya. Ni Komang N. selalu membayar langsung kepada petani saat membeli dagangannya sehingga petani pun akan merasa puas dan akan kembali menjual kepadanya. Setiap transaksi, Ni Koman N. bisa mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp. 100.000.- Penghasilan itu bisa untuk mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya, untuk modal usaha dan disisihkan untuk ditabung.

loans.use: Increase Inventory

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia has been a member of the community bank “8th of September” for 18 months.  She is from the district of Acosvinchos, which is one hour from the city of Ayacucho.
Sonia is 32 years old, and by profession she is a nurse.  She makes andean shingles, which are used on most of the roofs in the area.  She learned this profession from her parents.  Sonia mentioned that in the past she was able to produce very little, but with loans from the community bank she is able to produce much more.  She sells her products in her native town to people who then transport them to other villages in the area.
In addition, Sonia works as a nurse in the city of Cangallo.  While she is working as a nurse her sister helps with the tile business.
Sonia needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy wood and pay laborers.  
One of the key aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate receives.  Sonia plans to use her savings to build a home, and to start a new business selling food staples such as flour, rice, and sugar.  Her dream is to continue studying and specialize in anesthesiology and to have a successful business.

loans.use: Sonia needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy wood and pay laborers.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Three and a half years ago, Margarita ran the grocery store, with much dedication, which she managed from within her home. The idea to start up this business came from her desire to stand out and help her husband with the family income. At the start, she only sold fizzy drinks and any profit she made she invests back into the business to buy more products. During this time she had a dream to have a shop, but one with a larger selection of goods. Just two years ago, with the help of EDAPROSPO she can see the profits, although she still dreams about a shop. Margarita’s aim is to have a larger sale stand in a market, within a couple of years. But she knows that it will take at least a few years for her dream to become a reality. For the time being, she wants to extend the selection of goods for offer in her store. And she continues to support the education of her four children.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Hace tres años y medio que Margarita atiende con mucha dedicación en la bodega que maneja dentro de su casa. La idea de abrir este negocio nació con las ganas de sobresalir y apoyar a su esposo con el ingreso económico al hogar. En un inicio solo vendía gaseosas y lo que ganaba de ello lo volvía a invertir en comprar más productos. Durante un tiempo estuvo haciendo lo mismo, ya que su sueño era tener una tienda, pero una que bien surtida. Recién hace dos años y con la ayuda de EDAPROSPO puede ver ganancias de su trabajo, aunque una parte de ello lo sigue destinando a su tienda. El objetivo de Margarita dentro de unos años es tener un puesto de venta mayorista en un mercado. Pero sabe que aun le falta al menos unos años para poder empezar a realizar este sueño. Por ahora, quiere implementar su bodega con diversos artículos. Y seguir apoyando en la educación de sus cuatro hijos

loans.use: Increase the selection of products within her store

loans.name: Buena Ventura

texts.es:
Mr. T. is married to Mrs. Hamma Zalen, with whom he has one son. Buena Ventura owns a tire, paint, and auto body shop that he has been operating at his home since 2006. He has many customers, since his is the only tire shop in the area.

Both parents struggle on a daily basis to move forward, especially now that they have a son, because they want to offer him a better future. The loan being requested is for the purchase of a new air compressor, since the one he currently has is too old.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor esta casado con la señora Hamma Zalen con quien tiene un hijo. Buena Ventura tiene un negocio de gomeria, chapería y pintura en su domicilio particular desde el año 2006, y tiene mucha clientela, ya que es la única gomeria que hay en la zona.

Ambos luchan día a día para salir adelante y mas ahora que tienen su niño, pues desean darle el mejor porvenir. El crédito solicitado es para la compra de un compresor nuevo, ya que el que posee esta muy viejo.

loans.use: Purchase of new air compressor

loans.name: Deurn

texts.en:
The monsoon season is coming soon, so Mrs. Deurn Y. needs a loan to cultivate her rice field; thus, she has asked for a loan to buy cows to use as draft animals to plow her rice field. On the plantation, Mrs. Deurn Y. faced a drought last year and this year she hopes nature will give her a chance for doing a rice field.

Mrs. Deurn Y. lives in Trauk Leak Village in Kampong Speu province. She is 38 and married with a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband, Pheap Prum, is a farmer who always works with his wife on the rice field.

In May last year, Mrs. Deurn Y. got typhoid and the family faced unforeseen expenses. For this reason the family suffered an economic decline; thus, Mrs. Deurn Y. has now decided to request a loan to work on their rice plantation. Her husband and child are with Mrs. Deurn Y. in the photo.

loans.use: Buy cows to use as draft animals to plow her rice field

loans.name: Khaem

texts.en:
Khaem O. is 19 years old. Despite his young age, he already works and supports his parents. Khaem is an expert in computer services, for example, printing, scanning, lamination, and audio editing of video tapes and CDs with records of his clients' family events. Khaem has been in this business for already 2 years. He tries to use modern up-to-date technologies in his work to satisfy the demands and requirements of his customers. Currently, Khaem would like to purchase a new, modern computer in order to improve the quality of his work and to expand the business.
Therefore, he is requesting a loan of US$600 for a term of 12 months. This is his first loan, and Khaem is thankful to everyone for support. He promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase of a new computer to improve the quality of his work

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To replenish a mini-market.

loans.name: Salama's Neema Group

texts.en:
Salama is 44 years old. She is a married woman with 3 children aged 21, 19, and 12. She also takes care of 1 other person, aged 80 years old. She owns and runs a small shop. Every day, she works from 7am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 550 from her sales.

Salama now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with tailoring, clothes sales, and owning a milling machine.

loans.use: To buy more items to increase her inventory

loans.name: Cheveres Group

texts.en:
The Chéveres group bank is maD. up of 13 members who live in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. The group's president is Sra. Liliana P. A., who sells dry goods in the Saavedra market. 

The rest of the group is involved in a variety of occupations and businesses: Mercedes, Estela and Maribel are domestic employees; Abel is a contractor; Maricela runs her home; Santa sells dry goods; Marcela is a housekeeper; Ana Maria and Suleidy work as nannies; and Bernarda offers cleaning services.

This group is new, and is determined to get ahead with their respective businesses. Most of the group plans to use this loan to improve and expand their businesses for the good of their families and to be able to have a stable life. They are very grateful to AgroCapital for trusting them with this loan.

loans.use: Expand businesses

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo inició el negocio para ayudarse económicamente y a su esposa le gustan las ventas y conoce mucha gente. El quería tener su propio negocio aunque fuera pequeño aparte que se enfermo y eso le acarreo muchas deudas y se veía un poco presionado, entonces su esposa lo animo a que pusieran el negocio para sacar algunos ingresos extras. Comenzó aproximadamente hace 5 años vendiendo comidas pero hace apenas un año empezó a vender abarrotes y al parecer ha tenido buenos resultados por lo que piensa seguir invirtiendo cada vez mas para tener un buen surtido y así tener un negocio mas grande.

El necesita un préstamo por US $550 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Eduardo began his business to help himself economically and his wife enjoys sales and meeting people. He wanted to have his own business even though it would be small and when he became sick and accumulated many debts, he was under a bit of pressure, so his wife inspired him and they opened the business to generate some extra income. 5 years ago he began selling food but around one year ago he began to sell groceries and it appears he is having good results so he is thinking about continuing to invest in having a good stock of items and in this way expanding his business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for store

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom S. was born in1960, and she now lives in Sala Lek Pram Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a housewife who cooks very delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Seng Saroeurn, is a soldier who can make $50 per month, which is a small income to support his family. Because this family is building their house, which has not been completed yet, Mrs. Mom S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a front door. Mrs. Mom S. has three children, who are all attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a front door for her house under construction

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes B. is 33 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Her children are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Agnes has sold frozen foods in the local market to support her family.  She says demand for fish is high but she does not have enough capital to meet the demand. She wants to use the loan to buy more cartons of frozen foods, so she can earn enough income to support her children's education. She is a member of the group called Angels. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Namasuba H-Nansuna Aisha Group

texts.en:
It has been one year since Aisha N. ventured into the business of selling second-hand clothes in different markets around the city. She wakes up very early each Monday and Wednesday morning and heads to Owino Market in Kampala where she buys clothes from other traders. She gets a minimum profit of UGX 60,000 from weekly sales, which on many occasions she reinvests into the business to generate more income. She will use this loan to purchase dresses, skirts, blouses, trousers, and suits.

Hardworking Aisha aspires to open up a cosmetics shop. She was formerly a sales personnel in a kids wear shop in Kampala, and it is from her earnings that she put aside some savings as capital for the clothes business. Aisha is a married mother of four and also guardian to three of her late brother’s children. Her wish is to have an educated, healthy, and sustainable family.

loans.use: To purchase dresses, skirts, blouses, trousers, and suits to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is divorced and has one son. She sells women's clothing at the central market. She has been in this business for 15 years. Elena knows her business well. She has good prices and treats her clients well. She also helps her business neighbors to develop their businesses by giving good advice and personal support.

Elena is requesting a loan of $800 to increase winter inventories. She hopes to sell more goods and receive more profit to pay for her son's school tuition.

loans.use: to increase winter inventories

loans.name: Sokkhai

texts.en: Mrs. Sokkhai C. is a villager in Ba Chay village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Sam Oun, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. In their plantation, they face some problems because their field is infertile and has a lot of insects. In order to deal with these problems, Mrs. Sokkhai C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and use the rest of the money to buy pump supplies for water to support the field. She is 42 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are workers in different positions while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides, and to buy pump supplies for water to support the field.

loans.name: Sol Naciente De Paccha Group

texts.es:
El Banco Sol Naciente de Paccha es parte del proyecto Wari I, las socias son de la comunidad de Pacchacc, distrito de Vischongo, Provincia de Vilcashuaman, la comunidad se encuentra a una altitud de 3230 m.s.n.m. tiene aproximadamente 60 familias, la actividad económica mas primordial es la agricultura y también se dedican al comercio de animales y cereales.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como es el caso de Marlene que es casada, tiene 4 hijos, Marlene se dedica a la crianza de cuy y también la compra y venta de animales menores como el cuy, el préstamo que obtendrá será para aumentar su mercadería y comprar medicina para sus cuyes, los sueños de Marlene seguir trabajando para brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
Por otro lado Luisa es casada, tiene 6 hijos, Luisa tiene una tienda de abarrotes, Luisa es docente jubilada, tiene una hija que estudia para Cheff y es quien le genera mas gastos, Luisa espera que su hija culmine sus estudios e implementar un restaurante, el préstamo que obtendrá lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio.
Mientras que Carmen es casada, tiene 4 hijos, Carmen se dedica a la  venta de coca y también a la venta de pollos para crianza, con el préstamo que obtendrá comprara mas pollos y hoja de coca, los sueños de Carmen es que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Sol Naciente de Paccha Bank is part of the Wari I project. The partners are from a community in Pacchacc,in the Vischongo district of the Vilcashuaman province. The community is at an altitude of 3230 meters above sea level and has approximately 60 families. The basic economic activity is agriculture, including livestock and grains. The partners have various businesses. Marlene is married and has four children. She raises guinea pigs and also trades in other livestock. She'll use this loan to increase her merchandise and buy medicine for her guinea pigs. Marlene dreams of continuing to work in order to provide her children with a good education. Luisa is married and has four children. She is a retired teacher, and now owns a grocery store. One of her daughters is studying to be a chef and she generates the most income for the family. Luisa hopes that her daughter can finish her studies and open a restaurant. She'll use the loan to invest in merchandise for her store. Carmen is married, with four children. She sells coca, and chicks to be raised for eggs and meat. She'll use this loan to buy more chickens and coca leaves. Carmen dreams of her children continuing their studies and becoming professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cuy, medicine, coca, chicken, rice, sugar, noodles, and oil.

loans.name: Toribia

texts.es: Toribia de 27 años es una joven madre soltera, vive en su propia casa, la cual consiguió con mucho sacrificio. Tiene 3 hijos; Juan de 8, Sandra de 5 y Mónica de 3 años, a quienes quiere mucho. Se dedica al negocio de la compra y venta de triciclos, actividad que le ha servido de mucho para mantener a su familia y brindarle ciertas comodidades, compra triciclos usados que han sido dejados de lado porque ya no funcionan, los repara y los pinta dejándolos como nuevos. Lleva 8 años en este negocio y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender sus triciclos y ver que están bien refaccionados, pero lo que menos le gusta, es que para arreglarlos realiza un trabajo muy pesado y cansado, que le toma mucho tiempo, aun así ella sigue adelante en espera de mejorar su vida. Toribia anhela tener un taller propio, donde pueda arreglar con mayor comodidad sus triciclos, ya que actualmente realiza esta labor en su casa. Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y tiene muchas ganas de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, ya que le da alegría a las demás. Invertirá los seiscientos soles que solicita en comprar más triciclos para arreglar y así incrementar la cantidad que vende.
texts.en:
Toribia, who is 27 years old, is a young, single mother. She lives in her own home, which she obtained through much sacrifice. She has 3 children she loves very much; Juan is 8, Sandra is 5, and Monica is 3. Her business is buying and selling tricycles. The business has really helped maintain her family and provide them with some comforts. She buys used tricycles that have been abandoned because they no long work. She repairs and paints them so that they look new. She has been in this business for 8 years. What she likes best about her work is selling the tricycles and seeing that they are refurbished well. What she likes the least is that it is hard, tiring, and requires a lot of time. Even so, she continues in the hope of improving her life. Toribia would like to have her own shop, where she could be more comfortable refurbishing her tricycles. She now does it in her house. This is her first loan with MFP. She fully intends to make her payments on time. She is a well thought of member of her community bank. She brings joy to others. She will use the loan of 600.00 PEN to buy more tricycles to fix and be able to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Consorcia

texts.en:
Mrs.Consorcia A.,  63, was widowed at an early age and raised eight children on her own.  A resident of Guba Clarin, Misamis Occidenta, she grows coconuts, bananas and root crops and buys and sells banana fruit for a living
.
Consorcia joined Paglaum MPC because of their programs and services and is now applying for a loan of Php 4000 as additional capital to purchase fertilizer for banana and root crop production.  Her future plans include enabling her son to complete his college studies and renovating her house for comfortable living.

loans.use: To purchase fertilzers for banana and root crop production.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy B. is 45 years old. She is divorced with four children. Currently, all her children are working and independent. Right now, her concentration is focusing on improving her business. Mercy lives at Akim Wenchi, a suburb of Akim Oda, in the eastern region of Ghana.

Mercy trades in the sale of bush meats, and fresh and dried fish. She has been in business for the last 5 years now in the community market where she lives. Also, she trades part to the surrounding communities during their market days. She take stock from the hunters who supply her with the tasty bush meats like grass cutter, deer etc. but for the fresh fish, she takes stocks from the river Volta in Ghana. She is currently facing financial challenges to buy more bush meats and fish. She requests a loan support to restock her business. She would be grateful for your support. Mercy belongs to a village bank called ‘wonderful Jesus’.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of bush meats, fresh and dried fish.

loans.name: Abasi

texts.en:
Abasi is 32 years old and married with two children. He earns his living by selling wooden planks.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of N70,000, which he plans to use to purchase more planks to sell.

He sends his thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita R. is from the village of Maikay in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 31 years old. Lolita is single. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a general store where she sells daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Lolita has just started this business.

In 2008, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and serve as working capital. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP that she will use to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This loan will be the second loan that Lolita has taken from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en: Rashida sells bags of salt and sugar. Rashida lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is 30 years old and married with 4 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more bags of salt and sugar to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of salt and sugar.

loans.name: Dinara's Group

texts.en:
M. Dinara is this group’s leader. She teaches English in a local school and at the same time holds the position of Vice Principal. She has three children: two sons, both of whom work, and one daughter, who is a school student.

About a year ago Dinara started her own business of cattle raising. She bought two calves and now these calves have gained weight and in fall she is going to have them sold or slaughtered for meat. She wants to expand her business and needs a loan to build a new yard for her cattle as the one she has at the moment is in a bad condition. This yard is not suitable for her cattle in wintertime and therefore she is taking precautionary measures now, so that she does not lose her cattle in winter.

She says that having a business apart from a regular job helps her be constantly active and motivated. 

The other members of the group include Mairamkul, Gulyasyl, Kachkyn and Gulmira.

Mairamkul is a married woman aged 51. She owns a small shop and besides that makes national carpets. She needs a loan to rebuild her yard for her cattle and to increase its area.

Gulyasyl is a housewife. Many years ago her family bought some cattle and since then she has raised it and now she sells her cow’s milk. All of her children have their own families, but she prefers to live independent of her children.

Kachkyn is the mother of four children and works in construction. At the same time she manages to breed cattle for which she has ten-years of experience. She has a pretty decent income and now needs a loan to purchase some more cows.

Gulmira also works at a construction site in the capital. She used to work as a masseuse. Then she bought some calves and started cattle raising. She wants to purchase some more calves to raise them for her son’s wedding and then to resell the rest. 

As can be seen, all the members of this group combine two or more jobs and that makes them even more passionate about their plans.


======================================
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit:  www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at  www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To build a new yard for her cattle

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a business woman. She trades in Dumas clothes, linen, government school uniforms and lace materials. She sometimes sells through hawking, that is, she uses a personal selling method. This, she said, makes her goods move very fast.  She is 44 years old and a married mother with six children. All her children are in school. She is very supportive to her family through the proceeds she makes from the business. She has four years of selling experience, but progress has persistently been low due to insufficient funds. She hopes the loan will enable her to revive the business and make a more viable profit. She wants to purchase bulk of Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials to increase her inventory. It is her desire to save more to give her children a better education.

loans.use: To purchase bulk clothes to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza  es una mujer de 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos  en la casa de sus padres, ya que recibió como herencia  una parte de la casa donde habita con su familia. Sus deseos de superación  la motivaron a trabajar en diversos lugares de la ciudad y en la actualidad esta dedicada a la administración de dos carros que posee conformando así una línea de transporte y del que es socia. Junto a su pareja tratan de  ser miembros activos  para recibir los beneficios que otorga la empresa. Pero para completar sus servicios de movilidad adquirió unos motocarros, con las cuales trabajan sus hijos. Sumado a esta gran labor  Maritza  brinda servicios de cocinera en un convento durante la mañana, actividad que la ayuda a mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Uno de sus más ansiados deseos de Maritza  es consolidar la empresa de transporte con su pareja e invertir en la compra de  un carro adicional ya que las reparaciones o fallas mecánicas perjudican la economía de su hogar por ello  requiere de un ingreso adicional  dentro del rubro de trasporte. Este es su sexto préstamo en Microfinanzas PRISMA y espera que le apoyemos para que pueda mejorar sus condiciones económicas y a desarrollar actitudes dentro del grupo de trabajo que conforma en su banco comunal. Los 3000 soles de crédito le permitirán realizar  el mantenimiento de sus vehículos los cuales requieren de reparaciones.
texts.en:
Maritza is 41 years old, married, and has two children. Her family lives in the home she inherited from her parents. Her desire to succeed motivated her to work in several different places throughout the city. At the moment, she manages two automobiles – one to use for public transportation and the other for her own personal use. Maritza and her partner share the responsibilities of running their business in hopes that they will both reap the benefits. However, their transportation service was not complete until they acquired some motorcars, which are operated by their children. In addition to managing her business, Maritza also works as a cook at a convent in the mornings, a job that helps to supplement her income.

One of Maritza’s greatest wishes is to augment her transportation business by purchasing another automobile, since repairs and lost revenues due to mechanical failures have hurt her family income. She is requesting her sixth loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA and hopes that the additional support will improve her financial condition. The attitudes she developed working with her Communal Bank have helped her cope with her situation. Her loan of 3000 soles will be used to perform maintenance on the vehicles in need of repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Marian

texts.en: Marian sells sarongs and baking materials such as baking powder, flour, etc. She has been in this business for a long time. She is married with nine children and she is 45 years old. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She requests the loan amount of 140,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs and baking materials to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and baking materials to sell

loans.name: Big Five Marketer Group

texts.en:
Daniel B.S. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called 'Big Five Marketer'. He is 48 years old, married with 4 children, aged 9-24 years old. Their educational levels are 4th- 12th grade. He also cares for 2 siblings. Daniel could not go to university after high school graduation due to lack of financial support.

Daniel's business is his general shop; he buys general good that people use daily wholesale and sells them to the residents of Old Road, Joe Bar where he lives.

Daniel started with food preparation and later sales of drinks then decided to elevate his business to a general goods shop and has been running this business for 18 years, hoping to establish branches all over Monrovia,Liberia. Daniel pays rent for the shelter he occupies for the business, so when the rent is increased, it causes problems for his business.

Daniel needs this loan to purchase more general goods. He dreams of giving his children an education so that they will live better lives in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more general goods

loans.name: James' Group

texts.en:
Rogers is 25 years old and the leader of his group in Rukungini. He is married and has a baby boy who is only 10 months old. Additionally, he cares and provides for his sister’s daughter.

Rogers has been in the poultry business for five years and operates a stall in the central market of Rukungini. The small operation generates 70,000 USH per week in profits.

With the loan of 600,000 USH he plans on purchasing more chicks and expanding his business. One day he hopes to be able to build a house for his family to live in and pay for the education of his children.

loans.use: To buy more chicks

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
“If you are industrious, you will have plenty of food,” says Oscar P. Sr., the industrious husband of Telma P.. They live in a village located at Brgy. Lactawan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya and are blessed with five children, four boys and one girl, all of whom have finished their studies in college. Three of them are presently working abroad, while the others are managing a business.

The common source of their living is through cultivation of their farmland by planting rice and some vegetables. During harvest season, they can earn a net income of P 35,000.00 which they use to both sustain their daily basic needs and save for their future. At present, Oscar is requesting an amount of P 30,000.00 to acquire needed agricultural supplies including fertilizers and pesticides for the maintenance of their crop production. He believes that he can increase his harvest and income with the help of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy farming inputs

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en: Mercedita B. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 43 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Mercedita owns and operates a furniture-making business, making and selling bamboo household furniture to local businesses and community members. She makes 5,000 PHP a month from her business. In 2009, Mercedita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to sustain her business. Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon E. is from the village of Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 42 years old and is married. Ramon owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, canned goods, etc., in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ramon joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Atieno Edewa

texts.en:
Atieno Edewa O. is a 54-year-old woman, a widow and the sole guardian of one grandchild in Malanga, Busia district. She is a former fish-seller at Malanga market, where she now runs her grocery business.

She would like a loan of 20,000 KES to increase her stock and to introduce a cooking/frying oil business alongside the grocery. As a former fish seller, she says oil is the highest selling commodity in the area due to fish being a staple food.

Her future dream is ensure the education of her grandchild.

loans.use: To increase grocery stock

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is fifty years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to four children. All of her children are in school. Akua lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. She is a baker. She bakes bread and supplies her product to retailers and beverage sellers. She purchases bags of flour from nearby communities. Akua has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour in bulk.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal Firmeza.
Nelly es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Nelly se dedica a la crianza de cuy, tiene 50 galpones, actividad que realiza en sus terrenos de San Miguel de Ayacucho que se encuentra a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, sus ventas los realiza a los recreos y restaurantes.
Nelly necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de alimento para cuy.
Los sueños de Nelly son ampliar sus galpones y comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the Firmeza Communal Bank. She has a live-in partner, is 29 years old and has 2 children. Nelly works raising guinea pigs. She has 50 sheds and raises the guinea pigs on her land in San Miguel de Ayacucho, which is 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. She sells the guinea pigs in parks and restaurants. Nelly needs a loan of 800 soles which she will use to purchase food for the guinea pigs. Nelly's dreams are to expand the sheds for the animals and to buy a house.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food for her guinea pigs

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Julio, tiene 33 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos. El socio Julio forma parte del banco comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene un pequeño taller de confección de ropa de lana. El socio y su esposa se dedican a la  confección de chompas, pantalones, chalinas y buzos de lana. Julio requiere el préstamo de los 500 soles, que invertirá en comprar materiales como lana y tela.
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. 

(El distrito peruano de Huancarani es uno de los 6 distritos de la Provincia de Paucartambo, ubicada en el Departamento de Cusco, perteneciente a la Región Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Julio, age 33, is in a common law marriage and has two children. Julio is a member of the Once de Mayo – Huancarani Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association. He has a small shop where he makes clothes from wool. He and his wife use wool to make sweaters, pants, scarves, and jogging suits. Julio needs a loan for 500 PEN to buy more materials like wool and fabric. He is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and he promises to pay it on time. (The Peruvian district of Huancarani is one of the six districts in the Paucartambo province. It is located in the Cusco department, which belongs to the region of Cusco, Perú.)

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials like wool and fabric

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en: Gantumur is 37 years old and lives with her three children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. She is solely responsible for her family, and she receives government help to support her children. Gantumur started a retailing business with her sister by purchasing products in Ereen, a Chinese border city, in 2008. She has been operating her business independently since June 2008 and the business has been stabilizing. Gantumur has been working hard to expand her business and to increase the variety of products she can offer. She says, “I would like to constantly operate my business and will expand the business.” She is requesting a 765,000 tugrug (~  538 USD) loan to increase the working capital of her business.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla K. (pictured here), age 27, and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Noun, age 33, live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married for ten years and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of the children are in school and the other one is still young.  

Mrs. Phalla K. has been a silk weaver for ten years, a skill she learned form her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who, in turn, sells them in the Phnom Penh market. Besides weaving, she also supplements her income with a business raising pigs. Her husband has been a security guard for 2 years. 

Phalla is requesting her first loan in the amount of $500 to purchase additional piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Ana Del Socorro

texts.es: Ana Del Socorro tiene 52 años, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar desde muy joven. Cuando inicio fue por los conocimientos de su Mama así fue que Ana logro aprender lo necesario y adquirir experiencia para fortalecer su trabajo, pues ella siempre sea preocupado por su familia como son sus 2 hijos que les proporciona el alimento diario y además mejorar su condición de vida. El financiamiento que actualmente solicita es para la compra de cosméticos, sabanas, ropa y trajes. Su deseo es poder proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana Del Socorro is 52 years old and has been selling general merchandise for more than five years. Ever since she was a young woman, she has always enjoyed working. When she started, Ana relied on her mother’s knowledge and learned everything she needed to know and gained the experience to strengthen her business. She has two children and is always concerned about providing for her family’s daily needs and improving their living conditions.

The loan she is currently requesting will be used to buy cosmetics, bed sheets, clothing, and suits. Her wish is to be able to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics, bed sheets, clothing, and suits

loans.name: Wassa Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Wassa sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 3 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Fougani, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali.
 Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parentés. Elles font le commerce de céréales et de charbon de bois. Nana D. est un des membres qui fait le commerce de charbon de bois. 
Nana tout comme les autres membres du groupe  collabore avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci d’avoir constamment un appui financier pour leurs activités.
 Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt et tous les prêts précédents se sont  bien dénoués. 
Quant à l’utilisation de ce nouveau prêt, Nana compte  acheter, des chargements de charrettes en sacs de charbon de bois avec les producteurs du village et environs et revend sur place à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs.  
Elle estime réaliser  un bénéfice moyen de 25 000FCFA  par mois. Les bénéfices sont investis dans la nourriture, dans la santé et dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The members of the Wassa group are married women with an average age of 38 years and 3 children. They live with their husbands and children in large traditional families in the village of Fougani, in the Fana subprefecture, in the region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know each other due to familial and neighborly ties. They sells cereals and charcoal. Nana D. is one of the members who sells charcoal. Nana, like the other members of the group, is collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to have constant financial support for their activities. They are on their fourth loan and all of their previous loans were repaid in full. With this loan, Nana hopes to buy cartloads of charcoal from producers in the village and surrounding areas, which will then be sold on-site to a client base comprised mainly of retailers. She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA. The profits will be invested in food, health, and the business.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal Sumacc Huayta que significa Bella Flor en quechua.
Luisa es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 2 hijos, Luisa vende salchipapas en la puerta de su casa, actividad que realiza todas las tardes, además junto a su esposo tienen un carro con el cual realiza taxi en la ciudad.
Luisa necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa, descartables.
Luisa sueña con brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Luisa, 26, is a member of the Sumacc Huayta (Beautiful Flower in Quechua) communal bank. She lives with her life partner and their two children. Luisa sells salchipapas (fried potatoes with hotdog sausage) on her doorstep every afternoon. She and her husband also own a car that they use to provide taxi services in town. Luisa needs a 3000 sol loan to buy potatoes and disposable utensils. Luisa dreams with providing her children with a good education and with improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes and disposable utensils.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “KILLA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. Marlene,  ella tiene 34 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo de 17 años, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella es una mujer optimista llena de proyectos y sueños, Nuestra socia tiene un restaurante bar karaoke y ella solicita el préstamo para comprar un equipo de sonido para su negocio.
 
La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner belongs to the Killa village bank and lives in the Huanchac district in Cusco, Peru. Her name is Marlene and she is a 34 year old single mother with a 17 year old son. She juggles her household duties with her job as a retail businesswoman. She is a very optimistic woman full of dreams and projects. She runs a karaoke bar and restaurant and is seeking a loan to buy sound equipment for her business. She is grateful for the support she is receiving and promises to repay her debt on time.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sound equipment for her karaoke bar and restaurant

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
Feliza Y. is from the village of  Kiraging Sugbongcogon, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Feliza is married and has 7 children. To make a living, Feliza owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Feliza has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Feliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Feliza is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Feliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Martha Leonor

texts.es: Martha Leonor T. M. inicio en el 2010 con la venta de tajadas con queso, tortas de papa, enchiladas actualmente ha ido surtiendo su negocio con la comercialización de carne asada, cerdo asado, pollo asado y frito, gallopinto, ensaladas, tajadas etc. Ella con el préstamo piensa seguir mejorando su negocio y crecer.
texts.en:
In 2010, Martha Leonor T. M. began selling plantains with cheese, potato cakes, and enchiladas. At the moment, she has increased her business by selling roasted beef, roasted pork, roasted and fried chicken, beans and rice, salads, plantain chips, and other items.

With this loan, Martha plans to continue improving and growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains, vegetables, and other ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva Borrower is a married woman from Lebanon and the mother of two young children who still go to school. After seven years of experience as a hairdresser, she opened a beauty salon in her town in 2007. She offers all types of beauty services, including make-up, manicures, pedicures, etc.  She is well-known by a good number of clients.

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy beauty products and to add new services to attract more clients. She's certain that with the help of this loan, she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: buy beauty products and add new services

loans.name: Mansha's Group

texts.en:
Mansha is the wife of M. A. and a citizen of Borewala in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over fifteen years. 

A very vigorous lady, Mansha operates a clothes-selling business. She purchases the clothes from different cities and sells them in her community and market. She enjoys a good customer base because they give her orders of new fabrics in clothing. This helps her to get knowledge about the new material in clothing.  

Her husband owns & operates a grocery shop in the community. His shop is the only one in the community, which gives him good earning. Being an only shop in the community, the people's expectations become high, so he always needed of good stock in his shop. Therefore, Mansha has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s shop. With the loan amount he will buy groceries in bulk to meet the needs of his customers and to generate good profit from these items.

loans.use: Purchase groceries for grocery shop.

loans.name: Reina Margarita

texts.es: Reina Margarita A. D. H. 38 años D. edad, resiD. en la zona urbana D. San Francisco Gotera, en el departamento D. Morazán. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como albañil, y junto a sus tres hijos D. 14, 8 y 7 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Reina posee una venta D. tortillas, la cual se encuentra en su casa D. habitación, en donD. se encarga D. elaborar las tortillas las cuales se hacen a base D. masa D. maíz, las cuales cocina sobre un comal hecho D. barro y fuego D. leña, en la actualidad una forma D. hacer tortillas muy poco común en el país, ya que en el presente son cocinadas sobre cocinas D. plancha con fuego a base D. gas propano. Reina solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz y leña por mayor, con el deseo D. poder aumentar sus ventas, atendiendo a mayor cantidad D. personas. Su negocio es bastante estable, ya que ella incluso hace tortillas los días domingos, en los cuales son pocas las personas que las elaboran, lo cual hace su trabajo aún más eficiente y le permite ser preferida por las personas. Las ganancias generadas por este negocio son D. suma importancia para el sostenimiento D. su hogar, por lo que el mayor deseo D. ella es el D. poder mejorarlo significativamente.
texts.en:
Reina is 38 years old and resides in the urban zone of San Francisco Gotera, Department of Morazán. She lives with her husband who is a brick layer, and with 3 children, aged 14, 8, and 7, all of whom attend school. Reina has a tortilla shop, located in her home. She makes tortillas from corn flour and cooks them over a 'comal' maD. of clay and uses firewood. This traditional method is no longer very common in the country; today, tortillas are usually baked on a metal platter using propane gas. Reina requests a loan to buy corn and firewood at wholesale, with a desire to augment her sales, and serve more customers. Her business is sufficiently stable, since she also makes tortillas on Sundays when few people do so. This makes her work more efficient and gives her customer preference. The earnings she generates in this business are very important for sustaining her household. For that reason, her greatest desire is to be able to improve her income significantly.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CORN FLOUR AND FIREWOOD FOR BAKING TORTILLAS TO SELL

location.town: San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán

loans.name: Olmedo Luis

texts.en:
Olmedo Luis M. P. is 65 years old. He is divorced and lives in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. He has six children. 

Olmedo is a member of the rural loan group San Jacinto. There are 15 members of the group, the majority of whom work in agriculture. 

Olmedo also works in agriculture, earning on average $135 per month. He does the buying and selling of his products in the nearby town of Matilde. 

He plans to use the credit to build a house. His dream is to have a car and to start his own business. 

In his free time, he likes to watch television and listen to music. His favorite community tradition is the Chirstmas festivities.

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Mileyddiss Gabriela

texts.es: La Sra. Mileyddiss Gabriela N. G.   ella  es Trabajadora activa  de la Empresa Laboratorio Panzyma del crucero  desempeñándose como recepcionista, tiene  un año de trabajar para esta empresa, es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mileyddiss Gabriela N. G. is employed by Laboratorio Panzyma in El Crucero. She’s a Recptionist and has worked for this firm for a year. She’s married. She’s had two loans with CEPRODEL that she’s used to buy building materials and supplies for home improvements. The loans have been of great benefit to her in that they have improved her and her family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For paving stones, sand and cement.

loans.name: Ryskul's Group

texts.en:
Ryskul K. is the leader of this group. She is 54 and a widow who already has a grandson. Now she is an owner of a chemist’s shop. The family budget enlarges with the help of a cattle-breeding business. Her son actively helps to run his mother's business. During the past two years, Ryskul has managed to buy furniture. In order to develop her business she needs to buy hay for cattle feeding. That’s why she wants to get a loan. In the future, her plans include obtaining a new car. 

Gulshat B., 36, is married. Her husband's profession is farming. Together, the couple has three children, all of whom are school pupils. Gulshat has chosen to work in the sphere of medicine; she works as a nurse in a hospital. But in order to cover family expenses, she has to earn money additionally by cattle breeding. Out of those proceeds, the family has managed to build a new house and to obtain a refrigerator and a washing machine. The loan's purpose is for stocking up hay for the winter. In the future, she is planning to buy a car.

Saltanat U. has the status of the group’s treasurer. She is 34 and a widow who has raised two sons by herself. Luckily, she gets material support from her brother and her older son. But after the big tragedy, her husband's death, she decided not to give up and she has opened a small shop. This business gives her 6000 soms per month. Moreover, Saltanat makes her bread by working as a mail carrier. She has managed to buy necessary household appliances: a clothes washer, a refrigerator and a vacuum cleaner. The loan's purpose is to increase cattle stock by obtaining more farm animals (2500 soms per animal). In the future, she plans to build a household room. 

Shailogul T., 31, is married and her spouse is a farmer. Today, she raises money by taking orders at home and offering a sewing service. During the years of working hard, the members of the family together have managed to make house repairs, to buy a television set and a carpet. The loan's purpose is to obtain a sewing machine and stuff. Planning for the future, Shailogul wants to buy a kitchen set and a refrigerator. 

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase hay

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida D. is from the village of Pta. Miray, Baliangao (Pta. stands for Philippine travel [or tourism] authority). She is 36 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Adelaida sells ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2001, Adelaida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Adelaida is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a fishing boat. This will be her 15th loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Chet

texts.en: Chet S., 42, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Kandal Province, Cambodia, an area known for fertile farmland for growing vegetables. S. sells rice, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of about USD 2 per day to help cover the family's expenses. The family has to spend USD 35 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 10 on other necessary expenses every month.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more rice to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more rice to resell.

loans.name: Barshagul

texts.en:
Barshagul A. is 42 years old and lives with her five children in Bayan-Ulgiy province in western Mongolia. She and her children live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her three daughters all attend a local secondary school.

Barshagul operates a butchering and meat-selling business in her province. In Mongolia it is common for a household to buy at least one cow and ten sheep to be eaten during the long Mongolian winters. People of this province usually prepare their meat for winter during October and November and finish eating it in March.

Barshagul usually purchases livestock from herders, and her son helps her to slaughter them to sell at the local market. She also travels up to 200 kilometers from her town to sell meat throughout the province. She sells a kilogram of lamb for 2000-2500 MNT and a kilogram of horse meat for 3000-3500 MNT.

She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more livestock such as sheep at 50,000 to 60,000 MNT and cows at 200,000 MNT. She hopes to continue being successful and says, "All I want is to support my children."

loans.use: To purchase more livestock

loans.name: Phou

texts.en: Phou P., 28, is a motorbike dealer in Takeo province. He purchases and sells used motorbikes and is able to make about US$ 5 in profit every day.
