His wife is employed in a garment factory and makes US$ 3 per day. This couple has one young child who just started attending school. Phou P. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike for resale.

loans.use: Resell used motorbike

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen P. is from the village of Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 50 years old. Ellen is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Ellen owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and raising pigs for sale. She also buys and sells vegetables. Ellen has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ellen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ellen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Ellen is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Ellen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a single woman who rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are hospital bills, rent, and food. 

She has been operating a food stall business for over two years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Amina faces a major challenge in seasonality and competition from other food stall operators. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase stocks of Irish potatoes, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase Irish potatoes, rice, beans, and cooking oil

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Gantulga J. is 33 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Suhbaatar province in central Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian home tent, inside his brother's fence. His wife is currently unemployed and his daughter attends a local primary school. 

Gantulga operates a wooden products and furniture-production business in his town. He produces materials and wooden furniture used in gers according to his customers' orders. He started his ger-material and furniture-production business in 2006 and has gained much experience as a carpenter. 

For the future, Gantulga hopes to continue to grow and expand his business and have his own stable work place. He is requesting a 1,500,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase wood and supplies for his ger and wooden-furniture business.

loans.use: To purchase wood and supplies

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn A. is from the village of Santa Filomena. She is 53 years old, married, and has five adult children. Evelyn operates a family member's business in the retail sector, running a general store in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately $88 a month.

In 2010, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional goods to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell

loans.name: Jessy

texts.es:
Jessy Guzman G., es un emprendedor preocupado por la salud de sus vecinos.
Es por eso que hace  4 años inicio con la venta de productos naturales  medicinales, un negocio que la ha permitido salir adelante y ayudar a las personas de su comunidad. El necesita comprar mas producto para abastastecer  la demanda que cada vez es mayor, es por eso que el necesita un préstamo de  ₡598000 (Quinientos noventa y ocho mil colones). 
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica
texts.en:
Jessy Guzman G. is an entrepreneur who is concerned about his neighbors’ health. This is why he began to sell natural medicinal products four years ago, a business that has allowed him to get ahead and to help the people of his community. He needs to buy more products to meet the growing demand, which is why he needs a loan of 598,000 Costa Rican Colones (CRC).

He is a member of the Canalete Communal Loan Company (Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete), one of the 100 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: Purchase of medicinal products

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman who lives in Aborlan, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a general store and buying & selling dry goods.  Her husband Orville, who is 37 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are 8 and 12 years old. Joyce joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Joyce has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use to buy stock for the sari-sari (general) store to save up for the future expansion of her business. Joyce is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Elecita

texts.en:
Elecita is a 34-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  fruit and vegetable vending and rock salt vending   She lives in Bago, Negros Occidental.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3,000.  Elecita is borrowing PHP 10,000 to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her fourth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  Elecita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson is a 38-year-old married man with four children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Johnson has been buying and selling matooke (green plantains) for five years. He started out by selling four bananas on one bicycle and now sells 200 bananas. His hardships include competition and lack of capital. In the future, Johnson wants to export the bananas. Johnson needs this loan to buy bananas to sell.

loans.use: to buy bananas

loans.name: Fawaz

texts.en:
Fawaz is a 51-year-old client of FATEN. He is a father of one daughter and three sons. Fawaz took out a loan from FATEN to purchase home furniture.

Fawaz, who appears in the picture above, bought a kitchen table, bedroom furniture for his daughter, and chairs for the sitting room. Fawaz took out the loan as he can't pay the amount at once from his salary and it would be easier to repay FATEN on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to purchase house furniture.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es: Teodoro S. Jiménez es un hombre muy trabajador que desde hace 27 años, el dedica al mantenimiento de llantas de automóviles como lo es parchar, poner aire y la venta de neumáticos de segunda mano. El se encuentra agradecido por el apoyo brindado este será su segundo crédito el cual utilizara para terminar la construcción del proyecto anterior y así ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teodoro S. Jiménez is a very hard-working man.  For 27 years he has been repairing automobile tires.  His business involves patching tires, filling them with air, and selling second hand tires.

He is grateful for the support that has been provided.  This will be his second loan, and he will use it to finish a construction project that he started previously.  That way he will provide his family with a better quality of life.
.

loans.use: to finish construction

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felista K. N. is married and the mother of two. 

To earn a living, she sells children's clothes. She also does tailoring to supplement her income. She has benefited from Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills. This has helped her to sustain her business for three years.  

She hopes to expand it and employ people. She will use the loan of 50,000 KES to introduce new products such as baby shawls, diapers and vests into her product line.

loans.use: To introduce new products such as baby shawls, diapers and vests into her product line.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Después de aprender el oficio de las confecciones en talleres realizados, al quedar embarazada y tener que asumir su rol de madre cabeza de familia y debido a la falta de oportunidades laborales, Sandra Patricia G. C. se vio en la necesidad de empezar a trabajar como independiente confeccionando diferentes prendas a sus conocidos, vecinos y familiares. 

Con el paso del tiempo su negocio se ha ido acreditando, lo que le ha permitido incrementar sus ventas y debido a ello necesita comprar una máquina plana que le permita agilizar sus procesos y cumplirle a sus clientes, como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para hacerlo, Sandra necesita de un préstamo. 

A sus 36 años de edad, en el futuro, Sandra espera hacer de su taller de confección una gran empresa que no sólo le permita mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hija sino también generar empleo.
texts.en:
Sandra Patricia G. C. learned how to make clothing in established workshops. Upon becoming pregnant and needing to assume her role as mother and head of household, and due to the lack of work opportunities, she saw the need to start working independently making different kinds of garments for people she knew and for neighbors and family members.

With the passage of time, her business has been getting a good reputation, which has allowed her to increase her sales.  Due to this, she needs to buy a sewing machine that will let her speed up her processes and fulfill her obligations to her customers.  Since she doesn't have sufficient capital to do this, Sandra needs a loan.

Sandra is 36 years old. In the future, she hopes to make her workshop a large business that will not only allow her to improve her quality of life and that of her daughter, but will also generate employment.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to make clothing

loans.name: Felecidade Naftal

texts.pt:
Felicidade naftal, nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, provincia de Maputo, sul de Mocambique, solteira mãe de 2 filhos de 10 e 16 anos. Todos vão a Escola.  Fez a 9ª classe não continuou devido a sua gravidez. Vive numa casa de aluguer com seus filhos responsabiliza se pelas suas 2 madrastas quando pode.


Cresce na companhia das  suas 2 madrastas por te sido abandonada pela sua mãe ainda bebe,nunca saiu do Distrito. Apos a gravides passa a viver com seu marido agora separados. Consegue aranjar um emprego na Escola Secundária da Namaacha como Auxiliar das Limpesas, trabalha das 6h as 14h auferindo mensalmente 2.600.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa. Consegue poupar na sua conta bancária 200.00mt.

Ja teve empréstimo no BIM, conheceu a Hluvuku atraves da sua colega que também é cliente da instituição. Este é seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção( areia, blocos e cimento) para dar continuidade da sua obra. O anterior de 10.000.00mt foi para mesma finalidade.


Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo para aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para conclui  as minimas partes da obra e mibiliar a mesma.
texts.en:
Felicidade Naftal was born in Namaacha District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is single and has two children who are 10 and 16 years old. They both go to school. Felicidade finished 9th grade but did not continue with school because of her pregnancy. She lives in a rented house with her children and takes care of her two stepmothers when she can.

She grew up with her 2 stepmothers because her mother abandoned her when she was a baby. Felicidade has never left the District. After her pregnancy she went to live with her husband; they are now separated. She managed to find a job as a Cleaning Assistant at the Secondary School in Namaacha. She works from 6:00 am until 2:00 pm, earning 2,600 meticais monthly which she uses for household expenses. She has been able to save 200 meticais in her bank account.

Felicidade had a loan from BIM and then learned about Hluvuku through a co-worker who is also a customer of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. She is asking for 15,000 meticais, which she will use to buy construction materials (sand, blocks and cement) to continue building her house. The first loan of 10,000 meticais was for the same purpose.

She is confident that she will pay off the loan ahead of time so she can take out other loans. In the future she intends to take out more loans to finish up construction and furnish her house.

loans.use: to buy construction material (sand, blocks and cement).

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 41-year-old married woman and mother of four who started baking "saj" (a flat bread popular in the Levant) in 2001 in order to help her husband with their family's expenses. She intends to expand her business, which is why she has requested a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva Partner to buy another Saj-Convex metal griddle necessary to bake saj bread and also flour and gas.This is fatima's fifth cycle with Al Majmoua, she's a perfect paying-back borrower and all her previous loans reflected positively on her situation. She hopes to keep expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a new metal griddle, gas and flour necessary for her saj-baking business

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 29 años de edad. Actualmente, Alexander vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Alexander es chofer y se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en la ciudad del Cusco en su propio taxi, él trabaja en los turnos de la mañana y noche. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Alexander requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro. El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Hatun  Rumiyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Alexander, age 29, was born in Cusco (Peru).  Alexander currently lives in the same city where he was born.

Alexander is a driver, and he provides transportation services in Cusco in his own taxi.  He works the morning and night shifts.  He has had this business for several years.  It is going very well for him thanks to the effort that he puts into his work.

He is a responsible and hard-working person.  It is for these qualities that his colleagues invited him to participate in the Hatun Rumiyoc Communal Bank with the Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to pay for car maintenance.

loans.name: Alla Kan Soutra. Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf membres du groupe ALLA KAN SOUTRA sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41ans, 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à BATIEMOGOBOUGOU, un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide avec   AMINATA au milieu de la position debout.
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et la semence pour entretenir : 2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché du village de DALLEN et au marché de LOULOUNI après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 165.500FCFA en fin de  campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The nine members of group Alla Kan Soutra are married women who are on average 41 years old with five children; most of them live in polygamous families in Batiemogobougou, one of the villages of Loulouni Township in Loulouni sub-prefecture, Mali's third administrative region.
They are partnering with micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the organization. Previous loans well successfully repaid.
Aminata, who is standing in the middle in the picture, cultivates groundnuts. With her loan, she plans on paying for fertilizer and seeds to maintain five acres. After the harvest, the crop is sold in the village and at markets in Dallen and Loulouni, to a clientele comprising men and women.
She expects an average profit of about 165,000 CFA at the end of the agricultural cycle. This profit will help her pay back her loan and support her husband with daily expenses.
She wishes to continue this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to operate an even larger cultivation space, the better to increase her revenues.

loans.use: to pay for plowing costs and to buy agricultural inputs (such as fertilizers and seeds).

loans.name: Veronica Patricia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Verónica, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hermosa hija de cinco años de edad, la misma que recién en este año empezó a estudiar en una  escuela del sector. Su esposo es tecnólogo en computación.

Nuestra amiga es maestra por contrato en una escuela en San Jacinto, pero también tiene un negocio propio en el cual se dedica a la venta de confitería, helados, sodas, aguas, bocadillos elaborados para picar entre otras cosas, ella tiene un pequeño bar en la estación de servicios en Charapoto. También ofrece el servicio de cabinas telefónicas, nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio por más de siete años y le ha ido muy bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más mercadería va a comprar, papas fritas, tostitos, sodas, aguas, energizantes entre otras cosas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace ya cuatro años y le gusta porque los créditos le han sacado de muchos apuros económicos.
 
Sus metas son tener una casa y local propios pues donde vive y tiene su local es alquilado.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'San Esteban' community bank meets in the city of Charapoto.  This place is known for its traditional culture and also for the fact that it is located just a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet 32 year-old Verónica who is married and has a beautiful 5 year-old daughter.  Just this year, her daughter started attending an elementary school in their neighborhood.  Her husband is a computer engineer.

Our friend is a teacher at a school in San Jacinto.  However, she also owns her own business where she sells confectionery, iced treats, soda, water, sandwiches, etc.  She owns a small bar in a service station in Charapoto.  She also offers a telephone service.  She tells us that she has been in this business for more than seven years and it is doing very well.

Verónica will use this loan to buy more merchandise.  She will buy chips, tostitos, soda, water, energy drinks, etc.  She has been a member of her community bank for four years and she likes it because the loans have gotten her out of many financial tight spots. 

Verónica's goals are to own her own home and business premises as she currently rents both.

loans.use: to buy chips, tostitos, soda, water, energy drinks, etc.

loans.name: Vugar

texts.ru:
Vugar yavlyayetsya IDP personom , on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Vugar jenat i imeyet 2 detey. On rodilsya v 1970 qodu. 
Uje 9 let kak Vugar zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i rozvodit ovec. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit ovec dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya prodaji. On ochen trudolubiviy i lubit userdnuyu rabotu.
texts.en:
Vugar is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his family.   Vugar is married and has two children.  He was born in 1970. 

Vugar has been a shepherd breeding sheep for nine years now.  He needs 2000 AZN to buy sheep to expand his flock so he will have more to sell.  He is very hard working and diligent.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a single man with one school-going child. He owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four months, he has operated a grocery selling business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the dry, hot season the availability of green vegetables is low in supply compared to demand. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the KES 10,000 loan, he wants to purchase a crate of potatoes, onions, tomatoes and green vegetables. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a crate of potatoes, onions, tomatoes and green vegetables.

loans.name: Ivy Fe

texts.en:
Ivy Fe is married with three children. She is 40 years old and lives in Pigsan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental.

Ivy Fe sells and buys to earn a living.  She has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5000 from her business. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase more dried fish to sell.  Ivy Fe has been a member of PMPC for almost one year. In the future, she hopes to earn PHP 10,000 a month.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Nchue

texts.en: Nchue is 33 years old, married and has two children. He has been trading animals for the past three years. He has applied for his first loan with KADET Ltd., which he will use to buy more animals for sale. With the profits generated, he plans to pay school fees for his children. He dreams of becoming a prominent farmer. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more, not withstanding his limited resources.

loans.use: to buy more animals for sale

loans.name: Afepeb 06 Group

texts.fr: AFEPEB 06 est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont le représentant (celui qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommé Germain. Les membres du groupe habitent dans le même quartier. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Germain est âgé de 54 ans et est marié à Félicité. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Germain a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Germain achète de l'huile de palme qu'il vend à son domicile. Germain s'approvisionne au Bénin. Ce troisième prêt permettra certainement à Germain et aux autres membres du groupe AFEPEB 06 de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
AFEPEB 06 Group is made up of three persons. Its representative is named Germain, and is the one raising his hand in the photograph. The members of the group live in the same neighborhood. In order to increase its working capital, this group is seeking a third loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. 

Germain is 54 years old and married to Félicité. The couple has three school-attending children, whom they have to support. The family lives together, and the couple takes care of the various household expenses together.

Germain dropped out of middle school. In order to provide for himself and his children, he buys palm oil that he resells at his home. He gets his supplies in Benin.

This third loan will certainly enable Germain and the other members of the group to bolster their business and increase their clientele and income. The previous two loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy cans of palm oil

loans.name: Green

texts.es: Green, de 23 años habita en la comunidad nativa Santa María. Ahí formó su familia junto a Carmen, su esposa desde hace 5 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Solange y Gabriel a los que cuidan en su casa propia. “Recién estoy comenzando, aún me falta mucho”, afirma el joven y apuesto Green. Quien cuenta con un terreno productivo, donde siembra café, su único sustento económico. Sus ganas de trabajo son increíbles, él es consiente que para tener cultivos de calidad y extensas áreas de cultivo, tiene que ahorrar mucho e invertir gran capital. No se desanima, su alegría y vitalidad le ayudarán a progresar y salir adelante. Ya tiene 3 años de experiencia y lo que más le gusta es limpiar la maleza que crece entre sus cafetales, como también la temporada de cosecha; pues ve su esfuerzo recompensado en la comercialización de sus frutos en la ciudad de Pichanaki. Pero no solo a esta actividad se dedica, también trabaja en un taller de soldadura durante el año a la espera de la cosecha, porque necesita ingresos económicos para la alimentación y educación de sus hijos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los amigos cafetaleros” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece la oportunidad que le brinda. Razón por la que promete ser puntual con sus cuotas. Green de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de herramientas para la limpieza de sus cafetales, además de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos.
texts.en:
23-year-old Green lives in the indigenous community of Santa María.  There he formed his family together with Carmen, his wife of five years.  The couple have two children: Solange and Gabriel.  They care for their children in their own home.

"I just recently started out in this business and am still lacking a lot" says the young, handsome Green who has a plot of farmland where he grows coffee, his only financial means of support.  Green's desire to work is incredible.  He is aware that in order to produce good-quality crops over vast tracts of land he must save up a lot and invest a lot of capital.  He is not discouraged.  His cheerfulness and vitality will help him to make progress and get ahead.  He already has three years experience and what he most enjoys about his work is getting rid of the weeds that grow between his coffee plants and also the harvest season.  This is when he sees his hard work rewarded when he sells his beans in the town of Pichanaki.  

However, this is not the only work that Green does.  He also works in a welding shop during the year while he is waiting for the harvest season because he needs income with which to buy food and pay for his children's education.

Green is a member of the "Los Amigos Cafetaleros" community bank and this is his first loan from MFP.  He is grateful for the opportunity that he is being given.  For this reason, he pledges to make his loan repayments on time.  With your support, Green will invest the money that he has requested to buy tools for weeding his coffee plantations and natural fertilizers to spread over his crops.

loans.use: to buy tools for weeding and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Asmat's Group

texts.en:
Asmat is 45 years old, married and has three sons. Two of them are studying while her eldest son makes and sells ladies' handbags. 

Her husband operates a medicine shop in the market. He also supplies medicines to different medical clinics. He has put a good quality of medicines in his shop and his customers prefer buying from him because they find it easy to buy the medicine they need. 

Asmat is a very good housewife and performs her household tasks very well. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her eldest son's business. With the loan, he will buy raw materials like leather, cloth, zips and thread etc. in bulk quantity to be able to make a larger quantity of handbags of different varieties to increase his sales and profits. 

He has been operating his business for the past four years and Asmat is confident that an investment will help him improve his business and income.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Asmat.

loans.use: To buy leather, cloth, zips and thread for handbag making & selling business.

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en:
Julie Ann is 21 years old and single. She is from Nacional Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. For the past four years, she has managed her own garden, selling produce to make a living. Julie Ann earns 7,000 PHP each month. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year.

Julie Ann is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase more seedlings and fertilizer for her garden. In the future, Julie Ann hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Damaris Esther

texts.es: Damaris, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para mejorar el negocio, ella comprara piedras e hilos para crear pulseras, aretes, collares, para seguir haciendo nuevos estilos y variedad  de colores. Los préstamos para Damaris han significado mucho, ya que con esta ayuda económica ha podido comprar lo necesario para mejorar el negocio y que sea más productivo.
texts.en: Damaris is seeking a new loan to improve her business. She wishes to buy stones and thread so she can make bracelets, earrings, necklaces in new styles and a variety of colours. The loans have been a great help to Damaris since she has been able to buy whatever is needed to improve her business and become more productive.

loans.use: to buy thread and stones to make costume jewelry

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: La socia es docente de profesion y trabaja en la comunidad de Anta y a esta actividad ella a complementado la compra y venta de ropa, la socia viaja y compra de las diferentes fabricas al por mayor ropa para damas, caballeros y niños ropa y los distribuye entre sus colegas de trabajo, amistades, y tiendas de venta de ropa; la socia esta contenta porque le ha ido muy bien el negocio y desea capitalizarse ella invertira el dinero en la compra de ropa por temporada y la distribuira en las diversas tiendas en diferentes provincias en Cusco y de este modo la socia esta creciendo economicamente, la socia desea un futuro tranquilo y que cuando se jubile siga en actividad como a ella le gusta estar y talvez poner un negocio en casa o algo que la distraiga y permite tener calidad de vida. La socia desea al prestamo para invertir en la compra la por mayor de ropa para la venta y mejorar sus ingresos economicos.
texts.en: The member is a teacher by profession and works in Anta. She has complemented this work by buying and selling clothes. The member travels and buys wholesale from different factories ladies', men's and children's clothing and then distributes them among her teaching colleagues, friends and shops that sell clothes. The member is happy because her business is doing well and she wants to capitalize it. She will invest the money in buying seasonal clothes and distributing them to various shops in the different provinces of Cusco. In this way the member is growing economically. The member wishes for a peaceful future and that she remain active when she retires as she likes to be, and perhaps set up a business at home or something to keep her busy and allow her to have a good quality of life. The member wants the loan to purchase wholesale clothes to sell and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy clothes wholesale to sell and improve her income.

loans.name: Callixte

texts.en: Callixte is 43 years old and has four children between the ages of 2 and 10. He runs a general store which he has owned for seven years. Callixte would like a loan to buy beans, rice, sugar, and other foodstuffs to sell in his store. He plans to use any profits to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Felisa Magaly

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en la ciudad de Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Felisa, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro  hijos de 16, 13, 11 y 8 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es albañil.

Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, de productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) y de tarjetas telefónicas. Trabaja los fines de semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada domingo. Sus productos los recibe en su casa. Lleva más de diez años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
	
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa y tarjetas telefónicas ya que quiere aprovechar la época de Navidad Y Año Nuevo. Este es el séptimo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan.
 
Ella está repitiendo el crédito porque necesita el dinero para comprar más productos ya que tiene muchos pedidos. Ella ha  prosperado mucho en su vida y esto es gracias a los créditos ya que ha podido comprar ciertas cosas que sus hijos necesitaban, por esto está muy agradecida con la institución ya que con los créditos su negocio mejora y también su vida personal.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The communal bank Camino Al Progreso meets bimonthly in the city of Montecristi.  This city is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its artisanal crafts that are nationally and internationally renown.  

Here we meet Señora Felisa who is 33 years old, married and has four children ages 16, 13, 11 and 8  with her husband.  The older two are in secondary school and the younger two attend primary school.  Her husband is a mason.  

Felisa is a home maker who sells clothing from catalogs, Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories), and phone cards so that she can have her own income.  She works weekends, selling her products on credit and collecting every Sunday.  She receives her products at home.  She has been doing this for more than ten years and things are going well for her.  
	
She will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothing and phone cards as she wants to take advantage of the Christmas and New Year season.  This is her seventh loan cycle with her communal bank and she likes it for the support they give her.  

She is taking out another loan because she needs to buy more products as she has many orders.  She has prospered in her life and this is thanks to the loans that have allowed her to buy certain things that her kids needed.  For this she is very grateful to the institution. The loans have also improved her business as well as her personal life.  
 
She dreams of seeing her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothing and telephone cards.

loans.name: Electina

texts.en:
Electina is a second hand clothes dealer. She lives in Likoni, Kenya. This is a business she began five years ago from her personal savings. After being introduced to Milango by her friends, Electina is applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to purchase a new stock of clothes.
Her future ambition is to be a supplier of clothes to the area where she lives. The main challenge is the seasonal sales. The area depends on tourists and in the off season there are few sales.
Electina will use the income obtained from the loan to purchase other items like handbags and shoes.

loans.use: To purchase a new stock of clothes

loans.name: Siony

texts.en:
Siony is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with four children. 
Siony has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for four years. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Siony has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Siony hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a single mother of one daughter aged 8 years old. She has been selling secondhand clothes for the last three years. Her monthly income is Kshs 12,000. 

Susan has requested for a Kshs 20,000 loan, which she will be using to buy more stock of clothes. The profit she gets from her business will be used to educate her daughter. Her dream is to own her own bale shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
With seven children to raise, Dinah who is an ever-smiling woman has limited time or sometimes no time at all to make money to provide financial support for her family. Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs and some personal business that she engages in. Dinah is seeking a loan worth 20,000 KES from Kiva lenders to buy cereal seeds and grow her business.

Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Dinah access to a loan that will aid her in growing her cereal selling business into a highly profitable business and also venturing to other markets. With your loan, Dinah’s family will benefit. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability. Lenders, if there is someone you should consider lending to, then that person is Dinah!

loans.use: to buy cereal seeds and grow her cereal business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: I changed to this business four (4) years ago and I have no cause to regret it. Though I am 53 years old; my numerous customers always give me satisfaction, says Mrs. Esther E.. She needs the above amount to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to buy a hybrid dairy cow

loans.name: Nhi

texts.en: Both Nhi and her husband are 31 years old. They recently left the home of their parents to strike out on their own for the first time. Nhi runs a grocery store at home. Her husband is a farmer. Their income is $6 per person/month. They hope to receive a loan of $75 to increase the inventory they offer in the grocery store. They will repay monthly.

loans.use: To supply the grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Equipment for business expansion

loans.name: Yaroslav

texts.en:
Yarloslav started his business around seven years ago out of a desire to work and bring financial stability to his family. He sells a variety of household products including house shoes and other items. His business is the only source of income for him and his wife, Ivanna, and their two small daughters. In a typical month, Yaroslav makes about $270 in profit.

Yaroslav attributes the growth in his business to four loans he has received from Nadiya Ukraine. He is grateful for the financial resources that have been made available to him. Yaroslav has requested a loan of $1000 to give him more working capital for his business. He hopes to continue developing his business and be able to open new sales locations in the future.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en: Kamala Q. is a 23-year-old farmer who sells vegetables from her garden to the local bazaar traders. She lives in the 2nd IDPs settlement in Bilasuvar region. Kamala is an internally displaced person who fled from Jabrail region to Bilasuvar in 1993 during Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict. She started her business in 2003 when she was only 20. This idea came to her mind when she felt that very soon she and her family could stay hungry. With saved money, she purchased seeds of some vegetables and during  the summer she sold most of her harvest. With the money from her first harvest she saved money for autumn and winter. She is still raising vegetables, but now she wants to expand her business and to rent land for planting and raising more vegetables. For this purpose she has applied for 800 USD.

loans.use: Going to expand her business of planting vegetables

loans.name: Gulkhanim

texts.en: Gulkhanim (her husband is pictured)  is 46 years old and has 2 children. She and her family live in Khachmaz town.  This family has sold the building materials for 10 years. Now they need a loan of $850  to buy building materials for improving their business.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Marx's Group

texts.en: Marx is 38 years old. Her primary business is tailoring. In addtion she offers catering services and does livestock farming. With the extra profits from her businesses, she  intends to  cement her house fully.

loans.use: To buy school uniform material and start sewing uniforms

loans.name: Rahman

texts.en: Rahman A. is a 50 year old man, married and has three children. He lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He has been driving a taxi for a few years. He applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan in the amount of $700, which he plans to use to repair his car.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vũ Thị Bình, 31 years old, joins the TYM Fund 5 years ago. Her family runs a rice mill, raises pigs and also weaves straw mattresses to make their living. By product from the mill is used as feed for pigs. In average, they churn out 500 Kg of pork a year. The income is good at 200USD a month, the family’s economy is stable. In 2007, they built a new house from their saving. She is applying for a loan of 400USD to invest in the family’s businesses.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Vũ Thị Bình, 31 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ được 5 năm. Công việc hiện nay của gia đình chị là kinh doanh máy xay xát, kết hợp với chăn nuôi lợn, tiết kiệm được gạo và cám dư thừa. Với thuận lợi đó gia đình nhà chị chăn nuôi rất nhiều và có hiệu quả. Bình quân mỗi năm chị Bình cho xuất chuồng 5 tạ lợn thịt. Không chỉ dừng lại ở những việc đó gia đình chị còn làm thêm nghề dệt chiếu. Với nhiều nguồn thu nhập như vậy kinh tế gia đình chị Bình liên tục phát triển. Từ những nguồn thu trên gia đình chị đã dành dụm năm 2007 xây một ngôi nhà mới thật khang trang. Vòng vốn tiếp theo gia đình bàn bạc xin vay mức vốn 400USD. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình hiện nay là 200USD/tháng,

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Señora Isabel M. is 60 years old. She lives in the city of Ybycuí, and is the single mother of three grown-up daughters.

Isabel is dedicated to sewing; from a very young age she was dedicated to this activity. Even when she was extremely young she would help her aunt, who was a seamstress. This is how she learned the necessary techniques and skills. With the passing of time, her skills were perfected and today they constitute the activity that generates income for her sustenance.

With the income obtained from her work she was able to give a good education to her daughters and to finish the construction of her small house with much sacrifice and honesty. Now she has gone to the Fundación asking for a loan that will allow her to buy cotton fabric of different colors in order to make items for the autumn.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Isabel M. tiene 60 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Ybycuí, es madre soltera de tres hijas todas ya mayores de edad.

Isabel se dedica a la costura; desde muy joven se dedico a esta actividad ya que cuando era muy jovencita ayudaba a su tía que era modista, de este modo ella aprendió las técnicas y conocimientos necesarios. Con el correr de los tiempos se fue perfeccionando y hoy día constituye la actividad que le genera ingreso para su sustento.

Con las ganancias obtenidas pudo dar una buena educación a sus hijas y terminar la construcción de su pequeña casa con mucho sacrificio y honestidad. Ella hoy acude a la Fundación solicitando un crédito que le permitirá comprar telas de algodón de distintos colores para confeccionar prendas para el otoño.

loans.use: To buy cotton fabric

loans.name: Asha's Maua Group

texts.en:
Asha is 25 years old and is a married woman with a 4-year-old child. Asha sells vegetables. She started in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Mwanaisha, Mariam J., Monica, Mariam Z. and Sophia, who sell clothing and food.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her buesiness.

loans.name: Carmelinha Alexandre

texts.en:
Carmelinha is 46 years old and originally from Majacaze in the Gaza Province. Carmelinha is single and has four children: one boy and three girls, one already married.

Carmelinha lived with her parents until 13 years old, when she moved to a Catholic school in the Inhambane Province. In 1976 she dropped out from the school and moved to the capital city Maputo to live with her brother. In Maputo Carmelinha concluded primary school and studied until the 3rd year of the commercial technical school.

In 1980 Carmelinha got married and went to live with her husband in Catembe. When she got divorced in 1986 Carmelinha was already doing some business selling oil and food products. In 1988 she got a job at a manufacturing company in Matola, where she worked until 2000. During that period she hired someone to work at her food stand.

Since 2001 Carmelinha has been dedicating herself to her food stands. She currently has two stands: one located in her backyard and another in one of Catembe’s markets. Carmelinha’s older daughter is helping her with one of the stands. Carmelinha works from 6:30am to 7:00pm and buys all her products in Maputo. During summertime and on weekends Carmelinha reports higher sales. She makes daily sales of MTn 800, but towards the end of the month it can reach MTn 2,000 per day. Carmelinha’s most solid products are potatoes, onions, peanuts, beans and plastic bags. Carmelinha has a cashbook and reports a monthly profit of around MTn 500.

Carmelinha had already asked for previous loans to Hluvuku and has repaid them without problems. Carmelinha is very satisfied with the loans, as it has helped her business improve and her monthly income increase. With this loan of MTn 9,000 Carmelinha intends to buy merchandise such as sugar, beans, butter, peanuts, eggs and soap to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy sugar, beans, butter, peanuts, eggs and soap to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en: Akenese P., 34, is married with one child. She has 5 years of experience in the handicrafts business and her husband helps out with the business doing the carving and crafting. She sells to the village and general public 3 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~$166 USD). SPBD loans are Akenese’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will be used to improve business and help out with family.

loans.use: Akenese would like to purchase varnish, paint, etc. for her handicrafts business.

loans.name: Hawa's Jitahidini Group

texts.en:
Hawa is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children, aged 10, 7, and 1. Hawa earns income selling charcoal, firewood and bites. Every day, she works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m., earning a monthly profit of about US$25.

In the past, Hawa has taken out a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania which she used to expand her business. She now hopes to receive another loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses dealing with clothing and firewood sales.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and firewood for sale

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 37 años, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos que están estudiando y son su razón de ser. 
Por las mañanas trabaja en un hospedaje como personal de limpieza, y desde hace 8 años, vende comida por las noches, ya que su vivienda se encuentra ubicada en un buen lugar, el cual es muy transitado. Lo  que le gusta de su trabajo es que se socializa y conoce a mucha gente.
Sonia trabaja para los gastos permanentes de su hogar y sobre todo, para la educación de sus hijos, para  ella lo más importante, es salir adelante.
Con el dinero prestado se implementará con utensilios de cocina (ollas, platos, tazas, cubiertos, entre otras.) para posteriormente, poner un restaurante.
texts.en:
Sonia is 37 years old and she is a single mother to three children. They are currently in school and they are her reason for living.

In the mornings she works in a home provinding cleaning services. And for the last 8 years she has been seling foods in the evenings, especially good is that her home is in a well-visited location. What she loves about her work is that she gets to socialize and meet lots of people.

Sonia works to cover the household expenses but above all, she works to pay for her kids' education. For her that is the most important thing.

With the loan she will purchase kitchen wares (pots, plates, cups, cutlery, etc.), so that she can later on set up a small restaurant.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase kitchen wares to improve her business of selling foods.

loans.name: Paz Irasema

texts.es:
Irsaema inició el negocio por necesidad ya que se salió de trabajar para cuidar a su hija lo cual disminuyo el ingreso de su hogar y encontró la forma de ganar dinero sin descuidar a su hija vendiendo por catalogo a buen precio bolsas para dama, comenzó hace 4 años por recomendación de una amiga.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para surtir pedidos que tiene pendientes y también buscar nuevos clientes, tener mercancías para ofrecer en directo.
texts.en:
Irsaema started her own business out of necessity after she left work to care for her daughter, thus losing household income. She found a way to earn money and still care for her daughter by selling women’s bags at good prices. Following the recommendation of a friend, she started her business in catalog sales 4 years ago.

She needs a loan of $250 which she will repay in 3 months and which she will use to fill outstanding orders, find new customers, and buy merchandise to offer in direct sales.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Idi

texts.ru: Сафоев Иди житель района Файзабод.Возраст 40 лет,женат,имеет  8 детей. Образование незаконченное высшее.По специальности агроном.Заработная плата маленькая,поэтому клиент дополнительно занимается куплей продажей фруктов.Иди скупает у местных жителей фрукты и реализует их на рынке.Бизнес является основным источником  дохода его большой семьи.Кредит нужен клиенту что бы увеличить денежный оборот.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Idi S. lives in the Fayzabad region. He is forty years old, married, and has eight children. He did not finish a college degree. He is an agronomist by profession. His wages are very low, and therefore the client buys and sells fruit as well. He buys fruit from locals and sells it at the market. This business is the primary source of income for this large family. The client requires a loan in order to increase turnover. He plans to pay off the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing turnover

loans.name: Goddey

texts.en: Goddey O. is single and he is 26 years old. He sells frozen foods and he has a cool room from where he sells them. Goddey wants to purchase more frozen foods to enable him to meet the demands of his customers. He hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more frozen foods to sell. He is a LAPO client. Goddey says "thank you" to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Kwami

texts.en: Kwami A. is a 37-year-old married father who lives and works in the village of Wome.  In the local language, Ewe, his first name indicates that he was born on Saturday.  To provide for his family, Yawo picks up passengers and their baggage along the road, as seen in this photo, and drops them off at their destination.  This service is always in demand in Wome, as there is no electricity in this village and people must often travel further than walking distance to take care of business.  Yawo has asked for this loan from Kiva so that he can buy a new motorcycle in order to satisfy his customers. With the profits he will earn from his business, Yawo can continue to send his children to school and provide his community with this essential service.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia, a sus 33 años viene conviviendo desde hace 13 con su pareja, tienen 3 hijos y uno en camino. Todo este tiempo ha trabajado en la compra y venta de fruta de acuerdo a la temporada, y hay días en que tiene que ir a las chacras a las 4.00am para comprar a los agricultores que ya tienen preparando sus productos para el mejor postor, por ello que Silvia tiene que madrugar para seleccionar las frutas y luego comprarlas. Para Silvia, años atrás esta labor le parecía muy pesada, pero ya se adecuó porque le es mucho más rentable, sobre todo en los meses de enero a marzo cuando vende frutas cítricas, luego viene la temporada de los plátanos hasta los meses de mayo, en este tiempo no va mucho a las chacras, solo espera comprar de los que llevan al mercado, llegando a vender solo de 20 a 25 javas de frutas, cada java consta de 12 kilos de naranjas o mandarinas. Mientras que está bien la demanda en el mercado la venta de frutas le sale el doble de ganancia, o de lo contrario busca vender paltas que son mucho más delicadas. Lo dificultoso en este negocio es que las frutas de malogran, y a veces se compra a un precio, y luego baja, entonces pierden parte de su capital; a pesar de estos altibajos, Silvia está feliz con su actividad porque le permite llevar una vida decorosa. Silvia hace uso de un crédito de MFP por la quinta vez consecutiva, todo este tiempo ha pagado con mucha responsabilidad todas las cuotas fijadas y jamás cayo en morosidad. El dinero solicitado lo derivará a la compra de fruta por camionadas, para que de este modo las envíe directamente a la capital, ya que ganará mucho más que en su puesto y en un menor tiempo.
texts.en:
Silvia is 33 years old and has lived with her common-law husband for 13 years. They have three children and one on the way. All this time Silvia has dealt in seasonal fruit, and there are days when she has to be at the farms at 4:00 a.m. to buy from farmers who sell to the highest bidder. For this reason she has to be up early to choose the fruit and then purchase it. In the past this work seemed very burdensome, but she has become accustomed to it because it is more profitable. In general she sells citrus fruit from January to March, then banana season runs until May. During that time she does not go to the farms frequently, but waits to buy from those who bring 20-25 javas of fruit to the market. Each java is equivalent to 12 kilograms of oranges or tangerines. When demand in the marketplace is high, she makes double the profit from the sale of fruit. When it is not, she tries to sell avocados, which are more delicate. What is difficult about this business is that fruit spoils, and at times one buys at one price, but then it drops, resulting in a loss of capital. Despite the ups and downs, Silvia is content with her business because it permits her to lead a decent life. This is the fifth time in a row that Silvia has taken out a loan with Kiva, and each time she has made her loan payments and never fallen into arrears. The money that she has requested will go towards the purchase of fruit by the truckload, because this way she can send it directly to the capital where it will earn much more in a shorter period of time than if she sold it from her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit to send to Lima for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a thirty-five year old married woman with two children. For the past four years, Mary has been selling maize and ‘gari’. Gari is produced from cassava and it is high in carbohydrates. She obtains her supplies from the farming communities and retails to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy maize and gari in bulk to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to pay her children’s educational fees.

Mary is a member of a community group called "To God be the Glory" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To procure ‘gari’ for re-sale

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor Alejandro Torres  vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora Aida Chuilla y su hijo.
El señor Alejandro es rentista de la administración publica, y su esposa es comerciante en un mercadito de su zona.
El crédito solicitado es para el trazado y traslado de tierra de la parte posterior de su vivienda, nivelado que posibilitara una nueva construcción y la estabilización del suelo.
Esta es la octava vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 1998.
texts.en:
Alejandro Torres has his own house, in the Pasankeri zone on the west side of the city of La Paz, with his wife, Aida Alejandra lives on a pension from the local municipality and his wife is a merchant in a small market in their area. The loan will be used for the leveling and hauling of soil from the back of his house, which will make possible building on it and putting down a floor. This is the eighth loan that they have requested and the socioeconomic analysis performed qualifies them favorably to receive this loan. He has been a client of IMPRO since 1998.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses for leveling ground and hauling of soil from rear of house

loans.name: Phourng

texts.en:
Phourng T., 38, is asking for a loan to buy a motorcycle so she can transport fish quickly to her customers.  She currently makes a living selling fishes in Kok Tlok Market and generates an income of $6.50 per day to help her family.  T.'s business is running very well and she has gained more profit.

She is married with three children who are teenagers who go to school.  Her husband, Mr. Preang, 40, is a local motorcycle taxi driver.  Overall, they have established a family with six members who live in Siem Reap province in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en: Elisapeta A., 42, is married with four children. The funds from her SPBD loan were needed to start up her school canteen business: she needed a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a barrel of oil, a gas stove, and pots. She sells to the students five days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about $208). SPBD loans are Elisapeta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. This is her first SPBD loan.

loans.use: To buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a barrel of oil, a gas stove, and pots.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 20 años, es una joven con muchos deseos de superación, vive en la casa de sus padres y tiene muchos deseos de sobre salir en la vida. Desde muy niña se dedico a la crianza de ganado, esa siempre fue la activad de su familia, ahora ella tiene su propio ganado y los alimenta muy bien, porque sabe que del buen estado de sus reses dependerán las ganancias que obtendrá por su venta. Rosa lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es alimentar a sus animales, puesto que siente que les da el cariño que se merecen, pero lo más difícil es tener que llevar su ganado hasta las ferias de las ciudades de Huancane y Juliaca, que es donde vende sus reses. Para el futuro espera poder incrementar el ganado que tiene actualmente, para así tener unos mejores ingresos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y sabe que tiene que cumplir con los pagos de todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los 500 soles que solicita comprará más forraje (pasto) para alimentar mejor a sus animales.
texts.en:
Rosa, 20, is a young woman with a great desire to overcome her circumstances. She lives in her parents' home and greatly desires to get ahead in life. She has raised livestock since she was small, which was always the business of her family. Now she has her own livestock that she feeds well, because she knows that her earnings from their sale depend on the well being of her animals. She has been doing this for 4 years, and what she enjoys the most is feeding the animals, feeling that she is giving them the care they deserve; the most difficult part is having to take her stock to the markets in the cities of Huancane and Jeliaca, which is where she sells her herds. For the future, she hopes to be able to increase her current herd in order to increase her income. This is her first loan through MFP, and she knows that she has to fulfill each payment on time. She is a happy and supportive member of her communal bank. With the $175 that she is requesting, she will buy more fodder (grass) to better feed her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of feed for her livestock

loans.name: Govana Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Govana Elizabeth A. M. tiene 33 años, vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa, tiene 2 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Govana inició su negocio con la venta de galletas y bebidas gaseosas en un kiosco ubicado en su casa, ahora ha surtido su negocio con cerveza y golosinas.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II, lo invirtió en la compra de golosinas y galletas.
Con este crédito de 2000 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de cerveza y vinos.
Govana tiene como sueño poner una bodega surtida con abarrotes.
texts.en:
Govana Elizabeth A. M. is 33 years old and lives in the Florencia de Mora district in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Perú.  She completed her Secondary school education, and has 2 sons that depend on her financially. Govana started her business selling cookies and soft drinks from a kiosk located in her house. She has now also supplied her enterprise with beer and snacks. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from her cooperative bank, United for a Better Future II, she invested in the purchase of snacks and cookies. She will invest this loan of 2000 soles into the purchase of beer and wine. Govana’s dream is to have a store supplied with groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beer and wine.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
“Due to the economic crisis, life has become difficult, some people are hopeless about their future,” says Marilyn C.. 

No matter what the situation is, Marilyn strongly believes that there is still hope. She is a determined entrepreneur who tried but was unable to afford a college education. Marilyn is doing her best to give her three children the education that she was not able to attain. 

Marilyn manages a little village store. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 in order to purchase additional products to sell. Her husband manages their little parcel of farm land. They help each other to maintain their livelihood for the future of their children.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: cultivation of food crops

loans.name: Elizabeth Jepwambok

texts.en:
Elizabeth is forty-seven years old, married, and a mother of three.  She operates two "posho" mills; one is in Kapsoya and another one is in Illuah, both neighborhoods within Eldoret.  Posho mills grind staple grains such as corn and wheat.

Elizabeth has been operating this business for the last fifteen years and from the profit she gets from her business, she has managed to educate her three children, and feed and clothe her family.  She has serviced four other loans from KADET and hopes with this fifth loan she will be able to repair and service her posho mills and offer better services to her customers who are also within Eldoret.

In future, Elizabeth hopes to diversify her business, buy a plot of land, and build residential houses for rental purposes. She also intends to educate her children to Master's degree level.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within these communities.

loans.use: To repair and service "posho" mills

loans.name: Clara

texts.es: Clara es una mujer muy trabajadora, dedicada al progreso de su familia, la cual está conformada por su esposo y sus 2 hijos, con quienes vive en la casa que compró junto a su esposo. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, gracias a la invitación de una amiga, quien la motivó a vender cosméticos, desde entonces trató siempre de realizar las mejores ventas durante el mes y entregar a tiempo los pedidos a sus clientes, quienes se encuentran muy contentas con las atenciones que les brinda. En esta actividad dedica gran parte del día, porque hay que visitar constantemente a sus clientas para mostrarles las nuevas ofertas de productos y de la misma forma, busca nuevos clientes que incrementen sus pedidos e ingresos. Ahora, Clara tiene proyectado instalar un pequeño espacio para la venta de productos en su casa, pues cuenta con gran cantidad en stock por vender, por ello espera poder ampliar su casa, en un futuro cercano, para abrir un bazar, ya que vender adicionalmente otros productos le ayudaría a progresar como comerciante. Ella es nueva en Microfinanzas PRISMA y espera trabajar con responsabilidad dentro de la institución, ya que su interés es permanecer por varios años para mejorar su negocio. Los 1500 soles que solicita le permitirán comprar una vitrina para exhibir sus productos de belleza en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Clara is a very hardworking woman who is dedicated to her family’s progress. Her family is comprised of her husband and her 2 children, with whom she lives in the house that she and her husband bought. For 10 years she has been selling beauty products thanks to the invitation of her friend, who motivated her to sell cosmetics. Ever since then, she has always tried to be the top seller of the month and deliver the products to her customers on time. They are in turn very happy with her customer service. She works in the business for the better part of the day because she has to constantly visit her customers to show them the new products. In so doing, she looks to add new customers who will increase their purchases and her income. Clara is now planning to set up a small sales area in her house where she can sell beauty products because she has a big stock. She is planning on expanding her house in the near future so that she can open up a miscellaneous store because selling additional items will help her grow as an entrepreneur. She is new to the Microfinanzas PRISMA team, and she hopes to work responsibly within the institute because it is of interest to her to stay there to improve her business. The 1,500.00 PEN that she is requesting will help her purchase a display cabinet in which she can place her beauty products at home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase display cabinet

loans.name: Enea

texts.en:
Anea is a member of the Idunda East borrower group in Kihesa,Iringa,she is 45 years old woman she is married and a mother of 5 children.Her children are aged 30,28,18,16,14 years.she also cares for other 1 dependent.
Enea started her own food business selling vegetable 27 years,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximeatly 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Enea`s first loans from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more vegetable.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Enea hopes to save more money,pay school fees,get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en: Visitacion P. is from the village of Tungawan, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 51 years old, is separated from spouse, and has three adult children. Visitacion operates a clothing-sales business, selling clothes to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Visitacion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods and drinks. She also sells firewood in wholesale to her customers. She loves selling firewood because she has a lot of customers who patronize her firewood business. She is married with five children and she is 43 years old. She hopes for the loan amount of 140,000 NGN to purchase more firewood to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase firewood for sale

loans.name: Joy's Group

texts.en: K. Joy is the leader of her lending group in Kampala. She is a married lady with 3 children all in secondary school as she takes care of other orphans. Joy has a stationery shop business on Kampala road that has been in existence for 9 years and she is able to make 100,000/= as profits a week. Her major challenge is the lack of enough capital to boost her stationery shop since she has the good customer care skills for a successful business. She also hopes to have a successful and healthy home. Joy needs a loan to help increase her stock by buying more new books and other stationery. She is such a friendly and hard working lady.

loans.use: Buying more new books and other stationery for her shop.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is married and has a child. She is 39 years old. She sells provisions at her house. She hopes for the loan amount of 80,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a forty-one year old businesswoman. She resides, together with her family, in the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. She is married and has three children who are all studying. Imelda dreams to succeed in her business. She says that no matter how big the trials she is facing, she is always optimistic to help her husband provide for their daily needs especially towards the education of their children. She hopes to uplift her family’s general living conditions. With the help of her husband and generous people around, she believes that someday she will become successful.

Imelda is engaged in hog-raising. She wishes to increase the number of pigs to be raised for her to acquire more income. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 4,000 to purchase feed to sustain the healthy growth of her hogs. Imelda shared that, with her perseverance, she can somehow purchase another pig to raise.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her hog

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria, D. 51 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y solidaria. Vive en su casa propia junto a su menor hija, Elizabeth D. 10 años, y lo que más desea es tener una buena vida.

Los tejidos artesanales que realiza son muy novedosos y llamativos, ella los venD. en el puesto que tiene en la explanada “Laguna Temporal” (lugar donD. se realizan ferias en la ciudad D. Juliaca); sus clientes prefieren comprarle porque ofrece muy buenos precios, además que es una vendedora muy carismática y persuasiva.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es tejer, es por eso que siempre hace modelos novedosos, lleva 10  años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tejer los Chullos (prenda D. vestir para la cabeza), que son lo que más se venden a los turistas.
Para más adelante, espera poner una tienda más granD. donD. pueda vender sus tejidos.

Maria se encuentra en su tercer préstamo con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar sin demora sus cuotas, para no perjudicarse y no meter en problemas a sus compañeras. Con los mil doscientos soles solicitados comprará más lana para producir más tejidos artesanales.
texts.en:
Maria, 51, is a very hard-working and supportive woman. She lives in her own house with her youngest daughter, ten year old Elizabeth. What she wants most of all is to have a good life. The knitted handicrafts that she makes are very original and striking. She sells them in a stand that she has in the Laguna Temporal esplanaD. (place where they have fairs in the city of Juliaca). Her customers prefer to buy from her because she offers very good prices. Also, she is a charismatic and persuasive saleswoman. What she likes best about her work is knitting. That is why she always makes original things. She has been doing this for ten years. The most difficult part is knitting the “Chullos” (article of clothing for the head), which is what she sells the most of to the tourists. Later, she hopes to have a larger store where she could sell her knitting. This is Maria’s third loan with MFP. She is prepared to make her payments on time. She does not want to harm or cause problems for her colleagues. She will use the 1,200 PEN that she is asking for to buy more wool to make her knitted handicrafts.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool

loans.name: Audemia

texts.es:
La señora Audemia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Dorcas de San Juan II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 33 años y es madre de 04 hijos, 03 que aun dependen de ella.

Audemia, lleva poco tiempo dedicándose a la venta  de mantequilla maní, ya que gracias a su espíritu y energía emprendedora que posee, ella decide iniciar su propio negocio, para generar ingresos propios y así aportar en los gastos del hogar.
