Se inicio con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00, poco a poco fue vendiendo mas y haciéndose mas conocida por sus clientes. Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará semanalmente kilos de mami.

Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Audemia belongs to the “Las Dorcas de San Juan II” Communal Bank district of Banda de Shilcayo, province of San Martín, department of San Martín. She lives with her partner, is 33 years old and is a mother of 4 children, 3 still depend on her.

Audemia has been selling peanut butter for a short time, and thanks to her spirit and enterprising energy, she has she decided to start her own business to have her own income and to help in the household expenses. She began with her first loan of S/. 300.00 and little by little she sold more and became very well known by her customers. With this loan of S/. 800.00 she will buy weekly kilograms of peanuts.

She is very satisfied with the work that she does and believes that the sacrifice is worth it so that she can see her dreams and goals come true that she has planned in her life. In the same way she is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Kiva's field partner) for supporting her and other women who wish to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kilograms of peanuts.

loans.name: Saranchimeg

texts.en:
Saranchimeg is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a wooden house in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Both of her sons, aged 11 and 7, attend a local secondary school and her husband is a driving instructor.

Saranchimeg operates a beauty products retail business in a rented stall at a local retail center. She began her business in 2005 after working for several years as a nurse. Currently, she has a working capital that exceeds 5,000,000 tugrugs (~3450 USD) and has a monthly net profit of 300,000-500,000 tugrugs (~205-345 USD).

Saranchimeg has gained a lot of experience in her four years of operation and would like to keep growing her business in the future. She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase a large amount of beauty products and to start selling phone cards at her business.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of beauty products and phone cards

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Margarita trabaja con nosotros desde año 2001 y fue progresando poco a poco con la ayuda de nuestros creditos, la Sra. Margarita vive con el esposo y con su hija mayor quien es madre soltera y a la que ayuda con los gastos de su hijo ya que la hija se separo del esposo, tambien podemos indicar que la cliente es bastante trabajadora y responsable pese a la avanzada edad de 62 años y aun se la ve con bastante dinamismo y un buen semblante, por todo lo mencionado se escogio a la cliente para el credito kiva.
texts.en:
Margarita has worked with us since 2001 and she has progressed little by little with the help of our loans. Margarita lives with her husband and older daughter, who is a single mother. She helps her with her son's expenses since her daughter is separated from her husband. We can also say that the client is very hardworking and responsible. Despite being 62 years old, her dynamism and good outlook are evident. Because of all of this, this client was chosen for the Kiva loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE OF MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Noris

texts.es: Noris, es una socia nueva, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 22 años, es soltera y estudiante de contabilidad en la Universidad Nacional de Ucayali. Eella se dedica a vender productos de belleza, esta actividad la realiza ofreciendo sus productos a sus amigos y compañeros de la Universidad. Noris forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, ella necesita de un crédito de 300 soles, que será invertido en productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, etc.		    El anhelo de Noris es tener una Ferretería bien surtida que le permita mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Noris is a new member, who lives in the district of Callería in Ucayali. She is 22 years old, is single and is an accounting student in the National University of Ucayali. She sells beauty products by offering her products to her friends and peers in the University. Noris is a member of the “Las Orquídeas” Community Bank, and she needs a loan for 300 PEN, which she will invest in beauty products, including creams, perfumes, etc. She wants to have a well-stocked hardware store to allow her to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Niño Ismael Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Niño Ismael está ubicado en el departamento D. Huancavelica, su actividad principal es la artesanía y el comercio. Inicia su segundo ciclo con un total D. 12 socias

Carmen, es soltera y tiene un hijo D. 5 años, después D. terminar sus estudios Carmen se prestó dinero D. sus padres para invertir en un negocio D. ventas D. útiles escolares, su mamá la invitó a participar en el bancomunal porque es socia antigua. DesD. que está en FINCA sus ventas han aumentado, porque pueD. invertir más dinero en su negocio, ha aprendido a ahorrar. El préstamo que solicita ahora le permitirá comprar una fotocopiadora y surtir su negocio D. cuadernos, lápices, lapiceros, colores y todo tipo D. útiles, para iniciar la campaña escolar. El sueño D. Carmen es tener su casa propia y su negocio propio.

Vilma, es casada tiene 3 hijos D. 16, 22 y  24  años, es su bancomunal aprendió a ahorrar, inició su negocio vendiendo ropa, gracias a los préstamos recibidos ha podido comprar estantes, ahora tambien venD. joyas, regalos y perfumes, ahora quiere aprovechar la campaña escolar e invertir e nuevo préstamo en la venta D. uniformes.

Mariluz, es soltera tiene un hijo D. 4 años, se inició en los negocios vendiendo cosméticos por catálogo, no tenía mucho capital y no recibía apoyo D. ninguna entidad financiera, una amiga le invitó a participar en los bancomunales D. FINCA, gracias a los préstamos tiene un poco mas D. capital, que lo invierte en la venta D. mercería como útiles, ganchos, peines, espejos y jabones. Con el préstamo solicitado comprará loncheras escolares y algunos juego didácticos. Su sueño es tener una joyería granD..
texts.en:
The Niño Ismael communal bank is located in the Department of Huancavelica. Its members' main activities are handicrafts and sales. It is starting its second loan cycle with a total of 12 members. Carmen is single and has a 5-year-old child. After finishing her studies, Carmen borrowed money from her parents to invest in a business selling school supplies. Her mother, who is a longtime member of the communal bank, invited Carmen to participate. During her time with FINCA, Carmen's sales have increased, because she can invest more money in her business, and she has learned to save. The loan she is now requesting will permit her to buy a photocopier and to stock her business with notebooks, pencils, pencil holders, drawing supplies and all types of useful products for the beginning of the school season. Carmen's dream is to have her own house and her own shop. Vilma is married and has 3 children, aged 16, 22 and 24. The communal bank, has helped her learn how to save. She started a business selling clothes, and thanks to the loans she has received, she has been able to buy shelves. Now she also sells jewelry, gifts and perfumes, and she would like to take advantage of the school season and invest the funds from the new loan in school uniforms to sell. Mariluz is single and has a 4-year-old child. She started a business selling cosmetics by catalog. She did not have much capital and did not receive support from any financial institution until a friend invited her to participate in the FINCA communal banks. Thanks to the loans, she has a little more capital, which she has invested in merchandise to sell, such as school supplies, hair clips, combs, mirrors and soaps. With the current loan, she will buy student lunchboxes and some educational games. Her dream is to have a large jewelry store.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise such as school supplies

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Mrs. Belen S., 61 years of age, married, is a resident of Aquino, Tangub City. She is married to Rolando S., a farmer with an average net income of 250.00 PHP a week only. With these financial conditions, they have felt significant hardships to meet their basic daily needs. She decided to engage in snack vending and now she’s been in this type of business for 20 years. She is earning an average net income of 1,500.00 PHP a month. This amount is so beneficial to the family. She joined PAGLAUM MPC last year.  As a 1st cycle borrower, she was given the privilege to avail an amount of 3,000.00 PHP to add to her capital for her existing snack vending business in order to help her husband in meeting their family needs. The future income from this business will be used for daily basic needs, savings and loan repayments. She is hoping that this business will become more successful and more progressive.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her snack vending activity.

loans.name: Mrs. Sony Pum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank consists of nine people in Kang Pou village in Takeo province. All the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sony P. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. 

She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare field to cultivate rice. She now faces a small problem in that she does not have enough money to hire a laborer to plow her rice field. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan.

Mrs. Sony P. is a widow with four children who are all attending the local school.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow her rice field.

loans.name: Soth

texts.en: Soth T. sells a few types of vegetables at a local market in the province, earning $3 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. She is married and resides with her young child in Takeo province, Cambodia. The family is also supported by her husband who operates his tuk tuk (motorbike with compartment attached), earning $4 US per day. Their standard of living has improved since they have started these businesses. Soth T. is requesting a loan of $800 US to purchase a new motorbike. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva. T. is shown with her husband in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
El señor Marcelo Calderón vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona  de San Pedro, de la ciudad de La Paz, con sus dos hijos.
El señor Marcelo trabaja como empleado en una empresa telefónica de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de las gradas de la casa donde vive, ya que por la antigüedad de la construcción se encuentra deteriorado.
Esta es la sexta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Marcelo Calderón lives with his 2 children in his parents' house in the San Pedro neighborhood of the city of La Paz. Marcelo works as an employee in a telecommunications company in this city, and his income supports his family. The loan he requests is to renovate the stairs in his home, since his home was built a long time ago and the stairs are deteriorated. This is the 6th time that he has requested a loan, and he was qualified favorably by a socioeconomic analysis conducted by IMPRO to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to renovate the stairs in his home

loans.name: José Eufemio

texts.es: El señor C. G., trabaja como obrero en una institución, pero también tiene una pequeña parcela de tierra la cual siembra maíz en el invierno, tiene tres hijos en edad escolar los que tiene que preparar para el futuro, con este préstamo cubrirá unos gastos en la educación de sus hijos, les comprara también ropa para el colegio. Con los préstamos anteriores ha realizado siembras en su parcela y también ha cubierto unos gastos personales.
texts.en:
El señor C. G., trabaja como obrero en una institución, pero también tiene una pequeña parcela de tierra la cual siembra maíz en el invierno, tiene tres hijos en edad escolar los que tiene que preparar para el futuro, con este préstamo cubrirá unos gastos en la educación de sus hijos, les comprara también ropa para el colegio. Con los préstamos anteriores ha realizado siembras en su parcela y también ha cubierto unos gastos personales.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Educación de sus hijos y compra de ropa

loans.name: Nehemias Israel

texts.es: El señor Nehemías Israel C. D. León, D. diecinueve años D. edad,  vive con su esposa, tiene dos años trabajando como Albañil, además su esposa se dedica a la amarrada para cortes típicos, para el sostenimiento D. la pareja, el señor por la necesidad D. adquirir herramientas para mejorar su trabajo, por esa razón se acercó a la Asociación ASDIR para adquirir un préstamo para poder comprar sus herramientas D. trabajo, la que ayudará a obtener mejores oportunidades y opción D. trabajo, la que ayudará a mejorar sus condiciones D. trabajo y calidad D. vida familiar.
texts.en:
El señor Nehemías Israel C. D. León, D. diecinueve años D. edad, vive con su esposa, tiene dos años trabajando como Albañil, además su esposa se dedica a la amarrada para cortes típicos, para el sostenimiento D. la pareja, el señor por la necesidad D. adquirir herramientas para mejorar su trabajo, por esa razón se acercó a la Asociación ASDIR para adquirir un préstamo para poder comprar sus herramientas D. trabajo, la que ayudará a obtener mejores oportunidades y opción D. trabajo, la que ayudará a mejorar sus condiciones D. trabajo y calidad D. vida familiar.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de Herramientas

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia A. is from the village of Tambagan, Medina mIsamis Oriental. She is 54 years old and widowed with four adult children. To make a living, Cecilia owns a sari-sari (variety) store selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Cecilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Cecilia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Beva

texts.es:
La señora Beva es comerciante, la misma cuenta con un puesto en el mercado numero 1 de Villarrica. 
Su cónyuge el señor Gustavo Chamorro el mismo también es comerciante, y a la ves es mecánico de maquinas de alta revolución, ellos viven en la ciudad de Villarrica, empezaron con el negocio en ventas de ropas hace mas de 5 años por cuenta propia, sus amistades le decían que su negocio era muy rentable económicamente, entonces los mismos empezaron a gestionar los documentos para ingresar en el mercado solicitando un puesto, lo cual se les acepto rápidamente.
Solicita el préstamo para la  compra de más mercaderías al por mayor ya que aumento bastante su venta esta temporada y no lo quiere desaprovechar.
texts.en:
Beva is a businesswoman; she has a spot in the Number One Market in Villarrica. Her husband, Mr. Gustavo Chamorro, is a businessman as well; he also works as a mechanic for high-revolution machines. They live in the city of Villarrica. The pair began their clothing sales business more than five years ago with their own capital. Their friends kept telling them that their business could be very profitable, and so they began to go through the paperwork to apply for a spot in the Number One Market. They were quickly accepted for the spot. Beva and Gustavo are asking for a loan to buy more wholesale merchandise. As their sales have increased substantially this season, they do not want to lose out on the opportunity to grow their business.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise - "kepi" style hats, glasses, clothing, general accessories - for retail sale

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak V. is 30 years old. He lives in Ghashtarak village in the Ijevan area. Artak is married and has two preschool-aged daughters. Since 2008 he has been working in village administration, and at the same time he is engaged in pig breeding and land cultivation.

In the future Artak hopes to increase his number of pigs. Recently began building a new pigsty for his pigs, because the old one is tumbledown and very small. He has completed building the walls for the new pigsty, and now he needs a 300,000 AMD loan to roof it.

loans.use: To roof his new pigsty

loans.name: Kivule Group

texts.en:
Gikaro C., aged 38, is married with 4 children, aged 13, 10, 7 and 3. He has had a poultry business now for 3 years.  He works from 8am to 6pm daily and he is able to make a monthly profit of about $268.

This will be Gikaro’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to buy chicken feed and medicines. He has successfully paid back the loan. He hopes for a loan to buy 400,000 chicks. 

Gikaro will share this loan with his loan group,  Kivule, which totals 20 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture Gikaro is second from left, front row, in a white shirt.

loans.use: To buy 400,000 chicks.

loans.name: Vilma Elena

texts.es: Vilma Elena tiene 42 años, su actividad es una pulpería, hace más de 2 años que se dedica a este medio de vida. Desde muy pequeña, Vilma aprendió a trabajar es una labor que ha estado en su familia desde hace muchos años, esta actividad le dio el capital necesario para iniciar su negocio en al vivienda, la cual le está dando muy buenas ganancias, convirtiéndose poco a poco en su actividad principal. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es la comunicación que tiene con sus vecinos cuando entran a su establecimiento a comprarle algo, en donde considera que para tener lo que ha logrado tiene que sacrificarse y permanecer en su tienda todo el día. Con el tiempo espera ampliar las instalaciones de su negocio para brindarle a sus clientes una mejor comodidad. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos como golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas y detergentes.
texts.en:
Vilma Elena is 42 years old and has been managing a store for more than two years to earn a living. At a young age she learned that work is an important part of her family’s life and has been for many years. By working she was able to earn enough capital to start a business from home. Now that she generates good earnings, she has gradually made her business her primary activity. What she enjoys most about her work is being able to converse with the neighbors who come by her store to shop. Vilma says that everything she has achieved was a result of sacrifice and being able to stay at her store the entire day. Over time she hopes to expand her facilities so that her customers will be more comfortable.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products such as candy, soft drinks, bread, cookies, and detergents.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more ladies bags

loans.name: Roque Plutarco

texts.es: El Sr. Roque Plutarco D. H. es trabajador activo de la  Alcaldía Municipal San Rafael del sur tiene  cinco  años de trabajarle a esta institución desempeñándose como Electricista. Ha tenido  cinco créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para comprar materiales de construcción y mejorar su casa de habitación los créditos le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Roque Plutarco D. H. is an active worker for the municipality of San Rafael del Sur. He has worked for this institution for five years, in the position of Electrician. He has had five loans with CEPRODEL, and he has used all of them to buy construction materials and improve the house where he lives. The loans have benefited him greatly, because they have allowed him to improve his living conditions and those of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying beams and metal sheets, and paying for labor

loans.name: Joseph Guthonda

texts.en:
Joseph has been operating his taxi in Naivasha town for the last three years now.  He is 31 years old, married to Beth Muthoni and they have one child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid off his first loan well and on time. He is planning to use the loan amount as top up to his savings and to buy a new taxi.

Joseph plans to buy a minibus in future which he will use for public transport.

loans.use: To top up and buy a new taxi.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia S. is a seperated woman who lives in Purok Katipunan, Barangay Mansilang, Madredijos, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: dried fish/squid vending and a general store. She has a 22 year old child who is currently working and helps her out. Antonia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Antonia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 28,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 14,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 28,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she could continue to save up for the future and family needs. Antonia S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Elie

texts.en:
Elie C. is from the village of Mapulog, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 39 years old, widowed and has 3 school-aged children. Elie owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells a variety of ocean caught fish like bangus and bilong-bilong. She also harvests and sells coconuts for extra income. Elie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Madethan

texts.en:
Madethan H. is 60 years old and lives with his wife in Bayan-Ulgiy province, Mongolia. He and his wife live in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife is retired after working for an organization while Madethan currently operates a taxi service in his town. He started driving a taxi in 1999 and has since found success. 

Over the many years of running this business, he has gained not only a lot of experience but many permanent and loyal customers. His daily revenue from taxi service is between 10,000 and 15,000 MNT and 50 percent of this is considered net profit. In addition, he purchases and transports a car from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, to sell it at the local market to supplement his earnings. 

He has used his earnings to stabilize his family's financial situation and improve their quality of life. For the future, he hopes to continue his business' stable operation and save money. He is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts for his car as well as to buy three tons of coal and grass at 500,000 MNT as preparation for the winter.

loans.use: To purchase auto parts for his car

loans.name: Nom

texts.en: Nom K. is 27, married, and has two young children.  She and her husband live in the Takeo province. To earn a living, she has been working as a garment factory worker and is able to make about $2 every day. Her husband sells coconuts and earns $3 per day. Currently, her husband walks his trailer selling coconuts.  Nom K. is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike to attach to the trailer for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is a very talented lady. She started an embroidery business a few years ago to financially support her family. She lives in the city of Multan, which is the fourth largest city in Pakistan known for its history and tombs. She resides in the area called Muhallah Rahimabad, in a 2-room brick house with her family. Her business has given her a good income because in the city of Multan, people like to wear embroidered dresses in their normal routine.  

Her husband is involved in a dairy business and runs a dairy shop in the market. Zubaida has 6 children, but only her eldest daughter is able to get an education due to limited financial resources. Her daughter is studying in 3rd class. 

Zubaida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery items such as cloth, beads, colored thread and sketches to make more embroidered dresses for her clients. She is hopeful that an investment will be profitable for her business and her business will grow further. Zubaida is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy embroidery items for embroidery business

loans.name: Orlando Jose

texts.es:
Orlando es un hombre muy trabajador, padre de familia de dos hijos. Casado. Hoy en día trabaja en servicio de taxi siendo el vehículo propio, adquirido con muchos esfuerzos.
Entre las dificultades es lo altos costos de la gasolina, lo que los clientes no abordan por no pagar la carrera. Pero hay días buenos en donde puede equilibrar sus gastos.
Es atreves de los financiamientos que ha logrado dar mantenimientos a su vehículo lo que para él, es de gran beneficio para seguir dando un mejor servicios a sus clientes.
Son cinco  ciclos lo que ha venido trabajando, con este nuevo préstamo hará compra de llantas, batería, tapizado y mano de obra. Lo cual lo hace cada diez oh doce meses.
texts.en:
Orlando is a very hard-working man.  He has two children.  He currently works providing taxi services in his own vehicle which he acquired through a lot of hard work.

One of the difficulties he has in his business is dealing with high gasoline costs which his customers don't help to cover when they skip without paying for their journeys.  However, there are also good days in which he can balance his expenses.

Through loans, Orlando has managed to keep his vehicle in good working order which, for him is a great help toward providing a better service to his customers.

Orlando has been through five loan cycles.  He will use this new loan to buy tires, a car battery, upholstery and labor.  He does this every ten or twelve months.

loans.use: To have maintenance work done on his taxi, buying a battery and tires.  He does this every twelve months, so that he can provide a good service to his customers since it is his source of income

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma C. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Poblacion, Ginatilan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: BBQ food vending, coconut wine, and pig fattening. Her husband, Julito C. who is 39 years old, earns a living as a motorcycle driver. They have 3 children who are 7 to 12 years old. All are currently going to school. 

Vilma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 7 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Vilma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 22,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 5,500 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 8th cycle loan, she is borrowing 23,000 PHP, which she intends to use to pay for more stock to sell so that she can continue to support her family's living expenses and save up for their future security. Vilma C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Marta Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Marta es una mujer trabajadora, con 52 años de edad, hoy en día labora  a una empresa privada como calificador de póliza de seguro en donde lleva varios años en el cargo y que gracias a sus ahorros ha logrado cubrir todos sus gastos como: alimentación, gastos básicos, gastos personales y apoyo  a sus hijos.
Con este préstamo quiere enverjar y asegurar puertas y ventana en su casa de habitación, lo que para ella es de gran relevancia esta mejora. Ya que se le metieron a robar lo que le causo una gran impresión ya que con mucho esfuerzo ha comprado sus artículos. 
Los materiales  a comprar es: soldadura, varillas de hierro, pintura anticorrosiva, cemento, arena, para hacer esta mejora.
texts.en: Marta is a hard-working woman, age 52. She currently works for a private company as an insurance policy qualifier. She has had this job for several years, and thanks to her savings she has been able to cover all of her costs such as: food, basic costs, personal costs, and support for her children. She wants to use this loan to strengthen and secure the doors and windows in her home. This improvement is very important for her, as she has been robbed. This has had a strong effect on her, since she had purchased her possessions with a lot of hard work. The materials that she will buy are: a solder, iron bars, non-corrosive paint, cement, and sand for this improvement.

loans.use:
She will purchase construction materials such as: cement, sand,
iron bars, and paint to secure her door and windows

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: Roberto Carlos tiene 26 años, su actividad es la venta y comercialización de chatarra. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este medio de vida, por lo que ha sido reconfortante para ella obtener este negocio que le proporciona lo necesario a sus 3 hijos comida, vestimenta y educación. El siempre ha demostrado lo responsable que es con su familia, inicio con esfuerzos propios ya que no tenía un trabajo estable que le proporcionar un ingreso diario. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de chatarra variada.
texts.en: Roberto Carlos is 26 years old. He works selling and buying scrap. He has been working in this field for two years which is why it's been comforting to find a business that allows him to provide food, clothing, and education for his three children. He has always been responsible towards his family. He started in this business because he didn't have a stable job that provided a daily income. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of additional scrap.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more radios and watches

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en: Glenda is a married woman who lives in Quezon, Palawan.  She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store and a fishing business.  Her husband Alejandro, who is 51 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have six children who are between 11 and 24 years old.  Glenda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Glenda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.  Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy stock for the store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and for family needs. Glenda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Gloria Elcidia

texts.es:
Doña Gloria, de 50 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, es comerciante de verduras, frutas y mariscos, vive con su familia, su esposo e hijos, tiene 27 años de dedicarse al negocio el cual aprendió de sus padres.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería (frutas, verduras), esta inversión la quiere hacer para mantenerse fuerte y atender la demanda, ayudando a mejorar su inventario, aumentar sus ventas y a generar mayores ingresos.
La aspiración de doña Gloria es tener un negocio amplio, con suficientes productos para la venta, cuenta con mucho carisma para atender a los clientes, espera que este préstamo sea la prosperidad para el negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Gloria, age 50, resides in Jiquilisco in the Department of Usulután. She is a merchant who sells vegetables, fruits, and seafood. Gloria lives with her family, which consists of her husband and children. She has been in this business for 27 years and learned the trade from her parents.

Gloria is requesting a loan to buy merchandise (fruits and vegetables). This investment will keep her business strong, enable her to keep up with demand, help improve her inventory, increase her sales, and result in better income.

Doña Gloria has aspirations to expand her business by having enough products to sell. She attends to her customers with great care and hopes that this loan will help her prosper in her business.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Jose Porifirio

texts.es:
José es padre de familia de 53 años de edad. Es casado y tiene 5 hijos menores aun dependientes de él. Viven en casa propia sin servicios básicos como luz y agua. La única fuente de agua es la que obtiene de una pequeña vertiente que pasa por su terreno. José vive en el distrito de San Felipe, una zona rural, en la provincia de Jaén.

Desde hace más de 30 años, José se dedica al cultivo de café, maíz, menestras y yuca. En la actualidad siembra 01 hectárea de café y proyecta cosechar entre los meses de abril y junio 4 quintales más de café, 20 quintales de menestras y 15 quintales de maíz. Desea invertir una parte de su crédito en el abono de su finca de café y hacer un deshierbo a su terreno. Considerando que el precio del café está alcanzando niveles que no tenía en años anteriores, el invertir en abono para aumentar su productividad es una buena opción. También, trabaja como albañilería y desea hacer unas pequeñas compras de artículos de carpintería. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles. José es muy trabajador y es bastante entregado a su familia. Siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo.
texts.en:
José is a 53-year-old father. He is married and has 5 minor children who are still dependent on him. They live in their own home, which does not have basic services such as electricity and water. The only source of water is a small stream which passes through their land. José lives in the district of San Felipe, a rural area, in the province of Jaén.

For more than 30 years, José has worked growing coffee, corn, beans and yuca. Currently, he has 1 hectare planted with coffee, and he expects to harvest between the months of April and June, obtaining 4 more quintals [large sacks] of coffee, 20 quintals of beans, and 15 quintals of corn. He would like to invest part of his loan in fertilizer for his coffee plantation, and also in removing weeds from his land. Considering that the price of coffee is rising to levels it did not reach in previous years, investing in fertilizer to increase productivity is a good option. He also works as a mason, and he would like to make some small purchases of articles for carpentry. For these reasons, he has decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 Peruvian new soles. José is very hard-working and extremely dedicated to his family. He is always trying to ensure their well-being and development.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee plantings and articles for carpentry

loans.name: Pikria

texts.en:
Pikria T. lives in the village of Kvishilori, Tskaltubo District. She is 23 years old and is married. She lives with her husband, children and mother-in-law. They have three children:  a four-year-old daughter and a one-year-old daughter and a three-year-old son. 

The family has three milk cows, whose milk is used to produce cheese which is the main source of income for the family. The cheese is sold on the local market by Pikria. She also makes dried persimmons and sells them on the market. 

With the requested 1,000 GEL Pikria wants to buy a bull, which will help her to till the land and grow some vegetables.

She hopes that this will increase the income of the family and she will use her increased income for the well-being of her children and of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase a bull.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther K. M., seen here in the photo, sells herbal health products.  She has been in this business for the last seven years. 

Through the trainings held by Faulu Kenya, she has learned some business skills that have helped her to run her business.  She needs to add stock of zinc and calcium products.  Therefore, she has requested 20,000 Kes.  

She dreams of expanding her business in five years.  She is also looking forward to owning a piece of land in the future.

loans.use: to add stock of zinc and calcium products

loans.name: Alpacoma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALPACOMA” iniciará su décimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Catalina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicio.
 
La señora Catalina,  indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de conocidos. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de ladrillera, el que viene trabajando hace seis años, conjuntamente su esposo. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para invertirlo en su negocio (fabricación de ladrillos), sitió donde trabaja toda su familia. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene ocho hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta sus beneficios, los ahorros y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The communal bank "ALPACOMA" is beginning its seventh term through Pro Mujer, at the Villa Exaltación Center.  It is comprised of eight members and has a board of directors that is chaired by Mrs. Catalina.  The communal bank members have different businesses, among which are commerce, production and services.

Mrs. Catalina joined Pro Mujer two years ago by invitation from acquaintances of hers.  Currently she has a brick-making business that she has been working at with her husband for six years.

The loan she is requesting now is to invest in her business (brick-making), where all of her family works.  This type of work lets her generate income to support her family, since she is in a common law marriage and and has eight children.

When asked why she likes Pro Mujer, she says its because of the benefits, savings and training.

loans.use: To invest in her business (brick-making)

loans.name: Terimberemuhinzi No45 Group

texts.fr: Clément est client d’ACB depuis 2011, il est membre du groupe Terimberemuhinzi, il est né au Rwanda, son éducation est primaire, il est marié, il a 3 enfants entre 12 et 7 ans, tous ses enfants vont à l’école. C’est son premier cycle de prêt, Clément va utiliser le prêt pour l’agriculture de riz, en achetant les insecticides et paiement de main d’œuvre. Sa stratégie est d’augmenter la surface à cultiver et l’utilisation des felitilisants pour augmenter la production agricole. Dans l’avenir, il veut être capable de s’autofinancer et éduquer ses enfants  jusqu'à l’université et avoir l’électricité dans sa maison. Clément est cultivateur des mais aussi.
texts.en: Clément has been a client of ACB since 2011. He is a member of  the  Terimberemuhinzi  group. He was born in Rwanda and has primary education. He is married, with three children from 12 to 7 years of age, all of whom are in school. This is his first loan cycle. Gratien will use his loan for rice farming: buying insecticides and paying for manual labor. His strategy is to enlarge his cultivated land and to use fertilizers to increase his agricultural production. In the future, he would like to be able to finance his business himself and provide for his children’s education through university level, and also to have electricity in his house. Clément also grows corn.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and pay for manual labor

loans.name: Emmerencia

texts.en:
Emerencia, who was born in 1955, is a widow with eleven children, one of whom is younger than 15. She lives in a four room house with her children. Emerencia joined GHAPE in 2009 and received a loan of 50,000 XAF, which was successfully repaid. The only problem that Emerencia faces in life is that she has to singlehandedly take care of her children since her husband died. She hates thinking of the deaths of her father, husband and son. She struggles to see that she takes care of the children her husband left behind, paying tuition fees, feeding them and catering to their health.

Emerencia is requesting a loan to purchase Irish potatoes. She plans to buy five bags of potatoes at 23,000 XAF each and she will use 20,000 XAF from her savings to pay for the transportation of her goods to the Belo weekly market. She believes her business will succeed because there is a ready market and her prices are moderate, which would encourage customers. Any profits made would be used to pay tuition fees for her children. Emerencia prefers a loan from GHAPE because a lower interest is charged and repayment is gradual.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Samun

texts.en:
Samun, 49 years old, is a weaver. She is a single mother with one daughter and she is also a weaver. They both can make $4 per day for their income. 

Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on transportation and $15 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy silk to weave and sell to get more income. She wants to extend her business to make more products and sell to other provinces. She also wants to repair her house because now it is not in good condition.

loans.use: To buy more silks to weave.

loans.name: Janyl's Group

texts.en:
Janyl, 34, is married and has two daughters and a son, all of whom study at school. In order to meet the family's needs, her husband has gone to work in Russia. Janyl is the leader of this group.

Ten years ago Janyl started farming. In this way she earns an additional 1,000 KGS to the family budget. With her loan Janyl wants to purchase mineral fertilizers for her farm.

In the future she wants to give all of her children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Sovong

texts.en: Sovong, 21 years old, is a Khmer traditional wedding musician and also buys old motorbikes to resell at a profit. His income is $7 per day. His wife stays home taking care of their children. Every month he has to spend $50 on food, $7 on electricity and $10 on other family expenses. He would like to request a loan of $1000 to purchase old motorbikes for resale. His motorbike reselling business is going well and he wants to expand by buying more motorbikes when he has enough money.

loans.use: To buy old motorbikes for resale

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 26 years-old.  She is married to a farmer and they are blessed with three children. With her husband, she works hard to continue to provide for the education of their children. While her husband does farming, she also makes an income from selling vegetables, fruits and food snacks around their village. She has been doing this for five years now and earns P200 each day.  

Marites would like to increase their income in order to save for future expenses so is asking for a loan to purchase a greater variety of fruits and vegetables, including cabbages and tomatoes, and dried fish to sell.  Marites hopes this loan will help increase amount of sales she get daily and enable them to financially support the education of her children until college.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of fruits and vegetables and dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi is a married woman with four children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, Mnyazi has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby.  She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 65,000, Mnyazi wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy flour and sugar to resell

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Em, 57, is a married woman with eight children. Six of her children are married and live in separate houses; her other two children are school-age.

She now generates her income by selling fish in a market near her house. From this business, she earns about $3 each day. To expand her business, Em would like to request some funding through HKL's partnership with Kiva. She will use this loan to purchase more fish to sell at the market. She hopes that this loan will increase her profit and allow her to widen her house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell at the market.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en: Lanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her business. Lanie has been in this business for 8 years. She earns additional income from raising pigs and selling soft drinks. Lanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Gloria Catalina

texts.es: Gloria Catalina: D. 25 años D. edad.ella se dedica a la crianza D. animales desD. hace 7 años ella nos cuenta que esta contenta porque sus animales han abundado y le da gracias a Dios por que le a dado la oportunidad D. obtener este negocio con la cual ella ayuda a su familia,y a podido salir adelante ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. animales ya que ella los compra pequeños y cuando esta grandes los venD. es asi como ella a prosperado nos cuenta que esta conciente D. que le falta capital para trabajar, el sueño D. ella es tener un corral mas granD. y tener mas animales para tener mejor ganacia.
texts.en: Gloria Catalina: D. 25 años D. edad.ella se dedica a la crianza D. animales desD. hace 7 años ella nos cuenta que esta contenta porque sus animales han abundado y le da gracias a Dios por que le a dado la oportunidad D. obtener este negocio con la cual ella ayuda a su familia,y a podido salir adelante ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. animales ya que ella los compra pequeños y cuando esta grandes los venD. es asi como ella a prosperado nos cuenta que esta conciente D. que le falta capital para trabajar, el sueño D. ella es tener un corral mas granD. y tener mas animales para tener mejor ganacia.

loans.use: Compra de animales para la venta.

loans.name: Chimarchaj 2 Group

texts.es:
La señora Maura Francisca es casada, tiene 27 años D. edad, cursó los 6 años D. educación primaria, tiene 5 hijos 3 D. los cuales estudian, se dedica a la confección D. prenda por encargo, inició  este trabajo cuando tenía 15 años y hasta el momento lleva 12 años D. experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica al mismo trabajo.

DeciD. organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar una maquina industrial y D. esa forma incrementar su productividad, en el futuro espera contar con una pequeña maquila. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la crianza D. animales, confección D. prendas y a la venta D. refacciones.
texts.en:
Maura Francisca is married. She is 27 years old and she finished six years of elementary education. She has five children and three of them are studying.  She makes garments to order. She started this work when she was 15 years old and she now has 12 years of experience. She has help from her husband who does the same type of work. 

She decided to organize a group in order to solicit a loan that will be used to purchase an industrial sewing machine. With this she can increase her productivity. In the future, she hopes to have a small factory. The other members in the group raise animals, make garments and sell spare parts.

loans.use: purchase an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Azamzhan

texts.ru: Аъзамжон женат имеет детей. Он занимается выращиванием и откормом крупного рогатого скота. От этого вида бизнеса он получает хорошие доходы. Для расширения своего бизнеса он хочет получить кредит. На полученный кредит он приобретет крупный рогатый скот и корм для них.
texts.en: Azamzhan is married and has children.  He is involved in raising and fattening up cattle.  He make a good profit from this business.  Azamzhan wants to obtain this loan to expand his business.  He wants use this loan to buy cattle and fodder for it.

loans.use: to buy cattle and fodder

loans.name: Phanny

texts.en:
Phanny, 41, is a motor taxi driver and his wife, Kimseng (pictured with him), 36, is a farmer. They live about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two sons and one daughter. One is a garment worker, one is in university and another one is in high school.

Phanny is applying for a loan of $1,200 to assist in his wife’s farming business by buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm. He will also use a part of the loan to pay school fees for his son who is in university.

loans.use: To assist in his wife’s farming business by buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide and to pay school fees for his son.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de cerdos, para poder incrementar el negocio, ya que depende de la granja y estos préstamos le han permitido aumentarlo y mantener concentrado para alimentarlos. El préstamo anterior le ayudo para fortalecerse y generar buenas ventas.
Ella está motivada con las inversiones que ha realizado, ya que los préstamos le han dado fortaleza y le han permitido tener una fuente de ingreso más estable para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is soliciting a new loan to buy more pigs, in order to expand her business. She depends on her ranch and these loans have allowed her to augment it and to feed and maintain her herd of pigs. The last loan helped her strengthen the business and generate good sales.

Maria is motivated by her prior investments, since they have provided greater solidity and a more stable source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise and sell.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Yahia's Group

texts.en:
Yahia's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Yahia is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past year and seven months, Yahia has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells food and household supplies to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Yahia has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sugar, soap and cooking oil, and will help Yahia to generate greater profits and pay her child's school fees. Yahia hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Yahia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Yahia's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save and manage her money.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta is a 24-year-old woman living in the town of Gataivai. She is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Eseta owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Eseta has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 1000 Somoa Tala (WST) a month from these activities.

In 2010, Eseta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eseta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Eseta is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones. The loan will be the second loan taken out by Eseta from SPBD. Eseta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

Dear KIVA lenders, please take note that the dates in the client photo are wrong, it was totally a mistake made by our Loan Officers for not resetting the time, date and year of the camera, but the photos were taken within this month. I hope this won't happen again in the coming future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 8 children. 

Beverly has a shop where she sells a variety of dried fish. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of dried fish to sell.

Beverly has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Beverly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Esther; la socia aún se dedica a la elaboración de panes y a la exportación de maíz, la socia y ademas de eso la socia ya cuenta con un local en el poblado de Huaro y pondra una quinta, la soica esta embarazada de su segundo bebe y esta muy feliz porque también hara realidad uno de sus sueños tener su quinta restaurante, la socia ya tiene casi todo listo para la quinta ecepto que le faltan algunos detalles y cubiertos por lo que desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de utensilios para el local, algunas sillas y mesas mas y en insumos para el mismo.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Qori Orcco Communal Bank. The member lives in the Urcos district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. Esther is the member. She still makes bread and exports corn for a living, and apart from that, she owns a store in the village of Huaro and plans to set up a restaurant. 

She is pregnant with her second baby and very happy because her dream of owning a restaurant will come true. She is almost ready to open her restaurant, except for some details such as cutlery, that's why she wishes to invest this loan in the purchase of kitchen utensils for the store, some chairs and tables, and other supplies for her business.

The member is infinitely grateful for and values the loan. This allows her to grow in her business and improve her quality of life. She pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy cutlery, chairs, tables and supplies for her new restaurant.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 61 years old and married with 5 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 41 years old and married. She has four children, age 9, 14, 20 and 21. 

Lorna runs a fishing business with her husband. According to her, fishing has been their main source of income for the past 20 years. Lorna does her best to improve their business and keep their family together.

Lorna requested this loan to buy fishing nets, bait and crab traps. This will help Lorna and her husband have more fish to catch and sell.

In the future, Lorna hopes for her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, bait and crab traps.

loans.name: Afm Group

texts.en: Tanki is a 35 year old father of 3 children aged between 7 and 3 years. His wife died and now lives with his elderly grandmother in a traditional hut that is not well ventilated, nor warms up well in winter. He works long hours to ensure there is enough food for his children and grandmother, 2 of whom are going to school during the week and work in the field on Saturdays and Sundays. He has to wake up very early between 3am and 4am during the week, to start preparing the fire for cooking breakfast, heating water and warming the house for his children before they go to school because he could not afford any other means. However with little money he makes while working added to the pension money from his grandmother,which is not much, he is now able to afford to buy gas and paraffin both which are very expensive.He finds himself having to pay about R200 to R300 a month to have sufficient gas;money he hardly makes. Not only is gas expensive for Tanki and many like him, but it is highly flammable and when inhaled can lead to lung diseases even death. Tanki has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, in order to be able to purchase clean cook stoves which provide Tanki and 14 other people from his village, who are living in the same circumstances, the chance of cooking in a way that does not harm them and their families, and that does not require a lot of wood, which is hard to find in Lesotho, nor expensive paraffin and gas. This stove can be started with the use of very little, readily available biomass like dry twigs and dry cow dung that do not require lengths of time to collect. It does not produce smoke while burning, thus making it safe to be used inside the homes. This stove comes with a solar panel for charging the battery which runs the fan in the stove, a USB port for charging phones and a mini LED lamp. A life improving package for these people. This stove saves them time to be with their family, saves energy, eliminates the element of toxic inhalation, house burning and has given them the freedom to have a better lit home to see better in the evening while cooking and enables children to do their homework. For stove info please check www.africancleanenergy.com

loans.use: To be able to pay for the ACE cook stove which will improve his life in terms of health, cost of fuel and the time he spends collecting firewood.

loans.name: Edo’S

texts.en: Mrs. Edo’s E. operates a restaurant business in a semi-urban area in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria, learnt her trade for 3 years before she started her own in the year 2000. According to her, if the above amount is given to her it will go along way to expand her business

loans.use: To buy more food items and drinks for sale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 28-year-old woman. She sells peanuts, rice, beans, "gari," and eggs. She wishes to have her own shop one day. She is seeking a loan of $850.00 from Kiva to help her expand her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Dory

texts.en:
Dory is 28, married and has two children. Her husband is a taxi driver and she works as a seamstress, making all kinds of clothing for men, women and children. Her principal clients are the indigenous peoples who live on the outskirts of her community. With this loan, Dory would like to expand her business, purchasing fabric which would enable her to make more clothing and to show them to the public. With this work she will be able to contribute to the payment of family expenses. She is a member of a the group Santa Catarina 11.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

DORY TIENE 28 AÑOS, CASADA Y TIENE DOS HIJOS, SU ESPOSO LABORA COMO TAXISTA Y ELLA SE DESEMPEÑA COMO COSTURERA CONFECCIONANDO TODO TIPO DE ROPA PARA ÑIÑOS, HOMBRES Y MUJERES, SUS CLIENTES PRINCIPALMENTE SON GENTE INDIGENA QUE PROVIENE DE LOS ALREDEDORES DE LA LOCALIDAD. CON EL PRESTAMO DORY PRETENDE AMPLIAR ESTE NEGOCIO COMPRANDO TELA Y PODER CONFECCIONAR MAS ROPA Y EXHIBIRLOS AL PUBLICO EN GENERAL Y CON ESTO CONTRIBUIR CON EL GASTO FAMILIAR. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO DE SANTA CATARINA 11.

loans.use: Seamstress

loans.name: Rocelia

texts.es:
ROCELIA is 34 years old, married, and has seven children. Her husband does social work helping people in his community who don't have an education and consequently are mistreated. She is dedicated to making and selling dishes of little pastries that are ordered and delivered from house to house. She is a member of the group "Puente (Bridge) 2" along with doña Maria de Jesús Camacho Hernández (who has a grocery shop), Marcela Núñez Cruz (who sells perfumes and cosmetics), Sara Gómez Espinosa (who sells perfumes), and Antonia Espinosa Torres (who sells fruits and vegetables at the market). With the loan, they all hope to increase their business by buying the merchandise that they need.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

ROCELIA tiene 34 años, casada, 7 hijos, su esposo trabaja realizando ayudas sociales a la gente de su comunidad que no tienen estudios y que por este motivo abusan de ellos. Ella se dedica a confeccionar y vender pastelitos de manjar a pedido y de casa en casa. Pertenece al grupo puente 2 junto con doña Maria de Jesús Camacho Hernández (tienda de abarrotes), Marcela Núñez Cruz (venta de perfumes y cosméticos), Sara Gómez Espinosa (venta de perfumes), Antonia Espinosa Torres (venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado). Con el préstamo todas esperan incrementar sus negocios comprando más mercancía para abastecerlos.

loans.use: Selling pastries

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 23 years old, and he has one child. After his father died, his mother and sister came to live with him. He has a shoe and bag shop. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase new modern goods for the shop. He wants to increase his income and improve his living standard.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new modern goods for the shop

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Le Thi B., 56 years old, and her husband Pham Cong Dung, live in Quang Xuong district of Thanh Hoa province. They have 4 children and while their oldest son is already married, his family still lives with them. Since she joined TYM Fund, she has had funds to expand her business. Mrs. B.’s husband trades birds, and she stay home to raise pig and poultry as well as helping her daughter-in-law with her sewing. This term, she requests for a loan of 375 USD to buy more garment for her daughter-in-law. Due to her good needlework, her sewing stall is in good business and the average income per member of her family is about 35 USD per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Gia đình chị Lê Thị Bạo, 56 tuổi, và anh Phạm Công Dụng hiện đang sinh sống tại huyện Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Anh chị có 4 người con, hiện con trai lớn xây dựng gia đình nhưng vẫn ở cùng bố mẹ. Từ ngày tham gia Quỹ đến nay gia đình chị đã có thêm vốn để mở rộng loại hình buôn bán. Chồng đi buôn chim cảnh, chị Bạo ở nhà chăn nuôi và phụ giúp con dâu may mặc. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị vay 375 USD để sử dụng vào mục đích mua thêm vải cho con may tại nhà. Cũng nhờ có bàn tay khéo léo mà quầy may nhà chị lúc nào cũng đông đúc. Thu nhập bình quân đầu người của gia đình chị Bạo là 35 USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in printing paper, ink cartridges, and women's shoes

loans.name: Boimatova

texts.en:
Boimatova R. lives in Spitamen; she is married and has 2 children.  She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2005 and she recommended herself as a serious and executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures.  

She is engaged in commercial and trade services.  Mrs. Boimatova has a business in the wholesale vegetable selling (onion, potato, carrot and etc) and rice selling industries.  She has a straight supplier, which is why the prices for her goods are lower than the bazaar prices.  She is very polite, which is why she has permanent clients who want to buy only her goods.  

Boimatova R. is very experienced in the business, but working in the trade sphere she meets stiff competition, which is why she wants to provide a wide assortment.  Now Mrs. Boimatova R. requests a loan of $475 for business development and widening of assortment.

loans.use: For business development and widening of assortment.

loans.name: Arubaine 3 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Barbara N.. She owns a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to expand her salon business. Barbara is 23 years old and is married. Her husband is an engineer. She has 3 children ranging from age 8 months to 5 and two of her children go to school. Each week, Barbara makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the increased profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children . Barbara has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before to buy hair oils and salon mirrors and the loan was paid back on time.

Barbara is joined in her small group by Alice W., Scovia N., Racheal N., and Eddy N.. Alice W. has a business in charcoal sales and wants to increase stock. Scovia N. is currently operating a business in selling yellow bananas and wants a loan to add in stock. Racheal N. operates a business of selling charcoal and wants to construct a shade for the charcoal. Eddy N. is currently in the business of selling new shoes and is requesting a loan to purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.use: To expand salon business

loans.name: Lwaba East I Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jamawa N.. She is currently in the business of selling produce and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Jamawa is 38 years old and is married. She has 7 children ranging from age 2 to 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Jamawa makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children. Jamawa has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Jamawa is joined in her small group by Fatuma M., Scovia B., Madina M., and Loy N.. Fatuma M. has a business selling fruits and wants to expand to vegetable selling. Scovia B. is currently operating a business in clothing sales and wants a loan to add more stock. Madina M. operates a restaurant business and wants to add more furniture. Loy N. is currently in the business of selling produce and is requesting a loan to add to the business.

loans.use: To add to produce sales business and expand it

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria is 65 years old, separated, and has her own house.

Gloria began to work when she was very young, and has been working as a seamstress for more than 40 years. Thanks to her tireless work, all of her children were able to finish their studies. .

Today, her three children are all college-educated, working professionals, and support her economically by paying for household expenses. .

Gloria has been commissioned to make skirts for traditional dances, and she needs the loan to buy fabric. Making the skirts is a very special task that requires time and patience.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Gloria tiene 65 años de edad, es separada, tiene casa propia.

Gloria empezó desde muy joven a trabajar, tiene más de 40 años trabajando como modista. Gracias a su incansable labor, logró que todos sus hijos terminaran sus estudios.

Actualmente sus tres hijos son profesionales universitarios y están trabajando, apoyándola económicamente en los gastos familiares.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de telas, ya que posee pedidos de faldas para danzas folklóricas y que llevan un trabajo muy especial, tiempo, y paciencia.

loans.use: Buy fabric

loans.name: Emilia's Mji Mpya Group

texts.en:
Emilia is 31 years old and is a married woman with a 12-year-old child. Emilia sells vegetables. She started in 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

In the past, Emilia has taken and successfully repaid loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Juliana, Sikujua, Kanisia, and Sabina, who sell clothing and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Paullina

texts.en: Paullina O. sells fairly used clothes and bags in her community near Ijaniki in the state of Lagos in Nigeria. She is 41 years old and is a widow with five children. As a widow, things have not been easy for her. Paulina has been in this business since the year 2002; she has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years. She needs a loan of $425 to buy more fairly used clothes and bags to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes and bags

loans.name: Thi Doan

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Doan is 44 years old. She has 4 children, the oldest one is already working while the other three children are still schooling. She joined the TYM Fund in 1998. Before that, her family's income was mainly from farming. After joining the Fund, she discussed with her husband and decided to borrow money to purchase more cows and buffaloes to breed. After almost 10 years, her family now has a large number of cows and buffaloes. As she and her husband are both hardworking, their family's income is very stable. Their oldest child is also working and has stable income. Apart from the income from farming and breeding, her family also has additional income from her husband's horse-wagon transportation service. Therefore, her family's monthly income is always around 3 millions VND (about 193USD). This time round, she wants to borrow 15 millions VND (900USD) to purchase more cows to increase the income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thi Đoàn năm nay 44 tuổi. Hiện gia đình chị có 4 người con trong đó có 1 người con đã trưởng thành và 3 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương năm 1998. Trước khi tham gia vào quỹ tình thương thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào làm ruộng và trồng vườn. Sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ chị đã bàn với chồng vay vốn để mua thêm trâu, bò về chăn nuôi. Qua gần 10 năm tham gia Quỹ Tình thương hiện nay gia đình chi đã có đàn trâu bò với số lượng đáng kể. Nhờ cần cù, chịu khó làm ăn hiện nay kinh tế của gia đình chị rất ổn định. Anh chị đã có 1 con trưởng thành đi làm và có thu nhập ổn định. Hàng tháng ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi, trồng trọt gia đình chị còn có thêm thu nhập từ công việc chở hàng thuê bằng xe ngựa của chồng. Vì vậy thu nhập của gia đình chị luôn ổn định ở mức 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000 đ để mua thêm trâu bò về nuôi phát triển kinh tế gia đình.

loans.use: Breeding cows

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: A. Gulnora became a client in 2008 and showed herself to be very responsible. She makes repayments to her loans on time and has had no problem following loan procedures. She lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan and is married with 7 children. Mrs. A. Gulnora is engaged in trading home grown fruits and vegetables at the local bazaar. She is also a collective farmer. Mrs. A. Gulnora applies to KIVA for a business support loan of 2600 STJ for 4 months in order to increase and improve her business.

loans.use: To increase and improve her business

loans.name: Key

texts.en:
Key M. is 32 years old and is one of the farmers who live in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She works on a plot of land growing rice to earn a living and is able to make $1.00 per day. Her husband works at the irrigation department in Kampong Cham province. Normally, he makes $3.00 per day. This couple together has four children, and all of them are students. Mrs. Key would like a loan from Kiva to purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed for the next season which is coming very soon.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed for the next season which is coming very soon

loans.name: Toem

texts.en: Mr. Toem S. was born in 1977 and lives in Tumnop Thmey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a coal seller and his wife, Mrs. Chay Kimsal, is a rice farmer. In her plantation, she faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy two oxen to plow the rice field. To solve this problem, her husband, Mr. Toem S., is requesting a loan to buy 2 oxen. The couple has three children, two of whom attend the local school while the youngest is too young to work or study, being just three years old. His wife is pictured on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two oxen to help with plowing

loans.name: Yormahmad

texts.ru: Гадоев Ермахмад житель Файзабада. Женат и имеет одного ребенка. В возрасте 25 лет имеет опыт работы в бизнесе.  Работает  агрономом .Имеет сад , где выращивает фрукты.
