Так же занимается купле продажей яиц. Скупает яица у себя в селе и продает их на рынке. Планирует увеличить товарооборот и погасить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Yormahmad G. lives in Fayzabad. He is married and has one child. At only 25 years old, he already has business experience. He works in agriculture. He has an orchard where he grows fruit. He also buys and sells eggs. He buys eggs in the village and sells them in the market. He plans to increase sales and to pay off the loan within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene E. is 42 years old and married with 5 children. She sells bush meat. Bush meat is used in Nigeria for the preparation of soup. The demand for bush meat is high in Nigeria. Irene needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more bush meat to sell. She is a Lapo client. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more bush meat to sell

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita L., 31 years old, married and blessed with two children: Crisanto – 12 years old, a Grade 6 student; and Joan – 9 years old, already in the fourth grade. Her husband Jose works as a driver in their community. 

Merlita started her soap vending business one year ago. She decided to have her own business because she wanted to help her husband to earn a living to support the educational needs of their children. She sells detergent and bath soap in their village and most of her customers are women. Merlita earns a minimum of PHP1,500.00 monthly. She budgets her income to re-invest in her business and cover the daily needs of her family. Because she wanted to develop her business, Merlita asked for financial assistance to produce more soap and sell it to nearby villages.  

Her business is really of great help to them since they are able to meet their needs. She is hoping that through her business, they can continue to send their children to school and they can finish their studies. She believes that her strong faith in God will be a great factor in attaining all her hopes in life.

loans.use: To produce more soaps for sale in the community

location.town: Sitio Guingab, Masipi East Cabagan, Isabela

loans.name: Knech

texts.en:
Knech K., 36, is married and lives with her husband in Battambang province. She is a farmer and makes US$ 3 a day. Most of the farmers that live in Battambang province typically grow rice and fruit such as durian, oranges, and other favorite fruit. Battambang province is the number one producer of rice and fruit. Knech K.'s husband, Sam Saly, 35, is a motor-taxi and makes US$ 4 a day.

Mrs. Knech K. is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a taxi business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to use for a motor-taxi

loans.name: Sayed Sahadudin

texts.en: S. Sahadudin is 35 years old. He lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has got a general store and all the family members benefit from the income he generates. He wants to expand his business and to attract more customers, so he has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani for a term of 10 months. He is happy that he has got the chance to progress as soon as possible.

loans.use: Completing the inventory of his general store

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is a fashion designer. She also sells sarongs and tailoring materials. She lives in Agbor, Delta state, Nigeria. Doris is 28 years old, married, and has one child. She needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell. She says "thanks" to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase sarongs and tailoring materials

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
Zuhro D. lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan.  She is married with two children.  Zuhro is very cheerful and full of enthusiasm, despite the difficult financial situation. 

She works hard to ensure a good future for her children.  Zuhro makes pastries and the traditional national bread known as “lepeshky.”   It is hard work.  She makes the special dough and bakes it in a special flamed place.  Zuhro is requesting a business development loan of 3000 STJ, for 4 months.  The money will buy and import flour from Kyrgyzstan, good flour for national bread making.

Her husband went to the Russian Federation but he could not find appropriate work because of the financial crisis.

loans.use: Buy and import flour.

loans.name: Faasalafa

texts.en: Faasalafa P., 51, is married with four children. She has four years of experience in the pork bun business. She sells to the general public six days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 208 Tala. SPBD loans are Faasalafa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks, and this is her fourth SPBD loan, used to purchase lamp flaps, sugar, flour, salt, onion, yeast, soy sauce, cooking pots, and seasoning oil. She reports that her business is doing well.

loans.use: To purchase lamp flaps, sugar, flour, salt, onion, yeast, soy sauce, cooking pots, and seasoning oil.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery tiene 31 años, vive en casa de unos familiares con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 4 años se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en motocarro, ella posee dos de estos vehículos, y ha contratado a 2 personas para que conduzcan. Adicionalmente, Mery vende productos lácteos que lleva periódicamente en sus viajes a una ciudad cercana a la suya, de esas dos maneras genera los recursos que necesita para su familia. Cuando está en su localidad, reparte sus pedidos entre sus vecinos y otros clientes, y sigue controlando las ganancias de sus motocarros. Mery desea tener otra movilidad más e incrementar la cantidad de productos que vende. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las socias más activas de su banco comunal, y demostró puntualidad en sus pagos en el ciclo anterior, esta vez se compromete, una vez más, a seguir teniendo estas actitudes positivas. El dinero que viene solicitando es para invertirlo en la compra del seguro de uno de los motocarros, y para adquirir más productos lácteos.
texts.en:
Mery is 31 years old and lives in her family home with her husband and their three children. For four years, she has been running a taxi service; she has two vehicles and two hired drivers. Mery also sells dairy products whenever her vehicles travel to nearby towns. This allows her two sources of income for her family. When she's in town, she takes orders from neighbours and other customers, which contributes to the income from her vehicles. Mery wants to increase the mobility of her business and increase the number of dairy products she sells. This is her second loan with MFP and she is one of the most active members of her community bank. She has always made her payments in a timely fahsion, and promises to do the same this time around. Her loan money will go toward vehicle insurance and dairy products.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying another vehicle

loans.name: Yovo Yawo

texts.fr:
A. Yovo Yawo  célibataire âgé de 26 ans est un jeune très dynamique qui a pour activité la vente des friperies dans le quartier de Hédzranawoé, localité dans laquelle le commerce est développé. Depuis qu’il a quitté les bancs d’école, il a commencé le commerce de friperie pour femmes, pour enfant et pour homme. Il s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé chez un fournisseur qui lui livre les marchandises à crédit.
Actuellement vu l’évolution de son activité, il veut être autonome et souhaite acheter et payer au comptant. A cet effet, il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 2 bales de pantalon et 2 bales de t-shirt.
texts.en:
A. Yovo Yawo, single, aged 26, is an energetic young man who sells used clothing in the Hédzranawoé neighborhood, a locality where commerce is highly developed. Ever since he left school, he began selling used clothing for women, children, and men. He buys his inventory at the big open-air market in Lomé from a supplier who lets him have merchandise on credit.

In view of his present situation, he wants to be independent and would like to pay cash. With this in mind, he is requesting this first loan to buy 2 bales of pants and 2 bales of T-shirts.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of bales of used clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon B. is from the village of Libertad Alto, Sinacabn, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Corazon owns and operates a business selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,400 PHP a month. In 2006, Corazon joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Union Pro Mujer Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Unión Pro mujer” trabaja junto a  Pro-Mujer hace más diez,  a la fecha  cuenta con doce socias activas, ellas han  demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito.
Dentro el grupo la mayoría están casadas y con familias, se ven en la necesidad de buscar  otras fuentes de ingresos ya que las necesidades de sus hijos aumentan día a día.
Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación como ser; la venta de ropa usada, víveres, cosméticos otras también se dedican al  tejido de mantas, en lana de vicuña. La mayoría de ellas venden sus productos en ferias de la ciudad Necesitan capital para poder comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería  o productos, de esta manera generar mayores ingresos que les permita ofrecer bienestar a sus familias
texts.en:
The Unión Pro Mujer group has worked together with Pro-Mujer for over ten years. They currently have 12 active members. They have shown themselves to be an organized group regarding their loan payments. Most of the group members are married and have families. They need to look for other sources of income since their children’s needs increase every day. Within the group there are different businesses such as selling used clothes, provisions, and cosmetics. Other group members weave blankets from vicuna wool. Most of them sell products at the fairs in the city. They need capital to be able to buy a larger quantity of merchandise or products. This way they will generate greater income, which will allow them to provide for the well being of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Elisha Kipyegon

texts.en: Elisha N. is 40 years old, married to Rhodah Chepkemoi, and blessed with three beautiful children. He operates his electronics business in Eldoret Town and most of his customers are from within Eldoret. Elisha has had seven other Loans from KADET, and intends to buy more stock like cables, switches, switch boxes, nails, screws and meter boxes to enable him to serve his customers more efficiently. With the profit he gets from his electronics shop, he has been able to provide basic needs for his family. Elisha intends to open a larger business premise in future, raise his standard of living, and build a permanent residence for his family. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy cables, switch boxes, socket outlets, one-way switches, nails, screws and meter boxes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk for her genge.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita P. is from the village of Tungawan, Tambulig, Zamboang del Sur. She is 32 years old. Anecita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Anecita owns and operates a sari-sari, or general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling beverages and frequently-used retail products. Anecita has been engaged in her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

Anecita joined GDMPC this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anecita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to expand the business. This will be the first loan Anecita has taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: G. Marie est née en 1986 à Avrankou dans la commune  de Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Marie est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Marie est coiffeuse de profession. Mais, Marie vend aussi des cartes de recharge téléphonique. Marie veut mieux équiper son salon de coiffure pour répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. C’est pour cette raison que Marie sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé.
texts.en:
G. Marie was born in 1986 in Avrankou in the town of Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin.  Marie is married and the mother of two children.  She is a hairdresser by profession.  But she also sells mobile phone recharge cards.  She wants to equip her hair salon further in order to respond to the requirements of her customers.  For this reason, Marie is requesting financial support from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a steaming hood for drying hair

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella K. is a small business married woman .She is a food vender selling cooked and fried food stuffs to customers at Kigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the food stuffs from the market in whole sales. Due to low business capital she can not manage to rent a place where she can make a café but she prepares it at home and then supplying to customers in working stations. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Night

texts.en:
Night R. is currently in the business of selling textbooks, pens, exercise books etc at the bookshop and is requesting a loan to purchase a photocopying machine. 

 Night is 25 years old and is married to a businessman. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up an internet café.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase a photocopying machine

loans.name: Moise

texts.en:
Moise N. is 25 years old, single, and lives in the Northern Province of Rwanda, approximately three hours drive from the capital city of Kigali. His village, called Rwambogo, is where he has his transport business and he will continue to operate there.

Issa is requesting his first loan in order to buy a new motorbike to replace his old bike which needs replacing very much. This motorcycle allows him to earn a living as a moto-taxi driver with a monthly income of nearly 100,000 RWF (approximately US$180). His moto-taxi transport business has been open every day from 6 in the morning to 8 in the evening since 2006 as long as there are customers to drive.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie S. is from the village of  Casinglot, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns and operates a business venture a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosemarie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosemarie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena R. is from the city of Capatan Tuguegarao City. She is 49 years old. Rowena is married and has three infant children. To make a living, Rowena runs a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rowena has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rowena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rowena is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rowena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Storage and retail of cereals

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 50 años de edad, es viuda, y vive junto a sus cuatro hijos en el sector Pilar Nores del distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de sacar a su familia adelante hizo que utilizara el dinero que le dejó su esposo al morir en la instalación de una pequeña bodega en su vivienda. Allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos y clientes productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite), abarrotes, golosinas y bebidas.

El negocio tiene aproximadamente un año de establecido y les ha brindado los ingresos suficientes para salir adelante. Rosa está planeando ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos para vender pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por eso se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Rosa es una mujer luchadora, ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades y ahora su más grande anhelo es seguir trabajando para sacar a sus hijos adelante y brindarles la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior con la que puedan asegurarse un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Rosa is the mother of a family and is 50 years old. She is a widow and lives together with her 4 children in the Pilar Nores sector, Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, located 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo. The need to move her family forward made her use the money her husband left her when he died to install a small grocery store in her home. Here she offers her neighbours and customers essential items (rice, sugar, oil), grocery items, lollies and drinks. The business has been established for nearly 1 year, and has granted her sufficient earnings to move forward. Rosa is planning to expand her business with the purchase of more products to sell, but she doesn't have sufficient capital to realise this action. For this reason for the first time she is seeking a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 600 nuevos soles which she thinks of using to achieve her objective. Rosa is a born fighter, and has moved forward notwithstanding the difficulties she has faced. Now her greatest wish is to continue working to move her children forward and give them the opportunity to study for a good career with which they can be assured of a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grocery items to expand business

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en: In 2005, Charlita B. joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her rice production. Charlita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her rice production. Charlita is requesting her third loan from PMPC. Charlita wants to live a good life and maintain a good standing with the cooperative.

loans.use: To finance her rice production

loans.name: Elith

texts.es:
La Sra. Elith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 53 años y es madre de 02 hijos, ya independientes, presenta estudios hasta sexto grado de primaria.

Elith, lleva  20 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo implementar su pequeño taller de costura y teniendo habilidad  para este tipo de actividad, no dudo en hacerlo y gracias al apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos le brindo, logró implementarlo y que se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles compró, telas en metros y colores, cierras y botones en diferentes modelos, Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.

En la actualidad continua con su mismo negocio y cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su casa, para realizar sus pedidos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este crédito de S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles,  comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, grecas, elástico y botones. 

Elith, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de salir adelante, su sueño es seguir surtiendo más su negocio. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Elith belongs to the “Santa Rosa de Lima” cooperative bank, located in the Juanjui district of San Martín. She is single, 53 years old, and the mother of 2 children who are now grown and living independently. She was educated until the sixth grade of primary school. Elith has 20 years of experience making clothing, little by little generating her own income and saving her money. She wanted to start a small tailoring workshop and, being handy in this type of work, she had no doubt she could succeed. Thanks to the support that the Manuela Ramos Movement provided, she managed to set up her enterprise. It is located in her own house, in a comfortable setting in which to tend to her customers. With her first loan of 300.00 soles, she bought fabric, zippers and buttons of different styles. She tells us that sales are going well, and she works based on orders placed by her clients. Currently, she continues in the same business and has a loyal customer base that visits her on a daily basis to place their orders. She tends to them personally, with a friendliness that characterizes her. With this loan of 1,500.00 soles, she will buy a variety of fabrics and tools she uses in her work such as scissors, sewing needles, safety pins, decorative borders, elastics and buttons. Elith feels like a successful woman these days, with even more desire to forge ahead. Her dream is to continue to supply her workshop. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of fabrics in different colors, styles, etc.

loans.name: Laureta

texts.en:
Laureta S., 34, is from the town of Lipay Road Villasis, Pangasinan. She is married and has 5 school-aged children. Laureta owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food, snacks and drinks in the community. Laureta has been involved in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Laureta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laureta is requesting her first loan, for 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make products for sale

loans.name: Baryali

texts.en:
This is Baryali son of A. J.. He is 38 years old and is married with three children: one son and two daughters, all students at school. He, with his family members, lives in the 8th District of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a taxi driver and works hard in order to support his family members in a better way.

Baryali needs the money to purchase a new part for his taxi and to change the old one to a new one in order to work better because he is the only one who is responsible for paying all the expenses of the household.

Baryali hopes to grow his business and to give his children a good education, so he has requested an individual loan of 30,000 Afghani.

loans.use: To purchase a new part for his taxi

loans.name: Marng

texts.en: Marng N., age 40, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has three children. To help cover the family expenses, she buys mangoes to resell when the price is good, ad is able to earn about USD 7 per day. The family is also supported by her husband (pictured) who is a farmer and earns USD 4 per day. One of N.’s children is employed in a local garment factory and also helps to support the family. N. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more mangoes for resale. She hopes she will able to generate a better income to reach her goals of building a nice house and sending her children to a good school.

loans.use: To buy mangoes for resale.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Ángel tiene 37 años, es un hombre trabajador que lucha por sacar adelante a su familia, es casado, de cuya esposa se llama Noemí, tiene 29 años y ambos tienen 3 hijos, menores de edad, y juntos viven en una hacienda antigua cuidando sus campos de cultivo. Le gusta mucho la actividad agrícola, es por eso que a diario, y con ayuda de su esposa, se dirigen a trabajar, desde las 6 de la mañana, llevando las herramientas necesarias para remover y cuidar sus cultivos, además para no tener que regresar al medio día a su casa, llevan consigo sus propios alimentos, de esa manera no descuidan su salud.  Es así que lleva 5 años en ésta práctica decisión, ya que le permite trabajar más tiempo hasta el anochecer, puesto que trabajan sobre terrenos arrendados. Como tiene confianza en su fuerza y en su trabajo para obtener mayores ingresos económicos, en sus días libres realiza la labor de operario, ganando 20 soles por día. Para él, lo más pesado de su actividad es tener que contratar toros para arar la tierra, es por ello que desea comprar dos cabezas de reses, para así no tener que gastar en el alquiler de estos animales. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, y está dispuesto a seguir trabajando, a lado de su grupo  comunal, por todos muy unidos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una bolsa de arveja y tres sacos de fertilizantes, para asegurar una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Ángel, 37, is a hard-working man who struggles daily to help his family get ahead in life. He’s married to Noemí, 29, and they have three minor children. They live in an old farm caring for their farmlands. He enjoys farming very much. Every day at 6am, with help from his wife, he heads to the fields with the necessary tools to care for his crops. In addition, in order not to have to return home for lunch, they take food with them so as not to neglect their health. They have been following this practical plan for the past 5 years making it possible for him to work until nightfall because they till leased lands. Because he has faith in his own strength and ability to work to gain extra income, in his free time he works as a salaried laborer, earning 20 soles per day. For him, the hardest aspect of his work is having to lease oxen to till the land; for this reason, he’d like to purchase two heads of cattle in order to save on lease costs. This is his 5th loan with MFP and he’s willing to continue working alongside his communal group, which is quite united. He will use the requested funds to buy a sack of pea seed and three sacks of fertilizer to insure a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sack of pea seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “CRISTO MORENO”; Nuestra socia vive en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. GUADALUPE, ella tiene 35 años de edad es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 7  de edad, nuestra socia se dedica a la docencia, ella es profesora de primaria en un colegio y alterna sus actividades con el cuidado y atención de sus hijos y esposo; Nuestra socia nos comenta que tiene también una pequeña tiendita a la que le desea implementar un área de fotocopias, La socia solicita el préstamo para terminar de comprar la fotocopiadora.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member is an associate of the communal lender “Cristo Moreno” and lives in Cusco. Guadalupe is 35, married and has two children aged 8 and 7 respectively. She is a primary school teacher at a local school and takes care to balance her work responsibilities and those of caring for her family. Guadalupe runs a small store and would like to expand it to include photocopy services; to do so she seeks a loan to obtain a photocopy machine. Grateful for the support of micro credit lenders, Guadalupe is fully committed to repaying the loan in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a photocopy machine

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Banco Comunal Arrieros.
Olga es soltera, tiene 49 años y 2 hijos, Olga venD. cereales en L. ciudad D. Ica a donD. viaja semanalmente, tiene 3 puestos en el mercado D. L. ciudad D. Ica.
Olga necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles que será invertido en L. compra D. papa seca.
Olga sueña con tener una casa propia y comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the Arrieros Communal Bank. She is single, 49, and has 2 children. Olga sells cereals in the city of Ica where she travels weekly. She has three stands in the Ica city market. Olga needs a loan of 900 sols to buy dried potatoes. She dreams of having her own house and to be able to buy a car to transport her products.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dried potatotes

loans.name: Tey

texts.en: Tey P., 38, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Preyveng Province; the name literally means "long forest" in Khmer. She and her husband manufacture cement jars and pipes, earning an income of about $8 per day. P. is requesting a loan of $850 to purchase more cement to expand her business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. P.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy cement to produce jars and pipes.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar de 37 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil, su esposa le ayuda a cocinar la comida para su restaurante y sus hijos después que salen de la escuela le ayudan a repartir la merienda. 

Para darles una mejor vida a sus hijos y tener mas tiempo para ellos. El decidió invertir sus ahorros en arroz, legumbres, vegetales etc. Poco a poco con la ayuda de su esposa vende comida típica del Ecuador en los almuerzos y meriendas como arroz, con menestra y carne, churrasco (carnes y arroz) etc. Cada almuerzo los vende a $ 1.25 y las meriendas las vende a $ 2.00. 

Para poder implementar mas platos quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, legumbre y otra parte del préstamo quiere comprar ropa para venderla a los clientes mas conocidos del restaurante. Su meta principal es tener uno de los mejores restaurantes de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Oscar is 37 years old and he lives in the suburb of Guayaquil. His wife helps him cooking for his restaurant, and his children help him serve the merienda (midday meal) when they come home from school. He decided investing his savings in rice, pulses, vegetables and so on in order to give a better quality of life to his children and to have more time to dedicated them. Little by little and with his wife’s help, he sells the typical Ecuadorian meals, such as rice with vegetable soup and meat, churrasco (meats and rice) and so on at lunch and merienda times. He earns $ 1.25 for each lunch and $ 2.00 for each merienda. A part of the loan he is requesting will be use to buy rice and pulses in order to increase the variety of dishes he offers, while another part of the loan will be used to buy clothes he will send to the most regular customers of his restaurant. His main goal is for his restaurant to become one of the best of his town.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and clothes.

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 5 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Dah de la préfecture de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali) qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, 6 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
BAOUMOU D. utilisera son prêt  pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels agricoles et des intrants,  au grand marché de San ville. Après l’hivernage,  sa récolte est stockée pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elle ait de la valeur avant d’être vendue  au grand marché de Dah, San  et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
BAOUMOU D. compte réaliser, après l’écoulement de  sa production agricole, un bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
BENKADI 5 is a group of married women from the village of Dah in the San Prefecture of the Segou region (4th administrative region of Mali) who live in traditional extended families. On average, the women are 38 years old and have 6 children. They grow peanuts. Because of concerns about the profitability of their farm, the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago. This is their third loan and they have repaid their previous loans. Baoumou D. will use her loan to buy peanut seeds, small agricultural tools and input materials, at the general market in the town of San. After the rainy season, the crop will be stored for it to gain value and then sold at the general markets in Dah, San and in surrounding markets, in stores (often in bulk), or to cash customers from large cities. Baoumou D. expects to make a revenue of 35 000 CFA Francs from selling this agricultural product, which will be used to repay the loan and cover the family's expenditures.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inputs, seeds and small agricultural tools.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly A. is from the village of Brgy.Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 28 years old, married and has 1 infant. Nelly owns & operates a food business, preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Nelly has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,100 PHP a month.

In 2008, Nelly joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Nelly is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Nelly from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn C. is from the village of Binakalan, Gingoog City. She is 43 years old. Jocelyn is widowed and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Simeona

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, Provincia del Cusco y Departamento Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Simeona ; ella tiene 49 Años de edad y tiene 4 hijos. La socia alterna sus actividades con su negocio de restaurante, ella vende diferentes platos, desde hace 8 años atrás, La socia es casada y ella misma elabora los diferentes platillos; La socia desea implementar su restaurante y comprar vajillas e invertir en diferentes cosas relacionadas a su negocio de comidas.  La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar el restaurante.

La socia agradece y valora esté préstamo el cual le permite realizar sus metas, La socia se compromete a cumplir el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
Simeona, 49, is a member of the “PROGRESO” (Progress) communal bank which is located in Huanchac district, Cusco Province, Cusco department. She is married and has four children and she combines her household chores with running a restaurant. She has sold a variety of home made dishes for the last 8 years. She’d like to supply the restaurant and buy dinnerware and various other items related to the food business. She is asking for the loan to do this. She is grateful for and values the loan that will help her meet her goals. She pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of restaurant utensils and supplies.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Sofía, de 60 años, vive en su casa propia, a lado de sus 2 hijos  jóvenes, que trabajan y le ayudan en los gastos del hogar. Esta laboriosa dama se dedica a la comercialización de anticuchos (platillo peruano compuesto de corazón de res a la parrilla) en la esquina de una calle aledaña a su casa. La venta es diaria, y su labor empieza desde muy temprano cuando compra la carne que untará con especias, ya luego ensarta las carnes con palitos, para luego freírlas a la parrilla. Su platillos son bien buscados, por la sazón que tiene, luego que sus clientes prueban sus ricos anticuchos se van satisfechos. Asegura que es un negocio bastante rentable, pues obtiene ganancias que le permiten vivir cómodamente, y le gusta dedicarse a la preparación de anticuchos, ya que es un negocio bastante tranquilo. Y como a Sofía le gusta trabajar, para salir adelante, pues tiene planeado ampliar su negocio para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus comensales. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y promete cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas, además manifiesta que esta muy contenta con el trabajo de su grupo porque todos los integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios. Sofía tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de un carrito sanguchero (especial para frituras) y también mesas y sillas, para ofrecer comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sofia is 60 and she lives in her own house with her two children who work and help her with the household expenses. She is a hardworking woman who sells anticuchos (a typical Peruvian dish of grilled beef heart) on the corner of a street by her house. She sells every day and the work begins very early when she buys the meat to rub in the spices. She then spears the meat with sticks and then fries it on the grill. Her food is very sought after for the flavor that it has. When her customers try her delicious anticuchos they are satisfied. She maintains that this is a profitable business since the earnings help her live comfortably. She likes to make the anticuchos because it is a very stable business. And since Sofia likes to work to get ahead, she plans on enlarging her business to offer better service to her customers. This is the fourth loan with MFP, and she promises to make all the payments punctually. She also shows that she is very happy with the work of her group because all the members are very responsible and supportive. Sofia plans on using the loan to buy a “carrito sanguchero” (a special cart for frying) and also tables and chairs so that her customers will be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cart for frying, as well as tables and chairs to set up her food stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing and drums of palm oil

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen M. is a married woman who lives in Tapon, Barangay Sillon, Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: dried fish, a general store and fish vending. Her husband, Ramon M., who is 63 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 10 children who are 23 to 39 years old. 

Carmen joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Carmen has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 17th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,000 which she intends to use to purchase additional stock so that she can continue to save up for the future of her children's education and for her family's needs. Carmen M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en: Phat S., 46, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of about USD $3 per day. The family has to spend USD $50 on food, USD $10 on electricity and water supplies, and USD $50 on other necessary expenses every month.  S. is requesting a loan of USD $500 to purchase cows to raise for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy cows to raise for sale

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en:
Epefania S. is 53 years old, married, and supports her family by operating one business venture: buying and selling 'chicharon' (pork rinds) and plastics bags.  She lives in Bliss, Brgy. La Paz, Bogo, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her 'chicharon' (pork rinds) & plastics bag business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Epefania is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can continue to purchase more stock of plastic bags and 'chicharon'  to sell.   This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Epefania aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.

 About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase stocks of "chicharon" (fried pork rinds) and plastic bags to sell

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra is a twenty-seven-year-old woman, married to a driver with two children below ten years of age, living in Fort Portal, Uganda in her own house. She has a dream of educating her children and ensuring that they get better qualifications to earn them reputable jobs. She had a retail shop before turning it into a clothing shop over the past three years, and it has reaped enormous benefits for her. Sandra needs the loan to purchase clothing for sale.

loans.use: Purchasing clothing for sale at her shop

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran lives in a city named Multan in Pakistan. She resides in an area named Hazori Bagh with her family in a two-room brick house. She is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and do her household work. She is also a very caring mother who is raising her children very well. She is married to A. D. and has given birth to four sons and a daughter. Her eldest son operates a business selling vegetables. He has a small shop in the market from where he sells seasonal vegetables to the buyers. The next two children are tailors by profession. They sew men's clothes, specifically. Her remaining children are enrolled in school and are getting their education. 

Manzooran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her elder son’s business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal vegetables to sell through his shop. Manzooran is hopeful that an investment will make positive changes to her son’s business and his income will increase as a result. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables to sell

loans.name: Esau Eliazar

texts.es: El señor Esau Eliazar S. C. es un joven de 21 años, soltero sin hijos, trabajador de Café Soluble, la empresa nicaragüense que exporta el mejor café de Nicaragua,  él es un hombre inteligente que se ha enfrentado a muchas dificultades económicas pero ha podido salir adelante gracias a su esfuerzo y el firme propósito de ayuda a su familia, el solicita un préstamo para componer el baño principal de la vivienda de sus padres, es para él un símbolo de honra a sus padres el devolverles un poco lo que han hecho por el apoyándolo a que habiten en un hogar mas digno de vivir.
texts.en: Esau Eliazar S. C. is a young man who is 21 years old.  He is single and doesn't have any children.  He works in Café Soluble, the Nicaraguan company that exports the best coffee of Nicaragua.  He is an intelligent man that has been faced with many economic difficulties, but he has been able to get ahead thanks to his efforts and the solid intention to help his family.  He is requesting a loan to repair the main bathroom of his parent's house.  For him it is a symbol of honor to his parents to return to them a little of what they have done in supporting him, so they can live in a more dignified home.

loans.use: To repair the bathroom in his parent's house

loans.name: Candy Faye

texts.en:
Candy Faye R. is from the village of Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 25 years old. Candy Faye is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Candy Faye owns & operates a business raising pigs for breeding. Candy Faye has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Candy Faye joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Candy Faye has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Candy Faye is requesting a new loan of 21,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Candy Faye from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Longuinos

texts.es:
El señor Longuinos S.  esta agradecido por su cooperación en los dos créditos anteriores lo cuales su negocio a tenido muy bien ingreso. 
Esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para comprar materia prima ya que tienen varios pedidos de muebles de madera para elaborar y le esta haciendo falta material. No quiere descapitalizar el negocio, es por eso que esta solicitando su cooperación en este crédito.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso de su familia y tiene tres hijos que actual mente están estudiando
texts.en: Longuinos S.  is thankful for your cooperation in the two previous loans which generated very good income for his business. He is again requesting a loan to purchase basic materials since he has various orders to make wooden furniture and he is lacking materials. He doesn't want to decapitalize the business. It is for this reason that he is requesting your cooperation with this loan. He plans to pay the loan with a part of his business' earnings since it is the income source for his family and he has three children that currently are students.

loans.use: Purchase basic materials for business.

loans.name: Fany Karina

texts.es:
Fany D. 34 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Elena departamento D. Usulután, se dedica a vender pupusas y antojitos (enchiladas, yuca, papas fritas), vive junto a sus dos hijos D. 7 y 2 años D. edad.
El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su propia casa, las ventas las realiza D. 4:00pm a 9:00pm, tiene 5 años D. estar atendiéndolo, por el momento necesita un préstamo para invertir en mercadería para el negocio, pues productos como quesillo, maíz, chicharrón, plátanos y aceite, son los que mayormente demanda, pues se agotan rápidamente por la demanda D. los clientes en pupusas y antojitos.
Ella espera que este préstamo le logre dar estabilidad y potencial  para producir más y atender mejor  a los clientes, en cuanto a su familia sueña con ayudar a sus hijos para que terminen sus estudios y mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Fany is 34 years old and she lives in Santa Elena of the Usulutan department. She sells pupusas and snacks (enchiladas, yucca, French fries). She lives together with her two children, aged 7 and 2 years old. 

Her business is located in her home. She makes her sales from 4pm to 9pm and she has 5 years in the business. She requires a loan to purchase goods for her business, such as fresh cheese, corn, pork rinds, bananas, and cooking oil. These products are in highest demand. Her supplies are quickly depleted given the client demand for pupusas and snacks.

With this loan she hopes to bring garner stability and the potential to produce more to proviD. better service to her clients. As for her family, she dreams to help her children finish their studies and to improve the quality of their life.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Suzi

texts.en: Suzi is currently in a business of selling alcohol. She is 33 years old and married to a policeman.  She has 2 children, both of whom go to school. Suzi asked for a loan to stock more alcohol to sell. With extra profits from her business, Suzi hopes to construct a house in the future.

loans.use: To stock more alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
Virgilio tiene la edad de 56 años, padre de tres hijos, que junto a su esposa trabajan para lograr hacer su  casa con mejores condiciones, su esposa trabaja cuidando niños, y su trabajo de Virgilio es como conductor de bus.
Tras largo años de trabajo no había logrado hacer su casa de concreto debido a que tenía que cubrir las necesidades de alimento y estudio de sus hijos, siendo su casa de madera, pues años atrás trabajaba en la agricultura apena ajustaba para los alimentos.  Con sus ahorro comienza a construir de concretos su casa, lo que la tiene bastante construida y que terminara de cerrar con dinero que Afodenic está dando por medio de préstamo, lo que está contento ya que pagara  a plazos, y cerrara su casa. Para un bienestar familia.
texts.en: Virgilio is 56 years old and the father of three children.  He and his wife are both working to improve their home.  His wife works in childcare and he works as a bus driver.  After many years of work he had not been able to put up concrete in their house due to having to pay for the basics of food and school for his children.  His house was made of wood, because many years ago he worked in agriculture and then barely earned enough money for food.  With his savings he began to construct the house of concrete.  The house is now nearly done and he will finish the work with the loan money from Afodenic.  He is happy to be able to pay for this in installments and enclose his home for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: Construction materials to finish the concrete work in his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To rent a piece of farmland and pay for some of his university expenses.

loans.name: Narcisa Margarita

texts.es:
En la parroquia Eloy Alfaro de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.  Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas del Océano Pacifico.

La señora Narcisa es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos y por el grupo de amigas que han formado. Tiene  27 años, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos de 12,8,7 y 4 años de edad, los tres mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es albañil.

Tiene un pequeño local en la estación de Reinas Del Camino en la ciudad de Manta en el cual prepara y vende deliciosos platos, trabaja todos los días en las tardes ya que solo prepara meriendas, trabaja sola. Nos cuenta que tiene este  comedor dos años y que siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes que tienen en la estación su oficina, incluso hace un año también llevo a su hermana para que venda desayunos y al igual que a ella le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque con los créditos logro poner su negocio y poco a poco lo ha ido mejorando.
 
Su sueño es algún día tener un local comercial.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Mujeres Con Esperanza” (Women with Hope) meets every fifteen days in the parish of Eloy Alfaro in the city of Manta. This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited throughout the year by both domestic and foreign tourists. Manta’s port, which lies on the Pacific Ocean, is one of the largest in the country and in all of the Americas.

Narcisa is a founding member of the Communal Bank. She enjoys the convenience of accessing the loans and the group of friends that have joined together. Narcisa is 27 years old, married, and has four children (ages 12, 8, 7, and 4). The three older children are in school. Her husband works as a mason.

Narcisa has an establishment at the Reinas Del Camino station in the city of Manta where she prepares and sells delicious dishes. She works every day in the afternoons preparing snacks. Narcisa says that she has been managing her eatery for two years and has always done well because she has many customers who come to the station. A year ago, she brought in her sister to sell breakfasts and she too is doing very well.

This loan will be used to buy rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients for preparing her dishes. Narcisa has been with the Communal Bank since the beginning and enjoys having access to loans for her business, which has been gradually improving. Her goal is to have a commercial location.

loans.use: To purchase rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana tiene ya más de ocho años dedicándose a las ventas de papelería escolar. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar mercancía que es hojas de papel, colores, tintas de impresoras y otra copiadora, ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión y no quiere descapitalizar su negocio. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio ya que su esposo el señor Juan José se encarga de los gastos familiares con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una compañía de trasportes como chofer de camión de carretera.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana has been selling school supplies for more than eight years.  She is requesting a loan so that she can buy merchandise such as sheets of paper, crayons, printer ink, and another photocopier.  At the moment, she lacks the necessary funds for this investment and does not want to drain capital from her business.  

Juana plans to repay the loan with the profit she generates from her business.  Her husband, Sr. Juan José, takes charge of the family expenses with the salary he earns from his job as a truck driver for a transportation company.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies and a photocopier.

loans.name: Victoria Eugenia

texts.es:
La habilidad para las manualidades ha sido una de las bendiciones que ha recibido Victoria Eugenia G. L. quien desde pequeña supo que este podría ser su oficio en el futuro. Después de que se casó esta emprendedora mujer consciente de la necesidad de aportar a cubrir los gastos del hogar, esta emprendedora decidió hacer de su arte su propio negocio, el cual ahora es fuente de ingresos para ella sus dos hijos y su esposo. 

A sus 29 años de edad es una luchadora incansable y aunque en ocasiones debido a los pedidos debe trabajar largas jornadas, esto la motiva porque sabe que así logrará mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 

En el futuro Victoria sueña con tener un local propio, pues por ahora, realiza las labores en su casa y las ofrece a sus vecinos, amigos y familiares. Por ahora necesita de un préstamo para comprar surtido e insumos que le permitan aumentar su inventario y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
A skill for making handicrafts is one of the blessings that Victoria Eugenia G. L. enjoys.  When she was a young girl, she knew that this could be her job in the future.  After she married, she was aware of the need to contribute towards covering her household expenses and so this enterprising woman decided to turn her art into her own business.  It is now a source of income for herself, her two children and her husband.

At 29 years old, Victoria is a determined, untiring lady and, in spite of the fact that she occasionally has to work long days due to the orders she has, this motivates her because she knows that it will enable her to improve her own quality of life and that of her family.

In the future, Victoria dreams of owning her own business premises.  Right now, she carries out her work at home and sells her products to her neighbors, friends and family members.  She needs this loan to buy stock and supplies which will allow her to increase her inventory and improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy stock and supplies

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es: L. Sra. Sonia  es casada  y tiene 46 años D. edad, actualmente es integrante en L. alcancía comunal “Amigas Unidas” grupo  conformado por 7  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Sonia    trabaja desD. hace 15 años en L. venta D. carne D. res y carnero en un mercado, Sonia nos cuenta que empezó este trabajo con L. idea D. sacar a sus hijos adelante, tener mejores imgresos economicos ya que con el sueldo D. su esposo no alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos D. servicio agua luz alimentacion, Sonia trabajo muy duro para obtener lo que hoy en día tiene. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación sus hijos fueron a L. universisad, cuentan con una mejor calidad D. vida y sobretodo es feliz. Su sueño es compararse un terreno. El préstamo que se le otorgo fue para comprar mercadería.  Sabemos que Sonia  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Sonia is married and she is 46 years old. She is a member of the communal bank named "Amigas Unidas". It is a group maD. up of 7 members who all have different business activities. Sonia has been selling beef and ram’s meat at a market for the past 15 years. Sonia tells us that she started this business with the thought of supporting her children and to have a better income. Her husband's wages were not enough to cover the household utilities, including water, electricity, and food. Sonia worked very hard to obtain what she has today. Thanks to her efforts and dedication her children attended university, they have a better quality of life, and above all, they are happy. Her dream is to purchase a plot of land. The loan that has been granted to her is to purchase merchandise. We know that Sonia will reach her goals through hard work and efforts. And the loans from Edaprospo (Kiva Field Partner) will help her.

loans.use: to purchase beef and ram's meat for resale.

loans.name: Tuve Mutulo Group

texts.en: Philipo wants a loan to buy coffee to sell. He is a member of Tuve Mutulo, a group which means "we should get out of sleep". The members guarantee each other to access a loan. He is 43 years old and a father to 10 children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He deals in agricultural produce sellin. This is a business he has done for 14 years. He started out by selling second clothes from which he saved money to start up the produce business. His goal is to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy coffee to sell

loans.name: Itabaza  Rsz Group

texts.fr: Chantal est commerçante naquit au Rwanda.et elle est membre du groupe solidaire ITABAZA. Elle est mariée, elle a 30 ans, elle a un  enfant de 4 ans et va à l’école, et elle a deux personnes en charge .elle a 3 ans des études secondaire. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit pour  acheter  les poissons pour les revendre dans le marche locale,. Il n’a aucun difficulté attendue de non-remboursement de son prêt.sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business elle voudrait augmenter la quantité des poissons à vendre. Sa vision c’est pour développer son business, sa famille et éduquer son enfant et le faire soigner.
texts.en:
Chantal is a small-scale merchant born in Rwanda and she is a member of the solidarity group ITABAZA. At 30, she is married and she has a child four years old who attends school. She is also responsible for two other people. 

Chantal went to secondary school for three years. This is her first loan with ACB. She is going to use her loan to buy fish to resell at the local market. There is no expectation that her loan will not be reimbursed. Her strategy for growing her business is to increase the quantity of fish she has to sell. Her dream is to develop her business, her family, educate her child and have him taken care of.

loans.use: to buy fish to resell at the local market.

loans.name: Sos

texts.en:
Mrs. Sos is an young mother who has four children, most of whom are still going to a local school.

Since 2000, producing baskets has been a part of 26-year-old Mrs. Sos’s daily routine in Kompong Chhnang province. She and her husband currently buy raw materials to make baskets at home, where her children assist her. They also buy baskets from other weavers at a reasonable price and resell them to add to their profits. The couple also plants crops on their own fertile land.

Mrs. Sos will be using her loan to add to her personal savings to buy two cows to help her in the fields. This use of the loan will provide her with additional profits.

loans.use: to buy two cows to help her in the fields.

loans.name: Lena

texts.en: Lena is a school teacher. She has a large family and their low salaries cannot sustain the family. Together with her family members she takes care of the cattle and an orchard of walnut, apple and pear trees. Lena has applied for this loan to buy forage for the cattle. Having the cattle fed properly through the winter will assist Lena’s family’s sustainability. Lena lives together with her husband, two sons and a daughter-in-law.

loans.use: to buy forage for the cattle.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is from the northern city of Tamra and has been working for over 30 years as a seamstress. During all her years she took courses and taught herself in order to advance her skills. After years of receiving compliments and being encouraged by customers and friends, Huda started offering seamstress and tailor services in the afternoon. She has also begun to create some of her own designs. Huda wants to further establish her microbusiness and expand her services. Huda works with her sister-in-law at her business and has gained more and more clients wanting to purchase the clothes she creates.

She needs this loan to purchase a more professional sewing machine.

Huda wants to continue expanding her business. She continues to take design classes and wants to branch out into wedding designs and evening dresses.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is married and her husband is a scrap dealer. He deals in plastic and iron scrap. He has good number of business contacts and he makes good sales every month. In order to fulfill the demand of his clients, he needs to buy scrap and for that he needs an investment. That’s why Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah.  This will help him purchasing scrap in bulk quantity and increase his sales and profits. He has been operating his business for the past 10 years and Shahnaz is confident that after the loan investment he will be able to increase his income. 

She is the mother of five children. Three of them are studying. Shahnaz hopes that she will be able to send her remaining children to school as a result of the improved business of her husband. She is a new loan user of Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Shahnaz.

loans.use: To buy scrap for her husband's business.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 34 years old, married and has two children in school. He is a plumber by profession. Thomas earns additional income from his retail shop, which he has been operating for eleven years. He employs two people to assist him as he provides plumbing services.

Thomas has benefited from Faulu Kenya because he has learned how to save his money and to manage his business. He has requested for 50,000 Kenyan shillings to add stock of soda and eggs to his shop.

loans.use: To add stock of soda and eggs.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en:
Carlota is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Carlota has a vegetable garden. She plants & sells eggplants & string beans. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy vegetables for sell.

Carlota has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Carlota hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Uvumilivu Group

texts.en:
Rebecca, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children. One of her children goes to school.  She has had a gengeduka, which means she sells fruits, vegetables, wheat flour, baking flour, cooking oil, and sugar on the same table.  She has had this business for one year now. She works from 7 am. to 8 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her third Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania given in the middle of the main loan that motivates borrowers with good credit ratings who pay back their loans smoothly to receive half amount of the existing loan before their original loan term has ended.  She used the previous loans to expand her gengeduka and has paid back her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to buy more fruits, vegetables, wheat flour, sugar, baking flour and cooking oil to sell. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Uvumilivu", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more fruits, vegetables, wheat flour, sugar, baking flour and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Alberto Jose

texts.es: Alberto José se dedica a una pulpería. Hace más de 21 años que tiene este negocio. Él es una persona muy emprendedora las ganas de salir adelante que obtiene cada día han hecho que Alberto siga adelante con este negocio. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para realizar las comprar variadas de sus productos como leche, huevos, enlatados, sopas, papel higiénico, gaseosas, jugos, pan entre otros.
texts.en:
Alberto José has a general store, and he has had this business for over 21 years.  He is a very enterprising person.  His daily desire to get ahead has made Alberto advance with this business.

That is why he is requesting this loan to buy various products like milk, eggs, canned goods, soup, toilet paper, soft drinks, and bread, among others.

loans.use: to buy various products like milk, eggs, canned goods, soup, toilet paper, soft drinks, and bread, among others.

loans.name: José Lino

texts.es: José Lino de cuarenta y seis años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo. El posee un negocio de reparación, compra y venta de llantas, el taller se encuentra en el lugar donde  vive y es muy conocido en la localidad pues el ofrece un excelente servicio la reparación que realiza a las llantas es muy confiable y las llantas que vende son de muy buena calidad es por eso que últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque siempre satisface sus necesidades a muy buenos precios; José Lino es un hombre activo, con entusiasmo de salir adelante, para el que trabaja con el corazón y con perseverancia alcanza sus objetivos , es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar llantas de esta forma, José Lino tiene fe que le podrá dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Jose Lino, 46, lives with his life partner and their son.  He has a business buying, selling and repairing tires.  His workshop is in the same place where he lives.  He is well-known in the neighborhood, because he offers excellent service.  His tire repairs are very reliable, and the tires that he sells are of good quality.  Because of this, he has lately had a lot of customers because he always satisfies their needs at very good prices.  Jose Lino is an active man who has an enthusiasm to get ahead, and so by putting his heart into his work and with perseverance, he will reach his goals.  This is why he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow him to buy tires.  In this way, Jose Lino has faith that he will be able to provide his family with a better quality of life, and bring economic security to his household.

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a single woman. She has two children 14 and 16. She describes herself as honest.
