She operates a butcher shop and a cereals sales business where she sells meat and cereals including beans, maize and green grams (mung beans). She has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in a shopping center. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as the high cost of renting the business premises. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to increase the stock of cereals. Her business goal is to grow the businesses, separate them and employ people to run the two businesses within five years.

loans.use: To add stock of cereals

loans.name: Gerry

texts.en:
Due to the hardships of life, Gerry strives hard to provide for his family’s needs. He has been a farmer for more than 18 years and he plants, harvests, and sells corn. Gerry plans to improve his family’s standard of living and give them a happy life. Despite the problems and difficulties he encounters as a farmer, he has the determination to be successful someday. 

Gerry is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay labor costs to plant corn. His loan will help a lot to improve his business. Gerry wants to increase his yields to increase his income and finance the education of his children. He hopes that, in the future, he will improve his income as he continues to work and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide and hire farmhands

loans.name: Juan Esteban

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su familia, su esposa y dos hijos, él tiene un negocio con el molino de nixtamal, una granja de cerdos y un taller de refrigeración, aprendió el negocio con unos amigos, trabajando junto a ellos logro aprender y hoy en día administra sus propios negocios.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de repuestos para reparar un molino, él aun desconoce cuáles serán los repuestos que deba comprar, pues el molino debe ser revisado por una persona especializada y con conocimientos en la reparación de molinos, este préstamo le ayudara para poder darle mantenimiento a esta máquina para continuar prestando servicios a los clientes.
La aspiración de Juan es mantener los negocios con la ayuda de los préstamos, tanto la granja, el molino y el taller, son las fuentes de ingresos que desea mantener por un largo tiempo, para poder proveer a su familia lo necesario.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his family: his wife and two children.  He has a corn mill, a pig farm and a refrigeration shop.  He learned the business with some friends.  By working alongside them he learned and now he runs his own businesses.

He’s asking for the loan to buy spare parts to repair a mill.  He still doesn’t know what these parts he’ll have to buy will be because the mill has to be examined by a specialist who knows how to repair mills.  The loan will help him service the machine and continue providing service to customers.

Juan’s hope is to keep the businesses, the farm, mill and shop, going with help from the loans.  They are his sources of income that he’d like to have for a long time to provide his family with what’s needed.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair a mill.

loans.name: Ciomurumia

texts.en:
Ciomurumia is married and has eight children ranging from twenty-nine to forty years old. She describes herself as ambitious. She runs a general store where she sells household and farm products. She has been in this business for eight years.The business is faced with the challenge of increased price of goods.

She will be using the loan of Kes 20,000 to add to her stock of farm and household goods. In the next five years, Ciomurumia wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To add to her stock of farm products and household goods.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells rice porridge at Besease near Elmina. Mary is married to a farmer and has three children.  She has been selling porridge for eight years.  She uses her income to help her husband pay utility bills. Mary will use this loan to purchase rice for the preparation of the porridge. With the profit, Mary will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice to prepare porridge.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Mary Jane is making and peddling viands like jackfruit salad, fried fish, and afritada (stew). She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making the viands.

Mary Jane is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands to sell.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. Gabriel; el tiene 32 años de edad y es soltero; El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania como pinturas y cuadros y tambien sigue trabajando en una empresa publica,el socio el negocio de artesania lo vende en forma independiente desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el sueño del socio es tener una tienda donde pueda vender la artesania . El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía como cuadros y pinturas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sr. Gabriel is 32 years old, single, and continues to work in his business where he sells handicrafts such as pictures and paintings. He also continues working at his job with a public company. In his handicraft business, Gabriel sells independently between the hours of 8am and 6pm. His dream is to have a shop where he can sell handicrafts. He is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, such as pictures and paintings.

Gabriel is happy with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to purchase pictures and paintings to sell.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared, 29 years old, is married and has three children.  To earn a living, he does farming.  He has been in the business for seven years.  He mainly grows spinach, tomatoes and kale.  He has employed three people in his farm.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access business loans and has been trained in business management skills.

Jared hopes to practice large-scale farming in five years.  He needs a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Benkadi Yologosso 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi Yologosso 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 4 enfants et vivant majoritairement dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Kouroubadougou, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec   RACHELLE , debout au milieu, sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte  acheter des intrants, semence, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour  pour l’exploitation de 1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 165.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group BENKADI YOLOGOSSO 3 are married women who average 39 years of age and four children each. They live mostly in traditional families in Kouroubadougou, a village in San, the fourth administrative region of Mali. 

This is their third collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season. All past loans were correctly repaid.

Rachelle sells groundnuts. She is the one standing in the center of the photo. She will use her loan to purchase inputs, seeds and small farming tools, and to pay for the cost of plowing 1 hectare. After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the village and at the market of San to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to earn an average profit of 165,000 CFAF per season. This will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase inputs, seeds and small farming tools, and to pay for the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is 57 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been growing vegetables to sell for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $5 each day. Three of her children are employed. They earn $6 per day. The young man who is joining her in the picture is her son. 

Due to lack of funds, Mai is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase timber and zinc to fix her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to rent a store to sell vegetables in the market and help her children earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase timber and zinc to fix her house

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is 50 years old and she lives in the Likoni area, where she has a printing business that has been there for ten years. 

She is a married business lady with four children. She is also earns a salary, and she hopes that the business grows so that she can move to it full time. 

Prisca learned of Milango through friends, and now seeks a loan to buy printing material for her business.  

She wants to employ ten people in the next five years, despite the usual challenges of competition and inadequate materials. 

Prisca will use the extra income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy printing material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sewing and school uniform fabric to expand her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells palm oil on a large scale to market women in her community. She prepares the oil herself and retails to customers. She buys the palm fruits from farmers. She needs a Kiva loan of $900.00 to enable her to buy enough palm fruits.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will invest the credit to purchase goods to stock her store.

loans.name: Roxanda

texts.en: Roxanda V. M., or "Rossy" as she is known in the neighborhood, buys and sells new and used clothing in her area. She goes to Guatemala City to purchase clothing at wholesale and then brings it back to Mazatenango where she can sell it at a markup. The new clothing will often fetch a 100% markup, while the used clothing does not do so well. She's considering dropping the used clothing line because of the low markup. Rossy is a member of the group of women "Mujeres de Ánimo" and with this loan she'll invest in more new clothing for sale. She thinks she can get at least three dozen pants, three dozen blouses, and two dozen dresses with this credit. Her group is in their third cycle of credit. Rossy dreams of having her own place, instead of having to rent her current apartment, which costs about 700 Guatemalan Quetzales per month, or US$91. And someday she'd like to have a real storefront instead of just having a little room in front of her house. Rossy is unmarried and has two children, but they're now grown.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to add to inventory

loans.name: María

texts.en:
María is 27 years old and lives with her boyfriend and 2 children who are 3 and 6 years old. The eldest goes to school, and is in the first grade. Her boyfriend works for a potable water company where he has worked for 10 years and supports the household with his monthly salary.

María is a young entrepreneur who started her business, a store selling an assortment of goods, 3 years ago. She said that it was thanks to luck that she one day won a lottery prize of US $200 which she invested in the purchase of merchandise to begin supplying her store.

Her wish is to see her children grow up to be professionals, and she works hard every day without rest to ensure this happens. Now María needs a loan to buy more merchandise for her store, such as flour, rice, sugar, and soft drinks, in order to expand her business and help make her wish come true.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Hin

texts.en: Mrs. Hin S., aged 42, makes medicinal rice wine to sell to people in her area, earning about $3.60 per day. Her husband works as a laborer, earning about $2.90 per day. They have two children who are in school. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to purchase more tools for her husband’s construction work. She plans to use the remainder of the loan to purchase pigs to rear and resell in the market for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools and pigs to raise.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Mrs Felipa has 3 children and currently belongs to the community bank “Las Gaviotas”. She manages a three wheeler light delivery van, but also works wrapping tobacco and producing cigarettes for a tobacco company in her city.

Aiming to improve her quality of life and see her children develop and progress, she works hard and with determination.

She requests the loan in order to buy another three wheeler delivery van, that will help her to start a business of spare parts and lubricants for cars and three wheeler vans.

She sincerely hopes you can kindly offer her help.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Felipa, es madre de tres hijos, en la actualidad pertenece al banco comunal Las Gaviotas.Se dedica a la administración de su motocarro y de manera adicional se dedica también a la envoltura de tabaco y a la fabricación de cigarrillos en una empresa tabaquera de su ciudad. Con el propósito de mejorar su calidad de vida y el de observar el surgimiento de sus hijos se desempeña con ahínco y fortaleza. Desea comprar otro motocarro y mediante los ingresos del mismo llegar a implementar un negocio de lubricantes y repuestos de motos y motocarros, para lo cual requiere de una suma de dinero para invertirlos en la compra de su vehículo trimovil. Ella espera por la ayuda desinteresada de tu noble corazón.

loans.use: To buy a three wheeler light delivery van for a spare parts and lubricants business

loans.name: Thi Duc

texts.vi:
Beside working on her rice field and raising chickens, Ms Đức, 45, also sells fruits. She feels comfortable with the weekly payment arrangement with Bình Minh fund (SEDA) so she applies for a loan of 2006000 VND (150 USD) to buy fruits. This would help increase her wage.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Ngòai công việc nhà nông là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi gà thả vườn, cô Đức, 45 tuổi, còn buôn bán các loại hoa quả. Cô rất thích hình thức tiết kiệm để trả góp hàng tuần của tổ chức vi mô Bình Minh nên đã mạnh dạn vay 2006000 VND để bổ sung vốn mua hoa quả.

loans.use: To buy fruits for sales

loans.name: Mey

texts.en: Mrs. Mey S., 38, works with her husband on their farm growing rice crops and raising horse making totally about $3 each day of income. This couple has seven children. One of their children works making incenses; another one works as a garment worker; one of whom is enrolled in school and the rest of which are married and stay separately. Mrs. Mey S. is humble to request for a loan to expand her livestock by adding more healthy horse to breed for generating more profit in the next twelve to eight months.

loans.use: To purchase more horses to breed.

loans.name: Kimombasa South B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fatina N.. She is currently in the business of produce sales and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Fatina is 28 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from age 3 to 13 and her children go to school. Each week, Fatina makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for her children's education. Fatina has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Fatina is joined in her small group by Zipora K., Zaituna N., Salam N., and Annet K.. Zipora K. has a business running a restaurant and wants to buy more raw food and big saucepans. Zaituna N. is currently operating a business selling produce and wants a loan to add to her business. Salam N. operates a business of selling produce and wants to trade in bulk. Annet K. is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to increase the inventory.

loans.use: To add to produce business

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
THE ASSOCIATION CALLED "THE FRIENDSHIP" HAS BELONGED TO THE FAMILY OF PRO-MUJER FOR MANY YEARS COMPLETING ALREADY 19 LOANS. THE GROUP IS LOCATED IN THE ZONE OF ALTA LIMA, CITY OF EL ALTO. CURENTLY THE GROUP HAS 15 ASSOCIATES AND IT HAS PROVEN TO BE A GROUP ORGANIZED TO MANAGE THEIR LOANS.

AMONG THOSE IN THE GROUP THE MAJORITY ARE MARRIED WITH CHILDREN, ALMOST ALL OF SCHOOL AGE, EXCEPT THAT, IN SOME CASES, THEY LACK THE RESOURCES AND, PITIFULLY, THEIR CHILDREN COULD NOT ENTER SCHOOL. IN THESE CASES, THE CHILDREN OFTEN HELP THEIR PARENTS IN THEIR SMALL BUSINESS AND TAKE CARE OF THEIR SMALLER BROTHERS AND SISTERS.

THEY HAVE DIFFERENT BUSINESSES SUCH AS; THE SALE OF CHICKEN MEAT, MILK, AND UNDERWEAR BUT THE MAIN ACTIVITY IS THE SEWING OF SPORTS CLOTHING THAT, ONCE PRODUCED. THEY SELL IN THE OPEN AIR MARKETS OF THE CITY OF LA PAZ. THEY SAY THAT THEY NEED MORE CAPITAL FOR THE PURCHASE OF BETTER QUALITY FABRICS. IN THIS MANNER THEIR PRODUCTS ALSO WILL BE BETTER QUALITY AND THEY WILL HAVE MORE CLIENTS. BY INCREASING THEIR PROFITS WITH THE ULTIMATE OBJECTIVE OF IMPROVING THEIR ECONOMIC SITUATION THEY HOPE TO OFFER THEIR CHILDREN A BETTER FORM OF LIFE CHIEFLY IN THEIR EDUCATION.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

LA ASOCIACION DENOMINADA “LA AMISTAD” PERTENECE A LA FAMILIA DE PRO-MUJER HACE YA VARIOS AÑOS CUMPLIENDO CON 19 CICLOS DE CREDITO, ESTA SE ENCUENTRA EN LA ZONA DE ALTO LIMA, DE LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO, A LA FECHA CUENTA CON 15 SOCIAS Y HA DEMOSTRADO SER UN GRUPO ORGANIZADO EN CUANTO A SUS CUOTAS DE CREDITO.

DENTRO EL GRUPO LA MAYORIA SON CASADAS Y CON HIJOS, CASI TODOS EN EDAD ESCOLAR, EXISTIENDO ALGUNOS CASOS QUE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS LASTIMOSAMENTE SUS HIJOS NO PUDIERON INGRESAR A LA ESCUELA. YA QUE ESTOS DEBEN AYUDAR A SUS PADRS EN SUS PEQUEÑOS NEGOCIOS Y CUIDAR DE SUS HERMANOS MENORES.

EXISTEN DIFERENTES NEGOCIOS DENTRO LA ASOCIACION COMO SER; LA VENTA DE CARNE DE POLLO, DE LACTEOS, ROPA INTIMA PERO LA ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL ES LA COSTURA DE PRENDAS DEPORTIVAS QUE UNA VEZ PRODUCIDAS LAS VENDEN EN LAS FERIAS DE LA CIUDAD DE LA PAZ ELLAS AFIRMAN QUE NECESITAN MAYOR CAPITAL PARA LA COMPRA DE TELAS DE MEJOR CALIDAD DE ESTA MANERA SUS PRIDUCTOS TAMBIEN TENDRIAN MEJOR CALIDAD Y ASI OBTENDRIAN MAYORES CLIENTES Y POR COINSIGUIENTE MAYORES GANANCIAS CON EL UNICO OBJETIVO DE MEJORAR SU SITUACION ECONOMICA DE ESTA MANERA OFRECER A SUS HIJOS UNA MEJOR FORMA DE VIDA PRINCIPALMENTE EN SU EDUCACION.

loans.use: To purchase better quality fabrics for making sports clothing.

loans.name: Matrida

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Matrida M.. She is married and has 2 children aged 7 and 10. In 2006 Matrida established her grocery business. Matrida requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of soda, sugar, oil, and soap in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of oil, sugar, soda, and soap in bulk

loans.name: Luisa Eugenio

texts.en:
Luisa is 43 years old and originally from the capital city Maputo. She is married and has two children, both attending school. On top of her children, Luisa also supports her parents who live with her and four nieces who Luisa sends money and food each month.

Luisa grew up with her parents. She studied until 6th grade and stopped in 1983 in order to go to nursing technical school. Since 1991 Luisa has worked as a nurse at the Jose Macamo Hospital, working at different shifts five days per week. With her monthly salary Luisa is able to save around MTn 500 per month to cover any emergency the family may have. Luisa is also back at school, currently studying at 8th grade during the nights, from 6:00pm to 10:00pm daily.

This will be Luisa’s first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. With the MTn 12,000 loan Luisa intends to buy sanitary vase, a sink and other things to finish building her bathroom. Luisa already had a loan from former Banco Austral (now Barclays), which she also used to build the bathroom, buying aluminum roofing and cement. That loan she had to pay back all at once and they were not flexible in terms of the value and number of installments.

In the future Luisa would like to finish high school and learn how to drive, getting a drivers’ license. Her dream is to one day driver her own car.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for her house.

loans.name: Chhoun

texts.en:
Mrs. Y. Chhoun, 48, and her husband, Mr. Savoeun Chorn, 53, live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh and have been married since the Pol Pot regime. They have five daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home. Of the three children still living at home, one is a silk weaver at home, one is a garment factory worker, and one is in a local school.

Mrs. Y. has been raising pigs since 2003. Before starting this business, she was a silk weaver. Mr. Savoeun has been in the business of producing rice wine since 1979. Y. is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.use: To purchase feeds for raising pigs.

loans.name: Sirayel

texts.fr:
Sirayel M., a widow with 5 children of whom she takes care, has been a member of the Vélingara Foulbé 2 village bank for the past 5 and a half years. She would like to obtain a loan so that she can buy and sell bread, dried sorrel (a herb), packs of sugar and other ingredients to make fruit juices and ice. Her income will help her take care of the children in her care. This loan will be reimbursed in six months in one installement.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Sirayel M., veuve avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Vélingara Foulbé 2 depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter du pain de singe,de l'oseille séché, du sucre, des sachets et des ingrédients pour faire des jus de fruit et de la glace et vendre.Ses revenus lui permettent d'entretenir les enfants à sa charge.Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to make fruit juice and ice

loans.name: Mrs. Chi Chhunheang's Group

texts.en:
This group of six made up a loan group. They are located in Khsom Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Chi C., 46, is the group leader. She and her husband, Mr. Huot Bunly, are fisher folk in the local lake which is next to the village. Since their business is going well, they plan to gather more fish to sell in order to support their family.

Thus, Mrs. Chi C. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more fish nets in order to catch more fish. Mrs. Chi C. has four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending school. One of her children who is attending school has free time from studying, so that child works as a construction worker in order to help support the family.

loans.use: to buy more fish nets in order to catch more fish

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria U. is 34 years old and married with one child. Gloria lives in Afro Media, Lagos state, Nigeria. She is a LAPO client. Gloria sells frozen foods like turkey, beef, and chicken. The demand for her frozen foods is high and she hopes to meet that demand. She has been in this business for the past 5 years. Gloria needs a loan to buy more frozen foods to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders and LAPO microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Latofat

texts.en:
Latofat is the loving mother of three adorable children. Her husband has gone to Russia to look for a better paying job. So, to help her husband support the large family, Latofat started her own business. She raises and fattens cattle, and then sells them at the cattle market. This is the way she feeds her family.    
With the help of this loan, Latofat plans to increase the number of her cattle, fatten them in the winter, and then sell them.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.en:
Iskandar is one of the most hard-working young men in the area where he lives, which differentiates him from other local residents and makes him stand out as a well-respected and very important member of the community.  

Farming requires a lot of effort, which is why from a young age, Iskandar has dedicated himself to this business and today is seeking a way to expand his efforts in order to support his family, which consists of his wife and a son.  

Because his crop provides the main income for the family, he is seeking a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750 USD) for the term of 9 months to plow more farmland and purchase seeds and fertilizer.  The loan will allow him to expand his farming business.  Iskandar hopes the loan can increase the family's income.  He hopes you will support him and thanks you for your generosity.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer for sowing potatoes and onions

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu H. K. is a dressmaker in Kampala town. She sews different types of outfits which she supplies to both the retail and wholesale shops in town. She has three sewing machines and has employed three workers to help her construct clothing. This hardworking lady would use this loan to purchase more fabrics to produce garments in large quantities and meet the rising demands of customers.

She is married with two children and looks forward to educating them to university levels. She hopes that the profit from the business enable her to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fabric.

loans.name: Kimtray

texts.en:
Mr. Kimtray L., 28, and his wife, Mrs. Savy Yan, 29, who live in a small village off of National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, have been married for eight years and have three daughters. One of their children attends school. Besides their children, they also have a niece and their parents living with them.

Kimtray has been a mason for eight years, a skill he learned from his brother. His wife has been a garment factory worker for ten years. Kimtray is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to purchase construction materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for his business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. is currently in the business of selling bread, eggs, and cakes at the market. Rose is 35 years old and married. Her husband is a clerk in the Ministry of Education. She has three children who all go to school. She is requesting a loan to expand the business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business selling food at the market.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A. is twenty-eight years. She is single and lives at Wasa Simpa in the western region of Ghana. She owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood and also sells cosmetics. Florence is a very skillful and talented hair dresser. Through the innovative touches she adds to her customer’s hair, she has attracted lots of clients who come to have their hair done. Florence has been in this business for the past five years and has significant experience in customer care.

She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service. Therefore, she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, and activators to serve her customers. Florence belongs to a village bank called ‘St Martin’s’. She also hope to receive GH¢800 to improve her business by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, and activators.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo C. is determined and hardworking. He is 72 years old, married, and lives at Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. Although he’s older, he still very works hard to earn an income, and he’s happy about what he’s been doing. He has 6 children. His income comes from his “sari-sari” (general) store, in which his wife is his partner. They have good chemistry. 

Because of the benefits that Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative has given to pensioners like him, he decided to take a loan to buy additional canned goods and other supplies for his sari-sari store. He wanted to expand his business into a grocery store that offers a variety products for sale. He also wanted to have a restaurant adjacent to his grocery store.

loans.use: To buy canned goods and other supplies for his sari-sari store

loans.name: Silia

texts.en: Silia M., 29, is married with three children. She has two years of experience in the plantation/vegetable garden business. She sells to the village people and general public, two days per week. She has not had a previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~105 USD). SPBD loans are Silia’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals and seeds for a vegetable garden

loans.name: Juana Eliana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor”, en el distrito de Mazo-Cruz, provincia del Collao, departamento de Puno; tiene 25 años de edad, ella es conviviente, tiene 01 hijo y posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Ella trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 09 años aproximadamente, su primer préstamo fue de S/300.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en la compra de fruta.
Ahora ella implemento su negocio ya que ya no se dedica solo a la venta de fruta sino también, tiene una panadería.  Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 nuevos soles, podrá ampliar su negocio.  Comprará chocolates, caramelos, Harina y levadura para el negocio de panadería.
Ella es una de las socias mas puntuales del Banco Comunal, su mayor deseo es ampliar su negocio para ser una gran tienda.  Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad de todo el grupo.  Se siente agradecida por los préstamos recibidos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana is a member of the God is Love Community Bank, in the district of Mazo-Cruz, in the province of Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 25 years old, lives with her partner, has 1 son, and has completed secondary school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for about 9 years. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she invested in the purchase of fruit. Now she stocks her store with not just fruit, but she also has a bakery. With this loan of 1500 nuevos soles, she will be able to grow her business. She will buy chocolates, caramels, flour, and yeast for the bakery. She is one of the most punctual clients of the Community Bank. Her biggest dream is to grow her business so that she has a big store. What she like most about her Community Bank is the punctuality of the whole group. She is thankful for the loan she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chocolates, caramels, flour, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Vilma Elida

texts.es:
La señora Elida es socia del banco comunal “Las Fronterizas” en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 33 años de edad, casada, tiene 03 hijos y posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja desde hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos e inicio su negocio de preparación de alimentos (polleria) con S/. 300.00 Nuevos  soles.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, comprará mas víveres, así como insumos necesarios para poder abastecer su negocio, de esta manera contribuirá a mejorar la calidad educativa de sus hijos ya que quiere darles una profesión.
A la señora Elida le gusta mucho las reuniones y orientaciones que se les da Manuela Ramos, dice que les da aliento para seguir adelante
texts.en:
Ms. R. is a member of the “Las Fronterizas” microfinance institute in the district of Desaguadero of the Chucuito province, department of Puno. She is a 33-year-old married mother with three children. She also completed high school.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for three years. She started her food sales (chicken) business with a 300.00 PEN loan. With this 3,000.00 PEN loan, she will purchase more provisions and supplies necessary to restock her business, thus she can contribute to improving the quality of her children’s education because she wants them to become professionals.

Ms. R. really likes the meetings and orientations that Manuela Ramos gives them. She says that they give her the encouragement she needs to keep moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, chicken, vegetables, potatoes, natural gas, and spices

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites A. aims to make her business grow in order to send her five children to school and also to repair her home. Her family is poor but Marites believes that their poverty is not a hindrance to success. She is determined to reach her goal in life to provide for her family, especially her children. They live in a rural community located Barangay Murong Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Marvel and they are blessed with five children. Two of the children are in high school while the others are currently in elementary school. At present, they are struggling financially but they keep trying their best to work had and earn a living. Marvel works as a janitor while Marites earns a living by selling vegetables and balut. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 as additional working capital for her vending business. With the extra capital she hopes to increase her business and earn a higher income.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is a married mother of three children, two sons and one daughter who are all currently in the senior high and primary schools. She is fifty years old. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. She says her husband is a farmer. Elizabeth is a food vendor. She fries and sells doughnuts. She supplies to other retailers and beverage sellers in her community and hawks to sell. She buys bags of flour and other ingredients from Kumasi. Elizabeth has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy flour in bulk

loans.name: Prospérité Plus Group

texts.fr: Josée K. vend des beignets, des boissons sucrées et de l’eau pure dans un quartier très populaire situé au nord de Kinshasa. Elle a commencé son activité en 1993. Après une année de prospérité, son affaire a connu une baisse suite à son hospitalisation causée par la fièvre typhoïde. Après la mort de son mari en 1994, Josée décida de pérenniser cette micro entreprise qui a beaucoup supporté les études de ses trois enfants qui vont encore à l’école. De 1996 – 2002, elle ouvrit une pharmacie et une boutique dont elle fut victime d’escroquerie. Elle ferma la pharmacie pour renforcer la boutique avec les crédits obtenus de Hope à travers un des groupes dénommé « Prospérité Plus ». Le prêt qu’elle recevra le cycle prochain sera utilisé pour acheter des cartons des savons et autres articles pour renforcer le stock de la boutique en vue d’accroitre le revenu. Josée est âgée de 50 ans et a cinq enfants dont leurs âges varient de 15 à 31 ans. L’ainée d’entre eux est mariée et quatre autres vivent avec elle.
texts.en:
Josée K. sells doughnuts, sweet drinks and pure water in a very busy neighborhood to the north of Kinshasa. She started the business in 1993. After a very prosperous year, she was hospitalized with typhoid fever and business dropped off. Following the death of her husband in 1994, Josée decided to continue with her micro-business, which helped greatly towards the education of her three children, who are still at school. From 1996-2002 she operated a pharmacy and small store but fell victim to fraud. She closed the pharmacy to expand the store using loans she obtained from Hope via one of the “Prosperity Plus” groups. The loan she will receive during the next loan cycle will be used to buy boxes of soap and other items in order to boost the store’s inventory and thus increase her income. Josée is 50 years old and has five children aged between 15 and 31. The eldest is married and the four others live with her.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of soap and other items to boost store inventory and increase revenue

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad J., age 47, grows rice for her livelihood. She started farming when she married Melchor J., a farmer in her village. She has four children and wants to send all of them to school.

To do it, she needs to expand her farm. However, she needs additional capital to buy fertilizer and chemicals. She would like to ask for a loan of Php 10,000. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and chemicals.

Now, she is more delighted with CEVI services. CEVI provides not just loans to people, but education to grow their businesses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Corazon Chopcca Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Corazon D. Chopcca, pertenece al distrito D. Yauli, provincia D. Huancavelica ubicada en el departamento D. Huancavelica. L. comunidad se encuentra rodeada D. cerros, con bellos paisajes con árboles y hierbas silvestres, el paisaje llamado Nación Chopcca muestra a las señoras con vestidos coloridos tejidos a mano, su actividada principal es L. artesanía, L. agricultura y un poco D. ganadería.

Margarita es casada y tiene 04 hijos. Margarita teje desD. muy niña, habilidad que le genera algún ingreso, ya que envía sus tejidos para su venta a L. capital, cada vez que algún conocido viaja a elL.. Margarita, necesita un préstamo D. S/200.00 para comprar materia prima para continuar con sus tejidos. A elL. le gustaría tener sus propias maquina D. tejer.

Aurelia es casada y tiene 06 hijos. Aurelia scomo L. mayoria D. las mujeres D. su comunidad tambien se dedica al tejido, pero tambien tiene una pequeña bodega, que poco a poco va creciendo, gracias a L. inversión que esta haciendo en elL.. Aurelia solicita un prestamo D. S/200.00 para abastecer su tienda, con productos que demandan mayor salida. 

Juana es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Juana venD. comida en las ferias y L. vez se dedica a tejer pequeñas prendas, las cuales envía a Lima para su venta.  Juan requiere D. un préstamo D. S/200 soles para comprara utensilios, mesas y bancas para su negocio.
texts.en:
The Corazon D. Chopcca Community Banks belongs to the Yauli district in the Huancavelica province, which is located in the Huancavelica department. The community is surrounded by hills and pretty scenery of trees and wild grasses. The Nación Chopcca landscape shows women dressed in colorful hand woven clothing. Their primary activity is handicrafts, agriculture, and a little livestock. Margarita is married and has four children. Margarita has been weaving since she was a very little girl. This ability generates some income. She sends her weavings to be sold in the capital every time that someone she knows goes there. Margarita needs a loan for 200 PEN to buy raw material to continue with her weavings. She would like to have her own weaving machine. Aurelia is married and has six children. Aurelia, like most of the women in the community, also weaves. But, she also has a small grocery store. Little by little, the store is growing thanks to the investment she is making in it. Aurelia needs a loan for 200 PEN to stock her store with products that are in greater demand. Juana is married and has 3 children. Juana sells food in the fairs. She also weaves small articles of clothing, which she sends to Lima to sell. Juana needs a loan for 200 PEN to buy utensils, tables, and benches for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The 15 member of the Community Bank are asking for 4,000 PEN to invest in their handicrafts businesses

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felista is a member of the Nyamhanga borrower group in Ruaha,Iringa,she is 30 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children,Her children are aged 9,6,1 years.

Felista started her own business selling charcoal 2 years ago,she work  12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Felista`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Felista hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Lucrecia Miriam

texts.es:
La señora Lucrecia Miriam P. se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos tales como planchas, televisores, abanicos, arroceras, radios, entro otros. Ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito para la compra de los electrodomésticos con el propósito de ofertarlos en su localidad.

Actualmente espera en que su crédito será otorgado satisfactoriamente y así mejorará sus ingresos y llevará el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucrecia Miriam P. sells electrical appliances such as irons, televisions, fans, rice cookers, radios, and other items. She has come to CEPRODEL to request a loan to buy more appliances to offer from her store.

She hopes that her loan will be approved so that she can improve her earnings and sustain her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase home appliances

loans.name: Love Yourself Group

texts.en:
Gladys W. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called 'Love Yourself'. She is 32 years old, a single mother with  2 children aged 6 and 13 years old. They are in school. She is illiterate due to lack of financial support from her parents.

Gladys lives and works in West Point, a poor community close to the capital, Monrovia, Liberia. Gladys' business is the sale of general home products to the residents of West Point, Monrovia, Liberia. She started this business with Ld$10,000 and has been running this business for 3 years despite challenges of price changes.

Gladys' good relations and quality products make customers always patronize her business. She needs this loan in order to purchase more goods to serve her customers. 

She dreams of expanding her business to a bigger shop so that she can educate her children.

loans.use: in order to purchase more goods to serve her customers

loans.name: Kayode

texts.en: Kayode O. is 32 years old and married with a child. He sells lubricants such as engine oil. He is a hardworking man who hopes to expand his business. Kayode is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more lubricants to sell. He is very grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more lubricants to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline P. is from the village of Panadtalan, Valencia Bukidnon. She is 29 years old. Evangeline is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling flavored ice drops in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evangeline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Evangeline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pedra

texts.en:
Pedra S. is from the village of Grace Village, Sto. Nino, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 56 years old. Pedra is married and has 1 school-aged child. Pedra sells snacks & other delicacies in the local community to make a living. Pedra has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Pedra joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Pedra is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she has for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Pedra from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make and sell food products.

loans.name: But

texts.en: But S., a 38-year-old mother of six children, all teenagers and attending school, generates her daily income by selling stone with her husband. Purchasing large stone blocks from people who live near the mountains, they break down and carve them into small pieces, finally selling the pieces to people who need them to build their houses or to cover the street. This stone-selling business is the family's main source of income, and But S. is looking for her second loan in the amount of $1100 to purchase more stone blocks.

loans.use: To purchase more stone for resale

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is thirty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to five children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing business is the major occupation of the people. Cecilia is a baker. She bakes bread and supplies it to retailers and beverage sellers. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Mirna Amalia

texts.es: Mirna Amalia Z. E. de 48 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella vive sola, y posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad. Desde hace ocho años Mirna emprendió su negocio propio, viéndose en la necesidad de hacerlo, ya que perdió su trabajo y le fue imposible encontrar uno nuevo. Es por esto que para Mirna es de mucha importancia poder surtir la tienda, razón principal por la cual solicita el préstamo, ya que su mayor deseo es poder equipar su negocio con todo lo necesario, de manera que sus clientela aumente y así mismo sus ventas. Ella espera poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, a través de las ventas que obtenga, ya que la tienda es la que le permite contar con todo lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
Mirna Amalia Z. E., 48, lives alone in the San Salvador department. She has a store, and she sells perishable basic needs items. Mirna started her own business eight years ago. She saw the need to do so because she lost her job, and it was impossible to find a new one. That is why it is so important to Mirna to be able to stock her store. It is the main reason she is asking for the loan. Her greatest wish is to be able to equip her business with everything that is needed so that the number of customers she has will increase and that will increase her sales. She hopes to be able to improve her living conditions with the sales that she will get. The store is what allows her to have the necessities of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perishable products for her store

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est une femme de 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SILANE depuis 6 ans. elle fait le commerce de sucre et d'huile d'arachide qu'elle a elle même extraite. Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne et de participer aux différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
Fatou D. is a 45-year-old woman, married and mother of seven children. She has been a member of the ‘Banc Villageois’ loan group of SILANE for six years. Her business is selling sugar and peanut oil that she extracts herself. Her objective is to increase her level of savings and share in managing various family expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolster her capacity for self-financing

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr: Bintou S. est une femme de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de VELINGARA-OUEST2 depuis 6 ans et demi et a une bonne expérience en matière de crédit et dans son domaine d'activité. Elle est vendeuse de légumes et son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Bintou S. is a 40 year old woman, married and mother of four children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois Velingra-Ouest 2 for six and a half years. She has a good experience with borrowing and in her business sector. She sells vegetables and her goal is to help her husband with the financial support of her family.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her ability to self-finance

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 32 year old father of two from Nairobi.  He is a fish monger and sells in the open market.  Daniel has been in this business for two years. 

He is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to support his fish business.  He desires to live a good life and to create employment.  Daniel  says that he has learned to manage his business records since joining Faulu Kenya.  He describes himself as a capable salesman.

loans.use: Add stock of fish and fish products

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria sells iced and dried fish in one of the local markets in Asaba. Dried and iced fish are used in the preparation of mouth watering Nigerian soup. She has been in this business for a long time and uses her experience in business to attract and retain more customers. With this business, she provides the basic family needs.

Maria is a widow with a child and is also a grandmother. She hopes to expand her business but her challenge is funds. She hopes to overcome this challenge. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more dried and iced fish to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more iced and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Mr. Pon C., 60 and his wife, Mrs. Ky Phon (pictured together), 60, live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1975 and have five childrens. Three of the children are married and live in separate homes, one is a security guard and another one is a farmer. The couple is old; however, they are still strong enough to work. 

Pon has been selling cows for 35 years, a skill he learned from his father. His wife has been running grocery store in front of her house for two years. He is asking for his first loan of 600 USD to help his capital to purchase cows for resale.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale.

loans.name: Jonaly

texts.en:
Jonaly is 34 years old, married and lives in the province of Rizal in the Philippines with her husband and two young children. To earn additional income for her family, Jonaly owns and operates a business selling rice in her neighborhood. She has been a busy entrepreneur for almost five years. Jonaly would like to take out a loan to purchase inventory of rice amounting to 20,000 PHP. She believes in offering sufficient inventory of rice in her house for customers seeking to make convenient purchases.

A good member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Jonaly is grateful for the secured access to capital and loans to fund her entrepreneurial dreams. Her long-term goals are to expand her retail business, fund her children's college education and support her family financially. With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, she is determined to achieve business success with her entrepreneurial endeavors.

loans.use: To purchase inventory of rice

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.es: Raymunda tiene 51 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos menores. La actividad que realiza es trazar y cortar telas, en donde pone toda su concentración, ya que tiene que diferenciar y seleccionar las tallas de polos. La mesa de su comedor, es su herramienta de trabajo, sobre ella ejecuta los trazos sobre la tela a cortar. Ella se esmera en cortar las medidas exactas de cada pieza, en que luego son llevadas al taller de su amiga, para coser y remallar las prendas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es diseñar, por lo que lleva 2 años trabajando de esta manera, siendo lo más difícil, no contar con el material apropiado para continuar trabajando. Para en el futuro, planea comprarse una maquina de coser e iniciar un taller de confecciones. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente, ya que será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su actividad. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará telas al por mayor para elaborar mayor cantidad de polos y cumplir con sus pedidos a tiempo.
texts.en:
Raymunda is a hard-working 51-year-old woman. She and her husband live in their own home with their three young children. Raymunda makes polo shirts for a living. At her dining room table, she traces patterns, cuts fabric pieces and sorts them. Raymunda does her best to cut every piece precisely, and then she takes them to her friend's shop, where they are sewn and finished. Her favourite part of her job is designing the shirts. She has been making shirts for two years; it's difficult work, and she doesn't have the right materials to continue doing it properly. In the future, she plans to buy a sewing machine and open her own clothing shop. This is her first MFP loan; she has agreed to make her payments on time, and considers it good for her business. Raymunda will use her loan to buy wholesale fabrics so that she can make more polo shirts and fill her orders on time.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fabric for making shirts.

loans.name: Ester Rosaura

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “MILAGROSA VIRGEN DEL CARMEN II”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. Ester,  ella tiene 28 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 10 meses de edad, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella vende frutas en el mercado de confraternidad, Nuestra socia compra al por mayor la fruta del paradero de Quillabamba y lo lleva al merado de confraternidad para venderlo al por menor. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar al por mayor la fruta.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the “MILAGROSA VIRGEN DEL CARMEN II” (Miraculous Virgin of Carmen II) communal bank. Our member lives in the Huanchac district in the Cusco province, Cusco department. Our member's name is Ester. She is 28 years old, lives with her partner and has 2 children aged 8 and 10 months. Our member divides her time between her household chores and her retail business. She sells fruit at the "Confraternidad" (Friendship) market. Our member buys fruit wholesale from the Quillabamba street market and takes it to the Confraternidad market where she sells it at retail prices. The member is asking for the loan to buy fruit wholesale. The member is grateful for and values the support given through these means and commits to fulfilling the payment terms of her debt.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member is asking for a loan to buy fruit at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en: Mr. Soeun S., 50 years old, is a villager who lives in Krang Touch village in Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Norn Phoeuk, are farmers who own 3 hectares of land to cultivate rice. In addition to farming, Mr. Soeun S. also drives a horse cart and owns a rice mill machine. These activities enable him to earn a small income to support his family. In order to increase his income and improve his family's living situation, Mr. Soeun S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Mr. Soeun S. and his wife have two children; one is a laborer while the other one is a student in the local school. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Cesar Alfonzo

texts.es:
Cesar Alfonzo A. C. tiene 34 años, y vive con su esposa y 2 hijos, Verónica y Paul, en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Cesar es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santiagopamba, que se encuentra en San Pablo, a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. La ventanilla esta compuesta por personas que en su mayoría se dedica a la agricultura, como fuente de ingresos de su familia. 

Cesar trabaja en la construcción y es agricultor. Lo que más siembra es el maíz, papas y arvejas. Hace las compras y ventas de sus productos a los comerciantes y en los mercados del Cantón, cada 3 meses. 

Solicita el préstamo para mejorar la calidad del producto, y aumentar mercadería en su negocio. Su sueño seria construir su casa y comprar terrenos. El desafío que enfrenta es mucha competencia en el negocio. 

Le gusta salir de paseo con su familia y las fiestas de los patrones como San Pedro y San Pablo.
texts.en:
Cesar Alfonzo A. C. is 34 and lives with his wife and 2 children, Veronica and Paul, in the San Miguel canton of the Bolivar province. Cesar is a member of the rural Santiagopamba group, located in San Pablo, a half an hour from the village of San Miguel. The majority of the group members work in agriculture as a source of income for their families. Cesar works in construction and is a farmer. His most common crops are corn, potatoes and peas. He buys and sells his products to traders and in the markets of his canton every 3 months. He is requesting this loan to improve the quality of his products and to increase the merchandise in his business. His dream is to build his home and buy land. The challenge facing him is a lot of competition in the business. He enjoys going for walks with his family and celebrating the festivals of the patron saints such as San Pedro and San Pablo.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Product quality improvement and increase of merchandise

loans.name: Women Of Progress Group

texts.en:
Marion W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'Women Of Progress'. She is 40 years old, married and has four children who range from 18 months to 10 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. She cares for one sibling. 

For 3 years, she has been selling bread and crushed rocks in ELWA Rock Hill Community on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 36,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of flour. She describes herself as jovial.

Her dream is to improve her business, build a shop and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more bags of flour

loans.name: Rebina

texts.en:
Rebina D. is from the village of Brgy.Lantap,Bagabag,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 30 years old. Rebina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rebina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding. Rebina has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rebina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rebina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia O. is a 59-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 3 business ventures: a TV & Refrigerator repair shop, Farming and a General Store business. She lives in T. Alonzo St., Poblacion, Madredijos, Cebu City. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her TV & Refrigerator repair shop, Farming and General Store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP5,000. 

Lydia is now borrowing PHP 23,000 so that she could use it to purchase additional materials for her business. This will be her 18th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Lydia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

Shown in photo: Lydia together with her husband in her shop. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for business.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is a single mother, raising her child by herself. She sells clothing at a bus station in the small town of Svalyava, western Ukraine. Silvia has been in this business for six years. This business is the only source of income for her family.

Silvia would like to borrow 11,000 hryvnia (UAH) to increase her assortment of inventory. She hopes to increase sales and make additional income. Silvia is a very active person and has the desire to develop her business further.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es: Abraham, de 22 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. El cultivo de la arveja, papa y maíz es la actividad a la que se dedica Abraham, todos los días desde muy temprano sale a trabajar a sus chacras, con el único fin de esforzarse mucho para que sus cultivos tengan muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus tierras de la plaga de insectos que afecta sus plantaciones. Con el tiempo, espera sembrar más y así tener una mejor producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro préstamo, en su banco comunal es un socio muy cumplido y activo. Con los seiscientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más semillas de arveja, para ampliar sus actuales sembríos.
texts.en:
Abraham is 22 years old, a simple, hard-working man. He lives with his parents, and his greatest desire is to get ahead in life. Abraham grows peas, potatoes, and corn, leaving the house early every day to work in his fields. His only goal is to strive so that his crops will be good. What he likes most about his job is caring for his land. He has done this work for 6 years, and finds that the hardest part is protecting his land from infestation by the insects attracted to his crops. In time, he hopes to sow more and thus have higher production. This is his first loan with MFP. He is aware that he must pay the installments punctually if he is to secure another loan. He is a responsible, active member of his communal bank. With the six hundred new soles he is requesting, he will buy seeds for peas, to add to what he has already sown.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pea seeds

loans.name: Sokinamo

texts.ru: Ширинова Сокинамо проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 42 года. Разведена, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном готовить разные блюда и продает. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 10 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения продуктов питания. Полученную прибыль она хочет вложить в другой бизнес.
texts.en:
Sokinamo S. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 42 years old, divorced, and has four children. She has a high school education. She works trading in the market. She prepares and sells different dishes. She has been doing this work for more than ten years. She is taking out a loan to buy foodstuffs. She wants to use this money for another business.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying foodstufs

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny B. is from the village of Northern Poblacion, Baliangao. She is 53 years old, married, and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Jenny makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately $35 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jenny joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients to make the products she sells.

Jenny is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for the business. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn I. is from the village of Mahayahay, Iligan City. She is 45 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Evelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop shere she sells canned food, snack food & daily-use products like shampoos and toothpaste. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Mahayahay, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Krong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Krong N. is a 30-year-old married woman and lives in Preaek Hour Kaeut village in Kandal province. She is the leader of this four-member group loan. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan for different purposes.

N. earns her living as a seamstress in a garment factory, while her husband, Mr. Long Khoeun, 38 years old, works as a security guard for a private company. This couple has two children, one who attends the local school and another who is three years old.

With the income from both of their occupations, they support their family. They have a old motorbike to take them to work, but now they want to buy a new one. Thus, N. would like to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Umoja Development Group-Jinja

texts.en: Francis O., 44 years old, belongs to the Umoja Development group-Jinja. For the last 5 years, Francis has been bringing hard work to bear in his poultry sales business in Jinja Metropolis. He says he began this business after retirement from his past job in a steel rolling company. Francis is happily married with 8 kids. He makes a monthly profit of 300,000 UGX. With this loan that he is requesting, he says he is going to buy more chickens and bags of millet. Additional proceeds will go towards paying fees for his kids.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens and bags of millet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 15 goats and 10 sheep

loans.name: Esperanza Violeta

texts.es:
Esperanza es una madre de familia de 52 años de edad que reside en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la región La Libertad, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de ocho años a la venta de verduras y tubérculos en una calle aledaña a uno de los mercados más importantes de la localidad. El negocio cuenta con bastante acogida ya que ella siempre trata de brindar productos frescos y un buen trato a sus clientes. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para colaborar con la economía de su familia.

Esperanza desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más verduras, de modo que pueda responder de mejor manera a la demanda de sus clientes. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a mother, she is 52 years old and she lives in the district of Chepen, an agricultural region which is much commercialized for being located in the region of La Libertad.  It is located more than one hour form the city of Chiclayo, the capital region of Lambayeque. 

For more than eight years she has been selling vegetables and tubers on a street along one of the biggest markets in the region. Her business counts on a solid client base because she always tries to provide fresh products and good client service. The income that she earns from her business helps her contribute towards the family's finances.

Esperanza wishes to expand her business with the purchase of more vegetables. She wishes to respond to client demands. To this end she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 soles.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and tubers for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 41-year-old married woman. She is from Lebanon, living with her husband and three young children who are attending school. She used to work with her husband who has owned a tailoring and clothing shop for the past ten years. Currently, she is the proud new owner of a gift and accessories shop which she opened in 2009. She is thankful for her new business income; it helps with the family’s finances. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additionA. products to serve her clients better by offering new items in order to expand her profit.

loans.use: to purchase additional products

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mariana, ella tiene 66 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos los mismos que son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es chofer profesional.

Ella tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo,  como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes,  además también productos de bazar, licores,  gaseosas y ciertos medicamentos.  Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su esposo le ayuda, los productos los  compra en Portoviejo aunque la mayoría de sus productos los recibe en su local. Nos cuenta que lleva con su tienda ya por 32 años y que en ella se entretiene mucho.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite,  licores, y otros productos.  Está en el Banco Comunal desde el principio y le gusta porque en las reuniones se divierte con sus compañeras del grupo. Sus sueños son tener una tienda mucho más grande y más surtida.
texts.en:
The members of the Banco Comunal Crucita meet in Crucita, a town in the canton of Portoviejo. This lovely place is known for the beautiful beaches that surround it, which receive a great number of tourists from Ecuador and beyond. It is known as "Beautiful Crucita."
Here we met Señora Mariana, who is 66 years old. She is married and she and her husband have two adult children, who are financially independent. Her husband works as a driver.
She has a grocery store where she sells rice, sugar, oils, and detergents, as well as sundries, liquors, soft drinks, and a number of medicines. She works every day from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. or even later. Her husband helps her by purchasing some goods in Portoviejo, although most of it is delivered directly to the store. She informs us that she's had her store for 32 years and enjoys it very much.
She will use this loan to stock her store, buying rice, sugar, oil, liquors, and other products. She is a founding member of the Banco Comunal and likes being a member because she has a good time at the meetings with the other members of the group. Her dream is to have a much larger store with a wider variety of merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, oil, liquors, etc.

loans.name: Eric

texts.es: Eric tiene 28 años, es casado y juntos viven en una casa alquilada. Desde hace 2 años realiza la venta de productos naturales para la salud, que pertenecen a una marca reconocida dentro del mercado, eso le permite asegurar sus ventas y captar más clientes. Se siente motivado de realizar este negocio, porque percibe buenas comisiones por cada venta que realiza, esto le hace crecer en su negocio. Para el futuro desea tener una gran distribuidora de productos naturales. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en medicinas naturales.
texts.en:
Eric is 28 years old, married, and they live in a rented house. Since 2 years ago, he has been selling natural health products of a brand recognized in the market. This permits him to be sure of sales and of gaining more customers. He feels motivated to succeed in this business because he receives good commissions on each sale he makes. This has allowed him to expand his business.

For the future, Eric wants to have a large distributorship for natural products. It's his 2nd loan with MFP, and he is very content to know that he has financial help. Also, he is pleased to be part of his communal bank because all the members are people he knows, who are responsible and feel much solidarity. In addition, he appreciates all those who help promote the loan he is requesting, since it will be very useful in the progress of his economic activity.
