The loan he is soliciting will be invested in purchasing more natural medicine merchandise.

loans.use: TO BUY MORE NATURAL MEDICINES TO SELL

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 44 years old and married with six children between the ages 2 and 20 years old. She has small, well organized shop with clean shoes. She employs two people in her business. It is open every day of the week from 6am until 6pm. She has two years' experience in her business.

Rachel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand her business and purchase more shoes to sell. With her profit, Rachel will build her house.

loans.use: To expand her business and purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
María A. empezó vendiendo frutas hace 10 años atrás luego fue incrementando poco a poco su tienda y la motivo la necesidad de un ingreso economico estable. En la actualidad vende en su tienda arroz, azúcar aceite. 

Trabaja con sus 2 hijos todos los días de 6am  a 10pm. Unas de sus inconvenientes es el dengue enfermedad estacional poca salubridad en el barrio. Con el préstamo va a comprar arroz, azúcar, abastos. Unas de sus metas es incrementar su negocio arreglar su casa y que sus hijos salgan adelante.
texts.en:
María A. started selling fruits 10 years ago and then expanded her store little by little. Her main motivation for doing this was her need for a stable income. She currently sells rice, sugar, oil, etc. in her store.

She works with her two children every day from 6am to 10pm. One of the problems is dengue fever, a seasonal disease, in the neighborhood. With the loan, she will buy rice, sugar, and supplies. Some of her goals are to expand her business, fix her house, and for her children to get ahead in life.

loans.use: Rice, sugar, supplies

loans.name: Maria Eduarda

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria M. se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de Golosinas, su negocio esta  ubicado en el Instituto Polivalente “UNION DE ORIENTE” 
Doña Maria tiene mucha experiencia en este tipo de negocio, en dicho centro de estudio para este año debido al crecimiento estudiantil han aperturado una nueva caseta para la venta de golosinas y se la han dado a ella para que la trabaje, pero doña Maria no cuenta con el capital de trabajo para surtir la cafeteria.
Maria elabora las comidas para los maestros (desayunos y almuerzos) mismos que le cancelan cada vez que reciben el sueldo.
el credito lo utilizara para surtir su cafeteria y asi poder cubrir las exigencias de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria M. is a merchant and her primary business activity is the sale of snacks. Her business is located in the "Union de Oriente" educational institution. 

Maria has a great deal of experience in this type of business. There has been a growth in the student population in the educational center this year so a new snack bar has been opened and they have given it to her to manage. But Maria doesn't have the financial resources to stock the store. 

Maria prepares foods for the teachers (breakfasts and lunches) who pay their tab each time they receive their pay. 

The loan will be used to stock her snack bar and to be able to meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare foods

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita G. is from the village of Tagulalo, Aurora Zamboanga Del sur. She is 60 years old. Jovita is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Jovita owns & operates a business selling flower plants in the local community. Jovita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 200, Jovita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jovita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new pots and a variety of flowers for sale. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Jovita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new pots, variety of flowers for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy items for the home and decorations for Mother's Day

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene  mucho tiempo de trabajar en este negocio, siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan. La ubicación de su negocio es en las afueras del mercado, con mucho esfuerzo ha obtenido este medio de vida al que asiste diariamente. Inicio porque no tenía un empleo que le generara ingresos diariamente, fue así que poco a poco ella fue aumentando su inventario. Es así que ahora ella solicita este crédito para la compra de bolsos, carteras, calzado, ropa en general, cosméticos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Maria Elena sells general merchandise.  She has been working in this business for a long time.  She is always alert to what her customers are requesting.  Her business is located on the outskirts of a market.  She started out in this business with a lot of effort and she now works in it every day.

Maria Elena set up her business because she didn't have a job that made her daily income.  She gradually increased her stock and is now requesting this loan to buy bags, purses, footwear, clothes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.use: to buy bags, purses, footwear, clothes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia G. is from the village of Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 56 years old, widowed and has 2 adult-aged children. Lilia owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing and food supplements, such as multivitamins, in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 11,000 PHP a month from it. Lilia appears in the photo with her grandson.

In 2008, Lilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional herbal or medicinal products. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Lilia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional herbal or medicinal products.

location.town: Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Tunu

texts.en:
Tunu is a married woman with three children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

Tunu has operated a business selling mahamri (dumplings) for the past 10 years, selling at the market and from home to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the loan of KSHS 10,000, she wants to purchase one sack of sugar and a bundle of wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase one sack of sugar and a bundle of wheat flour.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget is married to Mr. Shadrack and is the mother of two children both below the age of 15.  She shares one room with her children  She lives in Elemighong, one of the  quarters found in Belo Sub Division, North West Region, Cameroon.

Bridget has encountered a lot of difficulties in life, for example, difficulty in having three square meals a day. Ill health has also been one of her problems, She has been unable to have good medical treatment because she has no money. She joined GHAPE because she  had heard and seen a lot of people testify about GHAPE and she believes her life will not be the same if this loan is given to her . 

Bridget plans to buy a good quantity of castle oil(this is a medicinal oil used for the treatment of skin diseases and and also used as food). She is going to use the profit from the loan to increase her capital. Her community and family will benefit from the trade because she will provide them with castle oil at very low prices. Her activity will help reduce distance from members of her community and it will be available at all times. Bridget says “her children will all be well educated”.

She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow up, and also that GHAPE does not ask for collateral security, and the because of the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan. GHAPE takes care of the poor and repayment is gradual. 

About GHAPE 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy castle oil for resale.

loans.name: Pao

texts.en: Mrs. Pao, 39, is a married woman and the mother of four unmarried children. One of her children is employed at a garment factory as a sewing worker and has a fixed salary each month. To earn a living, Mrs. Pao owns a small store in her community, Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City, where there is a good location to raise income. In her shop, she sells different kinds of flowers to people who need to decorate for parties or ceremonies. Her husband, age 40, works in the construction field. This family normally earns an average of $6 per day to help cover their family’s daily living expenses. To meet the needs of her family, she is applying for a loan to purchase some piglets to feed and then sell when they are big.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 45 years old and married with two children, aged 15 and 30. She runs a general store in Lumley, near Freetown.

Marie has been in this business for ten years and sells food storage containers at her store. She also earns income from another business selling clothes, shirts, and dresses. She says that the main challenge to her business is during the rainy season when there is a low percentage of sales.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more domestic items. Marie says that the extra income from this loan will allow her to expand her business. In the future, she wants to offer different products to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more domestic items.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. She has a shop that sells vegetables like tomatoes and cabbages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy vegetables to sell. Antonieta has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: 6.2 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Miễn has a service business laying bricks. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to build and repair houses.

Miễn is 52 years old and married with three children. Miễn is the group leader of the 6.2 Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of four members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

In 2008, Miễn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Miễn has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for two years.

The main hardship that Miễn faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Miễn hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build and repair houses.

loans.name: Grace Divine (Irede) Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GRACE DIVINE (IREDE) est composé de trois personnes qui fréquentent la même église au Bénin. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ayabavi glady est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Ayabavi glady est âgée de 23 ans et vit au Bénin. Ayabavi glady est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Jean. Le couple n'a pas d'enfant. Ayabavi glady a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Ayabavi glady a appris le métier de coiffure. Ayabavi glady exerce cette activité passionnément depuis cinq ans. A côté de cette activité, Ayabavi glady vend des produits défrisants et des mêches. Ayabavi glady s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Ayabavi glady sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GRACE DIVINE (IREDE), un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The group GRACE DIVINE (IREDE) is comprised of three persons who attend the same church in Benin. This is the first time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé for elevating its level of business. The group’s representative, by the name of Ayabavi Glady, is the person with her hand raised in the photo. She is 23 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a retailer by the name of Jean, and they have no children. 

Ayabavi Glady did not have much schooling. To support herself [...], she learned the trade of hairdressing. She has been working with passion in this business for five years. Aside from this work, she sells hair straightening products and hair extensions. She gets her supplies in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her revenues, she and the other members of the group GRACE DIVINE (IREDE) are requesting an initial loan.

loans.use: to buy hair straightener products and hair extensions

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 26 and is the mother of two children. She is happy to manage her rice farming business and earns an average income of P30,000 per harvest. At present, Violeta is essentially mother and father of her children because her husband is working abroad as an Overseas Filipino Worker.
Violeta has difficulties financing her farm. That is why she is asking for a loan to pay for the services of farm laborers. She will utilize the loan wisely to help her husband support the family. 
In the future, Violeta wishes to make a profit from her farm. She plans to save some of it for a better future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for farm laborers

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 46-year-old married man and the father of three children. He opened his restaurant in 2009 but he has 15 years of experience in this field.
Fadi is a hard working man. He started his own business to improve his family's living conditions and to cover most of their requirements. 
Fadi is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to buy a new grill, a french fry cutter and a falafel pan as well as tools needed to improve his business.
This is his first time as an Al Majmoua borrower. He hopes this experience will have a positive effect in improving his career.
Fadi hopes to improve and expand his business more and more in the future. He faced the challenge of starting his own business and is working hard to succeed.

loans.use: To buy new tools and machines for his business

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor es socia del Banco Comunal Socos, tiene 46 años y 4 hijos, es socia D. FINCA Peru hace 3 años.
Leonor tiene un Molinera D. cereales, recuerda que con su primer crédito compró cereales, ahora con el préstamo que tiene también comprará mas cereales para moler, ahora su Molinera a crecido y esto es gracias a todo lo que pudo aprender en Finca y por el apoyo que le brindan, ella pudo hacer su casita, y educar a sus hijos, ahora su meta es poder agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Leonor is a member of the Communal Bank “Socos”. She is 46 years old and has four children. Leonor has been with FINCA Peru for three years.

She has a grain milling business. Leonor remembers that her first loan was used to buy grain. Now she will use this loan to also buy more grain for milling. Her business is currently growing as a result of everything she has learned from FINCA and the support it has provided. Leonor has been able to build her house and proviD. an education for her children. Now her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grain in bulk for milling.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 38 years old and married to a tricycle driver. The couple was blessed with three children, all attending school. Despite poverty, Rosemarie and her husband still find ways to improve their lives. Rosemarie's spouse provides motorcycle services to the people in their village. He has been operating the motorcycle for almost five years and earns a daily income of PHP 300. The profits earned provide for daily meals and allowances.

Rosemarie would like to improve the services rendered by her husband. Therefore, she is now asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy side mirrors, paint and a new pair of tires for the motorcycle. These accessories would help ensure the passengers' safety and help Rosemarie and her husband earn a good income. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money to continuously provide good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy side mirrors, paint and a new pair of tires

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a farmer in Kitale where she has been farming actively for 20 years. Her farm currently produces tea, milk, and coffee for the local market. She has one farmhand. She also runs a retail shop to supplement the farming income. She and her husband have three adult children.

Margaret has requested a loan in the amount of 63,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the loan will improve her farming income and improve her life. She notes that farmers in the area are faced with challenges when breeding for dairy cows since necessary services are very limited. Nevertheless, she aspires toward becoming the major supplier of milk in the area. 

She adds that Juhudi Kilimo loans are having a very positive impact on local farmers.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Vankan-Sekou Group

texts.fr: Le groupement VANKAN-SEKOU est formé de treize personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Chantal est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Chantal est âgée de 31 ans, et est mariée à un entrepreneur du nom de Raymond. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous à leur charge. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Chantal n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis une vingtaine d’année, Chantal vend des ustensiles de cuisine et des vêtements dans son quartier ; ce qui permet d’assurer ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Chantal  achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la première fois que Chantal et les autres membres du groupement VANKAN-SEKOU sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité et d'accroître leur fonds de roulement, afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The group VANKAN-SEKOU is comprised of thirteen persons who all live in the same district in Benin and who belong to the same revolving credit group. The group's representative, by the name of Chantal, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. Chantal is 31 years old and married to an entrepreneur by the name of Raymond. They have four children, all in their care. Some of the children are in school. 

Chantal did not attend school. For about twenty years, she has been selling kitchen utensils and clothing in her area; this enables her, along with her husband, to cover family expenses. She makes her purchases in Benin 

This is the first time that Chantal and the other members of the group VANKAN-SEKOU have requested a loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to bolster their business and to increase their working capital in order to respond further to customer demand.

loans.use: to buy clothing and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Carlos Efren

texts.es:
Carlos de 43 años, es maestro cerrajero empezó este negocio hace 10 años atrás ya que lo aprendió de un amigo y siguió adelante con sus esfuerzos.

Trabajo solo todos los días sin horarios fijos. Las dificultades de su negocio son las enfermedades que se dan debido al trabajo que realiza.

Está casado y tiene 3 hijos (3, 14, 17, 18 años). El prestamo lo quiere para comprar varillas, estructuras metálicas y latas de metal para su  cerrajería. Sus metas a alcanzar es seguir adelante en su negocio sin ningún problema para poder sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos, 43, is a master locksmith.  He learned the relevant skills from a friend and has owned his own business for 10 years now.

He works alone every day for as long as it takes to finish the work he has.  His biggest concern is the illnesses that are common to men and women in this line of work.

Carlos is married and has 3 children (3-, 14-, 17- and 18-years old).  He will use the loan to buy the supplies he needs for the business.  His goal is to continue operating the business and avoid any obstacles that might limit his ability to support his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his metal shop.

loans.name: Kamalaneh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Kamaleneh” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Lunsar, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 800,000.00 SLL for each member in the group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.
 
The leader of this group is Posseh. Posseh is aged thirty, she is married to a driver and the couple have two children. Posseh sell dishes, cups, plates, plastic bowls, etc. She has been doing business for eight years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy dishes, cups, plates, plastic bowls, etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Karimou

texts.fr: Karimou est âgé de 35 ans et vit au Bénin. Karimou est marié à une marchande du nom de Affisath. Karimou a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Le couple a cinq enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Karimou exerce depuis treize ans le métier de matelasserie et de tapisserie. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Karimou contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Karimou sollicite pour une deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement par Karimou a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Karimou is 35 years old and lives in Benin.  He is married to trader called Affisath.  Karimou stopped attending school at the secondary level.  The couple have five children, some of whom attend school and all of whom are in their care.  The children live together with their parents.  The couple cover their household expenses together.  In order to meet his needs and those of his children, Karimou has been working as an upholsterer for thirteen years.  Thanks to the income that he makes from this business, Karimou contributes towards his family expenses.  In order to satisfy the needs of his customers, whose numbers continue to grow, Karimou is requesting a second loan from ALIDé.  The previous loan he received was repaid correctly.

loans.use: to buy upholstery supplies (covers, leather and glue)

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Gemma has a shop that sells bananas and coconuts for copra. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

Gemma has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Ena Gladys

texts.es: Ena Gladys  de 56 años de edad, habita con su esposo  de 60 años y su hijo de 37 años en casa propia. La señora Ena   es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora. Hace algunos años se decidió en poner un pequeño negocio en su hogar de residencia. El negocio consiste en un salón de belleza  que con gran esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener a lo largo de varios años. Cuenta con mucha clientela ya que para Ena lo más importante son los clientes, siempre los atiende con una sonrisa y mucha amabilidad, razón por la cual se ha ganado la confianza de muchos en la zona y a demás porque siempre ofrece el mejor servicio a sus clientes. Ella  sueña con dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y sabe que la única forma de hacerlo es trabajando duramente en su negocio y esforzándose por hacer las cosas bien. El salón de belleza es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que ha decidido invertir en el,  de tal forma que pueda seguir dando los frutos que hasta el momento ha dado. Es por esta razón que se motivo en solicitar este crédito a INTEGRLAL para poder invertir en su negocio en la compra de: cosméticos, cremas, champú, desodorantes, tintes, tijeras y otros productos necesarios para mantener en marcha el negocio. Confía que de esta manera logrará cumplir su sueño.
texts.en: Ena Gladys, who is 56 years old, lives with her husband, who is 60, and their son, who is 37, in their own house. Señora Ena is an enterprising and hardworking woman. A few years ago she decided to set up a little business in her home. The business consists of a beauty salon, which, with great effort and dedication, she has managed to maintain throughout several years. She has many customers, since for Ena the most important thing is her customers. She always tends to them with a smile and great kindness, and this is the reason she has won the confidence of many people in her neighborhood, and in addition she always offers the best service to her customers. She dreams of giving her family a better quality of life and knows that the only way to do it is to work hard at her business and make the effort to do things well. The beauty salon is her principal source of income, so she has decided to invest in it in such a way that it can continue giving the income that it has given up to now. It is for this reason that she was motivated to apply for this loan at INTEGRAL so that she will be able to invest in her business by buying cosmetics, creams, shampoo, deodorants, dyes, scissors, and other products necessary to keep the business going. She trusts that in this way she will fulfill her dream.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, creams, shampoo, deodorants, dyes, and scissors.

loans.name: Jeco

texts.en:
Jeco is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Jeco has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for two years. He requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Jeco has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jeco hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school while the fifth has already graduated. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, Masika has operated a retail shop business, selling to town dwellers and passersby. Her major business challenge is delayed payments by creditors. Masika dreams of expanding her business to meet customer demand. 

Masika plans to use this KES 25,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat and maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat and maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Otilio's Group

texts.en: Otilio, Antonio and Gregorio live in El Paraíso in Santa María Tiltepec. Their main occupation is in the field where they cultivate corn and beans. Gregorio is 62 years old and provides for a family of 7.  In El Paraíso, they just got access to the electric grid in early 2012, however the service is extremely unreliable. They continue to rely on candles when the lights go out, which according to Otilio is an average of 3 days per month and 8 days in the rainy season, and in order for his family to work and study, they spend around 10 Mexican Pesos (0.8 USD) on candles every day. During this time, they run out of energy on their cell-phones and have no way of communicating with the nearby centers. With your loan they will have the security of having everyday lighting and energy for their mobile phones, ensuring an adequate place to work, study and spend quality time with their family.

loans.use: Gregorio and his two neighbors each purchase a solar home system to have reliable energy access for lighting and communication in their homes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane wants to buy extra textile materials

loans.name: Faiva

texts.en:
Faiva Iosefa is a married woman with two children. They live together in Tufuiopa. Faiva’s flea market business sells Samoan lavalavas, kava bowls, elei printing and small items like carved earrings and accessories. Weekly, she earns quite a lot of money, but she earns more during special occassions such as White Sunday, Mother's Day, Father's 
Day and the Christmas season.

loans.use: To purchase 10 rolls of material.

loans.name: Romelía

texts.en:
Romelia has a business selling fast foods, such as hamburgers, hot dogs, and French fries. It is located on a main street near her home. She began three years ago with her own savings. Her previous business was selling popcorn and corn all day. With her new business, she sells to customers between 6:00 PM and 10:00 PM every day of the week.

Romelia needs the loan in order to fix up another cart and to be able to expand her business. Demand has increased and her husband will be helping her. Also, she already has a place to put the new cart.

Romelia is 30 years old, has 2 children, and her husband helps her with her business. Her house is under construction and with the loan she is sure she will be able to continue improving it. In this way, she will give security and wellbeing to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Romelia tiene negocio de venta de comidas rápidas hamburguesas, hot dog y papitas fritas. Esta ubicado en vía principal cerca de su domicilio. Se inicio con su negocio desde hace 3 años con ahorros propios. Su negocio anterior era venta de palomitas de maíz todo el día. Con su nuevo negocio atiende a sus clientes en las tardes desde 6: PM a 22: PM todos los días de la semana.

Romelia necesita el crédito para poder adecuar otro carretón y poder expandir su negocio. Por que su demanda se ha incrementado y esposo la va atender. También cuenta con otro lugar donde poder ubicarlo.

Romelia tiene 30 años 2 hijos y esposo que la apoya con su negocio. Su casa esta en construcción y con el crédito ella esta segura que podrá seguir adecuándola y de esta manera dará seguridad y bienestar a su familia.

loans.use: To invest in another cart

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
Daisy Noelia J. V. is 26 years old, lives in Pelopincho, Asunción and is an active businesswoman. Starting in the early morning hours she works in her store receiving customers. At first, 7 years ago, the store belonged to her in-laws who transferred it to her so that she could run it and become more independent. Her husband works repairing milking machines. They have three children, 7, 3 and 1 year olds respectively, the eldest now entering his first years of school. They have projects and dreams and are ready to work hard day after day to strengthen their business so that her husband can stop working as a repairman and work with her in the store. They could then expand their business, improve their quality of life and afford better education for their children.

Their store is part of a group of microbusiness, CME Tecojoja, made up of 15 people who are mutually responsible for their loans. Daisy Noelia J. is asking for a loan of $100 to buy merchandise such as sugar, herbs, pasta, oil, flour, drinks, vegetables, fruits, meat and dairy products.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Daisy Noelia J. V., que vive en Pelopincho, Asunción, es una activa emprendedora de 26 años. Desde tempranas horas se dedica a atender su despensa recibiendo a los clientes. Inicialmente, hace 7 años, el negocio pertenecía a sus suegros, quienes les transfirieron para dedicarse a explotarlo e independizarse. Su marido trabaja como repartidor de lácteos en una empresa y tienen tres hijos, de 7, 3 y 1 año respectivamente, el primero ya cursando los primeros grados de la escuela. Tienen proyectos e ilusiones, están dispuestos a esforzarse día a día y fortalecer su negocio para que su marido pueda dejar de ser repartidor de lácteos y junto a ella dedicarse a la despensa y crecer día a día, mejorando su nivel de vida y ofrecerle a sus hijos una mejor educación.

El negocio forma parte de un grupo de microempresas CME “Tecojoja” integrada por 15 personas que responden solidariamente por un préstamo. La Sra. Daisy Noelia J. ha solicitado un préstamo de USD 100, para comprar mercaderías tales como azúcar, yerba, fideos, aceites, panificados, bebidas, verduras, frutas, carne y lácteos.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, herbs, noodles, oil, flour, drinks, vegetables, fruits, meat and dairy products.

loans.name: Oswaldo Melquíades

texts.es:
Oswaldo is a man who, from the time he was very young, loved working with cattle. When he was growing up, his parents taught him many values, but above all, those of perseverance and work. His affinity for working with cattle led him to have a barn with a good number of cows, from which he gets a considerable amount of milk everyday. He makes the milk into cheese, yogurt, butter, and other dairy products. His family helps him with sales and with caring for these generous cows because it is thanks to the income they generate that the family is able to satisfy its basic needs.

Oswaldo wants to improve the barn so that the cows can have a more comfortable place to live. In this way he can thank each one of them for the happiness they have provided his family for such a long time. For this reason, Oswaldo is requesting a loan of $100.00, which he is committed to repaying over a period of 6 months. Oswaldo and his family thank you for your generosity, which will allow them to complete this project.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Oswaldo, es un hombre que desde muy pequeño sintió mucho amor y apego al trabajo ganadero; en su hogar le inculcaron muchos valores pero sobre todo la perseverancia y trabajo. Actualmente esta inquietud por la actividad ganadera lo ha llevado a tener un establo con un buen número de vacas de las que obtiene todos los días una cantidad considerable de leche con el que puede fabricar queso, yogurt, mantequilla y demás derivados.Su familia lo ayuda con la venta y cuidado de sus generosas vaquitas ya que gracias a los réditos que generan pueden satisfacer sus necesidades más urgentes. El deseo de Oswaldo es mejorar el lugar que habitan para que puedan permanecer con comodidad; de esa manera podría agradecerles todas y cada una de las alegrías que han brindado a su familia durante mucho tiempo.Debido a este hecho es que Oswaldo solicita un préstamo de 100 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un período de 6 meses. Oswaldo y su familia agradecen tu generosidad para llevar a cabo este proyecto.

loans.use: To improve the barn where Oswaldo's cows live

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara has belonged to the Banco Comunal "Las Azucenas II" for one year now. Her home is located on 550 Jr. Los Naranjos in San Fernando in the Callería district in Ucayali. She is 47 years old, she has been separated for 5 years, and she is the mother of 3 children. When she got separated, she began to sell fruits at a market while she studied cosmetology. Presently, she has a hair salon where she works from 8 in the morning until 7 at night.

With the recent loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 1,000 nuevos soles (approximately $350), which will be paid back in 4 months, she will buy a mirror, 2 hair clippers, 3 display cabinets, shampoos, and conditioners.Clara feels excited and fulfilled because her business is going well and her clientele is increasing every day.<

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Clara pertenece desde hace un año al Banco Comunal “Las Azucenas II”, su vivienda está ubicada en el Jr. Los Naranjos 550, San Fernando del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali.

Tiene 47 años, está separada desde hace 5 años y es madre de 3 hijos, desde entonces empezó a vender en el mercado frutas y paralelamente estudió cosmetología.

En la actualidad cuenta con una peluquería donde ella atiende desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,000 (US$ 333.00 aprox.), el cual serà pagado en 4 meses, comprará un espejo, 2 máquinas peluqueras, 3 vitrinas y 4 liquidos.

La señora Clara se siente emocionada y realizada porque le va muy bien y su clientela esta aumentando cada día más.

loans.use: Implementation of equipment and purchase of supplies

loans.name: Sarvar

texts.en: Sarvar K. lives in Khujand; she is married and has 6 children. Based on the long time she has been in business, she recommends herself as a serious and executive person. She is very polite and honest with her clients, so they wish to co-operate tightly with her. Sarvar K. wants to realize new business ideas, and so now she requires a loan for business support and modernization.

loans.use: Business support

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en: Joyce, the Group Leader, is 37 years old. She is a widow with nine children. She has a poultry farm and a public pay phone. She intends to use the extra business profits to buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Isha

texts.en:
Isha N. is a trader who is involved in the production of food. Specifically, she uses corn to prepare a local meal known as "kenkey," which is extremely popular in her country. She is married and has 4 children. She works very hard to support her husband and to pay for her family’s expenses. Her business is doing very well, so she wants to increase her production to meet the demand of her customers.

Isha is seeking $500 of additional capital to enable her buy more corn to improve upon her "kenkey" production business.

loans.use: To purchase additional corn to improve her "kenkey" production business.

loans.name: Munakukama A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah K.. She is currently in the business of brick laying and is requesting a loan to add more capital. Sarah is 44 years old and is married with a husband who is a mansion builder for work. She has 8 children ranging from age 7 to 24 and her children go to school. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in her business.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Topista A., Alice N., Sarah N., and Nakato T.. Topista A. has a business selling fish and wants to increase the stock. Alice N. is currently operating a business selling maize and wants a loan to purchase more maize from the surrounding villages. Sarah N. operates a business selling tomatoes and wants to diversify to a fruit business. Nakato T. is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To expand brick business

loans.name: Sagn

texts.en: Mrs. Sagn K., 44, sells porridge and Chinese noodles in the Muoy Village in Banteay Meanchey Province. She earns about $10 per day. Her husband, Mr. Chhut Saroeung, 42, works for the CMAC organization and makes $7 per day. They have three children, all of whom are students. Mrs. K. seeks a $1,100 loan to purchase a motorcycle to make it easier for her husband to commute to work. She will also use the motorcycle to transport goods for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to make it easier for her husband to commute to work and to transport goods for her business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is forty three years old and the mother of two children. One of the children is currently in school. She has been selling ladies’ shoes, jewelry, and sewing materials from Togo. She wants to use her loan to buy more products in order to increase her inventory and to avoid price hikes in the products.

Betty is a member of the group called “Nyame wo Tum” (meaning "God has power"). Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more ladies shoes, jewelry, and sewing materials

loans.name: Filogenio

texts.es:
The business activity from which Mr. Rios makes a living is the breeding of livestock from his home in the municipality of Villanueva in the city of Chinandega. He started this business 25 years ago with a small number of livestock, but as his business has developed, he has acquired greater quantities of animals for their eventual sale and gain from their derivatives.

According to Mr. Rios, he works very hard so that he can maintain his three children and two grandchildren that are in his care. For that reason, he is looking for a way to facilitate their studies, and because there is no electric power in his neighborhood, he has requested the installation of a solar panel to obtain illumination so that his children and grandchildren study in the evenings without using an oil lamp, and so they have access to electricity to carry out household chores.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio al que se dedica el señor R. es a la crianza de ganado en su sector de habitación en el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega. Inicio este negocio desde hace 25 años con poco ganado pero a medida que ha venido desarrollándose ha adquirido mayores cantidades de ganado para su respectiva comercialización y aprovechamiento de sus derivados.

Según el señor R., trabaja muy fuerte para mantener a sus tres hijos y dos nietos a su cargo. Para ello busca la manera de cómo facilitarle los estudios y al no contar con energía eléctrica en su sector, ha solicitado la implementación de un panel solar para obtener la iluminación para que sus hijos y nietos estudien por las noches sin necesidad de candiles y a la vez para tener acceso a energía eléctrica para realizar las actividades del hogar.

loans.use: Purchase calves for his livestock breeding business.

loans.name: Pannha

texts.en:
Mr. Pannha A. (pictured with his mother), 21, was married early this year and lives with his mother. The family lives on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 
His wife is a garment factory worker.

Mr. Pannha has been a plaster decorator for two years, a skill he learned in Phnom Penh. His business is growing well, but he lacks some money to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of US$400 to purchase plaster materials for housing decoration, which will help him grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase plaster material for housing decoration

loans.name: Yusuph

texts.en: Yusuphy M. has been operating a business selling shoes at Vituka in Dar-es-salaam for one year now.  Purchasing his stock from a shopping center, he currently sells to customers around Vituka, but plans to eventually open a footwear shop in Karia-Koo in Dar-es-Salaam. This business provides essential support for his family; he is now requesting a loan of $350 to expand it.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Tuti

texts.en:
Tuti K. is 40 years old. She is married with 2 children. The need for an extra income was what pushed Tuti to start selling coats and jackets, seeing as her husband does not have a good income. Her primary concern is to be able to provide her children with the education they require to be able to have a future with dignified quality of life.

It has already been 15 years since she started her business, and thanks to the unconditional support of her own and the love of her family, she has been able to continue until now.

Tuti now requires a loan of 3400 Somoni (1000 USD) that will be used to purchase merchandise that her clients have asked for, as she does not have the needed capital to increase her selection. She plans to repay the full amount of her loan in 8 months. Don’t doubt it! Help Tuti to continue moving forward and help her dreams to become reality, to provide her children with the education they need. They will thank you forever.

loans.use: Purchasing autumn coats for women to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Novruz

texts.en: Novruz was born in 1973. He is married, has 2 children. This man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town. He is settled in the Fizuli region, Alkhanli village.  He has been in cattle breeding business for 5 years. Now he needs a loan of $750 to buy a calf for improving his cattle breeding business.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Shavkatjon

texts.en:
Shavkatjon is divorced and has two of his children living with him. He is a craftsman and makes national baskets out of twigs, and sieves and rolling-pins out of wood. He buys raw materials from vendors in other markets where they are less expensive. He then sells his products in the village markets where he lives. 

He wants to borrow money to purchase more raw materials so he can increase his inventory of sieves, rolling-pins and baskets. This will allow him to earn more money to support his family.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials and increase inventory of products for sale

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed A. K. is a young man, currently twenty years of age. When his father lost his job, Mohammed quit school to help provide for his family, thus ending his life long dream of getting a higher education. Instead, Mohammed opened a small cafeteria which supports his parents and his five younger brothers.

Mohammed is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy tables and chairs for his cafeteria as well as some additionA. cooking equipment. The new seating and improved cooking equipment will help him increase his income and provide a better standard of living for his family. He thanks all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs as well as some additional cooking equipment for his cafeteria business.

loans.name: Usmonkul

texts.en:
Usmonkul is 27 years old and he is a hard worker. He is single with no children. Usmonkul has been farming since he was a young boy, and now he specializes in the cultivation of wheat. He has 10 years of experience, and he has been able to support himself by learning how to care for and manage his crops in the short growing season. Usmonkul aspires to have more farming equipment and supplies so that he can work his land much more productively. Only due to lack of funds has he not been able to do so. So, he is asking for a loan to purchase more farming supplies, such as herbicides, fertilizers and other necessities, in order to appropriately manage his crops and in the end make a profit. This request is in support of making his dream come true, and Usmonkul appreciates your generous help.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Quba

texts.en: Quba A. is a devoted mother that struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Ten years ago, she got the idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available in their land for this business. She is engaged in this business together with her husband for more than 12 years. Slowly, the number of cows increased and her clients started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan. Be an important part of the growth of Quba's business.

loans.use: purchase two  calves

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal. Veronica is 39 years old and divorced. She has four children and all her children go to school. She is requesting a loan to expand the business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business selling charcoal.

loans.name: Naziran M. Habib Group

texts.en:
Naziran baji is a 55-year-old married woman who has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 35 years. Her husband, M. H., works in a factory. Naziran baji is the mother of three sons. Her eldest son has a dairy business. The next son sells jackets. Her younger son works in a clinic. 

Naziran baji belongs to a family of farmers. For this reason, she helps her son by getting milk from the buffalo in her old age. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for her milk-selling business.

She is a the leader of a group of women in her locality. Sajida baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Naseem Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Hafizan baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell. Razia Begum baji wants a loan to buy utensils to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her milk-selling business

loans.name: Luvsanpurev

texts.en:
Luvsanpurev P. lives with his mother and two younger brothers in Arhangay, one of Mongolia's southern provinces. Although he is married, he has been living apart from his spouse. 

In 2006, he began to make wooden home furniture and to paint the decorative wood beams of "gers" (a "ger" or yurt is a form of traditional, nomadic Mongolian housing). He gets paid 100,000 MNT for painting all the beams for one ger. When he began to run his furniture business, his business capital was 300,000 MNT. Now it has increased to 500,000 MNT. Also, he now has his own workshop next to his home. 

Luvsanpurev is very good at attracting clients. He really believes in himself. In the future, he thinks he will have a bigger workplace and will attract clients from other provinces. With this loan, he will buy paint, brushes and decorative stencils for his business.

loans.use: To buy paint, brushes and decorative stencils

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en:
Huyền Nguyễn Thị was born in 1984. She lives at Lễ Pháp village – Tiên Dương commune – Đông Anh district- Hà Nội city.

This is her first microfinance loan. She wants to borrow 2.204.000 VND to buy some pigs. She also grows vegetables and sells in the market. Her husband works in construction and his salary helps her pay expenses for their family.

loans.use: Buy some pigs.

loans.name: Kodjo Mawuli

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est marié avec une dame qui est opératrice de saisie, il est père de 02 enfants. Pour pouvoir subvenir aux charges de sa famille, il a commencé en 2008 la vente de produits d’alimentation générale. Il attire beaucoup de personnes par sa manière d’accueillir. Il veut agrandir son commerce et réaliser plus de profit pour pouvoir subvenir aux charges de sa famille. Pour réaliser cela il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 8 bidons d’huile, 100 sacs de riz, 02 cartons de savons, 02 cartons de macaroni, un carton de lait et des cartes de recharges
texts.en:
This gentleman is married to a lady who does data entry. He is the father of two children. To be able to provide for his family, he started selling grocery items in 2008. He draws in a lot of people by his accommodating manner. He wants to expand his business and to realize more profit in order to provide for his family. To do so, he's requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy eight drums of oil, 100 sacks of rice, two boxes of soap, two boxes of macaroni, a box of milk, and some mobile phone recharge cards.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
La señora Adelaida es socia del Banco Comunal “Yunga Uyo” en  Distrito de Yunguyo, la  provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, estado civil  conviviente 03 hijos, Vive en el Barrio Santa Bárbara,  y estudio hasta 3ro de primaria. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 8 años, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de ropa, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/ 1700,00 nuevos soles, este préstamo le servirá para comprar ropa por docenas, además aumentara capital para su negocio de venta de helados y yogurt.
Le gustaría formar una pequeña empresa distribuidora.

Adelaida, nos cuenta que le gustan mucho las reuniones y los ahorros y las charlas que Manuela Ramos imparte
texts.en:
Adelaida belongs to “Yunga Uyo” communal bank, in the district Yunguyo, province Chucuito, department Puno. She is 33 years old, lives with her partner, and has 03 children. She lives in Barrio Santa Bárbara, and completed studies through 3rd grade. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 8 years. She buys and sells clothing. Her first loan was for S/ 300.00. Now she would like an additional loan of S/ 1700,00, which will allow her to buy clothing by the dozen, and also to increase capital for her business selling ice cream and yogurt. She would like to become a small wholesaler. Adelaida tells us that she really likes the meetings, savings, and the chats she has with Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing clothing and ingrediants for making ice cream and yogurt

loans.name: Ouyètiè 1 (On Se Connais). Group

texts.fr:
Ouyètiè 1 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Nitabogoro de la ville de Koutiala région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans et au moins 6 enfants.
Elles font plusieurs cultures mais se sont spécialisée dans celle de l’arachide.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe Ouyètiè 1 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de Koutiala ville. 
Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Koutiala et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Ouyètiè 1 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 65 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Ouyètiè 1 is a group of married women who live in the Nitabogoro neighborhood in the city of Koutiala (Sikasso Region, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in large extended traditional families with their children, husbands, in-laws, etc. They average 30 years of age, and have at least 6 children. They cultivate various crops, but specialize in peanuts. Eager to make their cultures profitable, the members of the group Ouyètiè 1 decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, two years ago. After having repaid the first loan without problem, they are now seeking their second farming loan.

The new loan will be used to buy, at the grand market in Koutiala, a sufficient quantity of peanuts seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields. After the rainy season, crops are stored for a while to gain market value, before being sold at the grand market in Koutiala and in the surrounding villages, retail (often wholesale) and for cash, to a clientele usually coming from the larger cities.

After selling their production, the members of the group Ouyètiè 1 count on turning a profit of XOF 65'000 (ca US$ 140) each, to be used to repay the loan and to pay for the daily expenses of the family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanuts seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields

loans.name: Moru

texts.en:
Moru B. is a butcher who sells fresh meat at Abotoase near Hohoe. Moru has received no formal education. He is married and has six dependents.

Moru has been selling fresh meat for quite a while. He is responsible for looking after six children and other family expenses. His loan will be used to buy more cows, goats and sheep for slaughter and resale. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more cows, goats and sheep for slaughter and resale

loans.name: Tofiq

texts.en: Tofiq M. has always been a hard-working man. He made sure from a young age that his family never went without their daily bread. He is married with four sons. Tofiq has a store where he sells different kinds of goods, such as cosmetics and home products. Thanks to his perseverance and dedication, Tofiq began his enterprise 8 years ago, with a starting capital of 100 USD. His salary as a accountant wasn’t enough to cover basic needs of his family. Since then he has expanded his business and it has become a family affair, with his whole family helping. Tofiq needs to buy more goods to increase the range of his inventory, so he is requesting a loan of 2000 USD. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push to achieve his goals and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: purchase more home products

loans.name: Eleseo

texts.en: Eleseo P., age 36, is a fisherman in Talibon, Bohol. He is starting to save money from his earnings, because he decided to get married early this year. He needs to repair his boat and buy fishing materials to carry on his fish-selling business. Since he knows well how to fish, he has good earnings which he shares with his parents and siblings. Eleseo actively participates in the CEVI cluster meeting which is held every week. CEVI provides its clients not just with loans, but with education as well, to help their small businesses grow.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials and for boat repair

loans.name: La Alternativa 3 Group

texts.en:
Teresa A. (second from left) is a hardworking mother of three who sells used clothing to make a living. She sells what is called “ropa de paca," which is pre-made bundles of used clothing from the United States and other countries, organized into bags such as men’s clothing, women’s clothing and bedsheets. Juana travels to cities up to five hours away from her home in Samaná to purchase the clothing she sells to those in her neighborhood.

Teresa works from her home, where she lives with her husband and three children, ages 14, 10 and 4. Her customers drop by with orders and requests, and Teresa happily finds the necessary clothing when she purchases inventory. Currently on her eighth loan with Esperanza International, Teresa has proven to be a determined and responsible businesswoman. Recognizing the oversaturation of some other types of businesses, she decided to enter into clothing sales, where she has found sales to be brisk.

Many of Teresa’s profits go to feeding her children. With five people living at home, her husband’s salary as a boat driver is not sufficient to provide everything necessary for the family. Now, with Teresa augmenting the family’s income, all are comfortably fed and clothed.

In the future, Teresa dreams of having her own store from which she can sell her clothing and other goods. As well, when her children reach college age, she hopes to support their education at a local university.

Thank you for your Kiva loan to Teresa and the other members of her group!

loans.use: New packs of men's, women's and children's clothing

loans.name: Miraji

texts.en: Miraji S. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. He runs a food shop and a hardware shop in the Ilala ward in Dar es Salaam. He purchases some food products directly from the producers on a wholesale basis and others from the Kariakoo city market. He sells a variety of food products in his shop, including wheat flour, maize flour, beans, ground nuts, sugar and cooking oil. His wife is fully engaged in running the hardware shop while he runs the food shop.  Business income is used to meet the family's daily demands and for business capitalization. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to top up the business.

loans.use: To extend the business

loans.name: Las Lucecitas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Lucecitas esta formado por un grupo de siete socias que desean superarse y llegar a tener mejores oportunidades en la vida, en su mayoría las socias pertenecen al barrio de Narancay  de la parroquia Baños en la ciudad de Cuenca, Baños es reconocida por sus aguas termales que son emanadas del volcán, siendo sus fiestas todo el mes de Enero con varias actividades como danzas, presentación de artistas y festivales del timbulo(dulce embuelto en hoja de maiz) y gastronómicos etc., pocos de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura , por que en su mayor parte se dedican al comercio por la gran cantidad de turistas que van a conocer ese bello lugar. Sus socias con la amabilidad que les caracterizan nos cuentan sus testimonios.

La señora María Natividad P. T. es socia del bankito Las Lucecitas, vive en Narancay  a unos 15 minutos a las fueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada concibiendo en su unión matrimonial 5 hijos de 18, 16, 14, 12, 1 año de edad, todos sus hijos estudian en el Colegio Técnico Manuel Córdova Galarza de su parroquia, viven en casa propia fruto del esfuerzo conyugal, su esposo es carpintero, siendo el mejor ejemplo para sus hijos y el mejor compañero en la vida.

María trabaja en la agricultura y crianza de animales como pollos, cuyes, chanchos,  hace ya diez  años, lo de la agricultura en su mayor parte es solo para el consumo en su hogar y un poco vende en la feria libre de Cuenca, los pollos vende en pie o pelados por a sus conocidas que  le compran en su casa,  también vende en las tiendas de su sector.

 Es su tercer ciclo junto a la fundación y, se encuentra agradecida por que le han ayudado a estabilizarse económicamente, nos cuenta que antes pedía plata a los chulqueros y tenía que pagar intereses muy altos.

Con el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le otorga va a  comprar más pollos, cuyes, chanchos, alimento y vitaminas para su crianza y seguir incrementando en el negocio.

Su meta es  llegar a comprarse un carro para incrementar  sus ventas y llegar  a más clientes.

La señora María Cristina Mejía P. es una nueva integrante del Banco Comunal Las Estrellitas su  suegra es socia del banco comunal y la invito para que forme parte del mismo. Vive en la comunidad  Guzho a unos 15 minutos a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 23 años de edad se encuentra casada hace 5 años concibió dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad, su esposo es chofer de transporte público.

María esta iniciando con el negocio de criadero de pollos nos cuenta que no es muy complicado por que solo hay que estar pendiente que el alimento y el agua no les falten y que se encuentren en un lugar abrigado para que no se mueran para obtener las ganancias deseadas.

Es su primer crédito en la FUNDACION ESPOIR y espera seguir realizando más créditos para mejorar su calidad vida y de su familia, con el préstamo que obtenido va a comprar más pollos, alimento y vitaminas, así  también una parte lo va a utilizar para la terminación de su casa.

La meta de María es  terminar su casa con los préstamos que la Fundación le otorgue.

La señora Sindy Gissela Morán C. es otra socia activa del Banco Comunal las Lucecitas, ella vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 18 años de edad es casada y aun no tiene hijos, tiene una  sólida  relación matrimonial,  nos cuenta que para tener una relación consistente se debe ser amigos ante todo y tener un excelente dialogo y después esposos; su esposo es electricista y  viven arrendando y desean mejorar su situación económica.

Sindy es comerciante de calzado,  hace un año se inició en esta actividad y le va muy bien por que tiene calzado de calidad y un buen surtido;  es comerciante informal por lo que recorre a diario la feria libre en Cuenca  su horario de trabajo  es de 8 a.m. a 6 p.m. y los fines va a las ferias de el Sigsig, Azogues, Paute siendo su horario de 5 a.m. a 6 p.m.

Es su primer crédito, una amiga le incentivó con los beneficios que la Fundación ofrece para que sea parte del banco comunal.

Con el préstamo solicitado va a comprar más mercadería y así tener un stock  surtido de calzado para damas, caballeros y niños.

Su sueño es tener un puesto propio y no tener que salir a recorrer la ciudad.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Lucecitas is made up of 7 members, who want to better themselves and have better opportunities in life. The majority of the members are from the neighborhood of Narancay from the Baños parish in the City of Cuenca. Baños is known for its hot springs that emanate from a volcano. There are festivals throughout the month of January with several activities such as dances and artist showcases and festivals featuring timbulo (a sweet tamale wrapped in corn leaf) and other foods. Few of the inhabitants work in agriculture because, for the most part, they work serving the large quantity of tourists who come to get to know this beautiful place. The members tell their stories with characteristic friendliness. Señora María Natividad P. T. is a member of the Las Lucecitas bank. She lives in Narancay, some 15 minutes outside the City of Cuenca. She is 39 years old, married, and has 5 children, aged 18, 16, 14, 12, 1. Her older children study in the Manuel Córdova Galarza Technical College located in her parish. She and her family live in their own home, the fruits of the efforts of Señora María and her spouse. Her husband is a carpenter, and he is the best life partner, as well as the best example for their children. For 10 years María has worked in agriculture, raising chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs. The family consumes the majority of her output, and she sells a small amount in the free market in Cuenca, also selling chickens on foot, or plucked to acquaintances who buy in the house; she also sells them in the stores in her area. This is her third loan cycle with the foundation and she is grateful because they have helped stabilize her economically because before she had to borrow from informal lenders at very high rates of interest. With the loan that the ESPOIR foundation is granting her, she will buy more chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, animal food and vitamins to continue to grow her business. Her goal is to eventually buy a car in order to increase her sales and collect more customers. Señora María Cristina Mejía P. is a new member of the communal bank. Her mother-in-law is a member of the bank and invited her to become a member. She lives in the community of Guzho, some 15 minutes outside the City of Cuenca. She is 23 years old, has been married for 5 years, and has two children: a 4-year old and a 2-year old. Her husband is a driver in public transportation. Maria is starting with the business of raising chickens. She tells us that it is not too complicated, to obtain the desired earnings you just have to be attentive so that the animals do not lack food or water and have adequate shelter so that they do not die. This is her first credit with the ESPOIR foundation and she hopes to continue to take out loans so that she can improve her quality of life and that of her family. With this loan she will purchase more chickens, animal food and vitamins, and also she will use a part of the loan to finish her house. The goal of Maria is to finish her house with the loans that the foundation grants. Señora Sindy Gissela Morán C. is another active member of the communal bank Las Lucecitas. She lives in the City of Cuenca, is eighteen years old, and is married. Although she has no children, she has a solid matrimonial relationship, telling us that in order to have a consistent relationship one must be friends above all and have excellent communication. Her husband is an electrician and they live in a rented home and would like to improve their economic situation. Sindy sells shoes, she has been involved in this activity for a year and it's going very well because she has a good supply of good quality shoes. She is an informal trader in the Cuenca free market, which runs daily. She works from 8am to 6pm and on weekends goes to the markets in Sigsig, Azogues, and Paute where she works from 5 a.m. to 6 p.m. This is her first loan, a friend convinced her to become part of the bank by telling her about the advantages that the foundation offers. With the loan she is requesting she will buy more merchandise and this way will have an increased inventory of shoes for women, men and children. Her dream is to have her own stall, so that she would not have to travel around the city to sell her goods.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, animal feed and vitamins, as well as merchandise in order to increase their businesses

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is already 30 years old and is married to Domingo T.. The couple is blessed with two children who were Anabelle - 10 years old and Kenette-7 years old, both of them are currently studying in the primary level of education in their place. The family simply lives in the village of Gomez San Isidro, Isabela of where, rice is their common produce products. 

Rosita manages a direct selling business of AVON. The business has become her way in helping her husband to earn income for their children education and their common necessities. According to her, she wanted to have added capital so that her business will grow further. In this regard, she is requesting the amount of PHP5, 000 from Kiva lenders. She knows this will be of big help in the maintenance and success of her direct selling. 

Rosita further said that, the success of her business is a big benefits to her children that is why, she is determined and tries hard towards her business development.

loans.use: Additional business capital for her personal product sales

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 39 years old and married with four children. She has been a farmer for six years, and is requesting a loan of 30,000 NGN to purchase more seedlings to plant and cultivate on her farmland. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings

loans.name: Fozia Soria Group

texts.en:
This is Fozia Soria group, which includes four members. Soria is the group leader and has a bead working business in her house. She has run this business since the Taliban regime, when all women were confined to the home and there were no jobs and schools for them. Now, using the loan, she wants to buy more materials for her business to bring a change and progress to it. Soria wants to take out a loan to buy all the needed material which she needs for her business. She hopes that she will have a good business and high monthly income to support all of her family members.

Shafiqa wants a loan to use for her embroidery work. She mostly designs the national clothes that we call Afghani clothes.
Khanm G. wants to take out a loan for her husband who has a second hand clothes selling business. Khanm G.’s husband is a hard working man and through his shop’s income supports his family members.
Fozia wants to take out a loan for her husband who has a metal shop. Fozia’s husband is a hard working man and tries to have a comfortable life and educated children, and through the loan Fozia’s husband wants to expand his business and buy some essential tools which can make his work easier.

They have requested a group of loan 40000 Afghani. They are very happy with this global loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Pho

texts.en:
Pho P., 27, is a low-income woman who resides in a rural area of Kampong Chhnang province. She now has two kids, who are dependent on her care.

Pho P. sells fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing. She earns $3 per day.

Pho P. is taking out her loan to repair her broken motorcycle that affects her ability to earn income.

loans.use: To repair her motorcycle that affects her ability to earn income.

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en:
A. Sarantuya is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three sons in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. Her middle son currently attends university and her youngest attends a local secondary school. She and her family live in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a "ger". Sarantuya operates a shoe-making business in her town with the help of her husband. She started her business in 1990 and has built a stable and successful business over the years. She is a very motivated businesswoman and works hard to support her family and her community. In 2008 she was named "Volunteer Leader of the Year" in her community by the local branch of World Vision, an international development organization, for making shoes for handicapped children. Sarantuya hopes to continue her success in the future and says, "My business enables me to provide for my children's education and improve their quality of life." She is requesting a 300,000 tugrug loan to purchase materials used in making shoes. About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.
To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.
To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase materials used in making shoes

loans.name: Suyum

texts.en: Suyum K. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and five children. He is a farmer dedicated to studying the land and to the cultivation of different crops.
